description:
The review about the someone had a hard time parking and didn't like Clement street is hilarious. Why do people go on Yelp and critiqiue businesses for random things out of their control? You sound silly. 

Anyway, these burritos are always consistent and tasty and fairly priced for SF. A staple for me.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Ordered a bean and cheese burrito. 

received a rice burrito with a few beans a little bit of cheese. 

burrito failure.
author: Adrian M.

description:
When I have no idea what I want for lunch, this place is always a solid go-to because it's quick and easy. They offer a good assortment of meat and tortilla choices.

My typically order is a Super Burrito, with black beans, pico de Gallo, sour cream, jalapeños , and their green hot sauce. The flavor is pretty standard but it can get wet if they don't drain the meat. Almost $10 w/add ons.

I would give a better review if the assembly line constructed a better burrito. The portion size varies almost every time and the extras you pay for (sour cream & guac) typically get dolloped on but not spread out evenly. So one portion of the burrito can have the sour cream, while the other half will have the guac. 

Occasionally I'll get the tacos but they are a bit overpriced, almost $5 per  w/add ons. Tasty but not a good value 

Regardless, I'll continue to come back because of proximity to work. But not something I'd go out of my way for.
author: Paolo B.

description:
The food was.... Not bad.   It was definitely not good either though. I'm halfway through my burrito (and the lady gal already finished hers) and I can definitely say that it tastes like gravy train dog food. Yes..  I have two dogs and have tried it just to make sure its okay. That's not too bad of a knock on them because canned dog food is made to taste like beef and its not all that bad. I'll probably go here again because its cheap,  but the food doesn't taste that great. 

Btw.... The salsa\pico is some of the best I've ever had. Period. Props to whoever made it!
author: Quentin L.

description:
Gordo Taqueria (1 of 2 ) is located on the corner of Clement and 24th. 

They have an assembly line set-up and the crew working seemed pretty jovial. I especially liked the one non-hispanic guy (perhaps he's Latino) who greeted me with "todo bien caballero". 

Unfortunately however, the Carnitas taco I had was not very good and falls at the bottom of my taco rankings. It was pretty dry and not very flavorful. No cilantro or onions toppings, The burrito's looked like a better option and for the taco's I believe they only had two meat options Carnitas or Chicken so it seems like Taco's are not their "thing" despite having " Taqueria " in their namesake. 

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck
7 Taqueria Los Mayas 
8 Garaje
9 Taqueria Vallarta
10 Little Taqueria
11 La Taqueria
12 Taqueria Castillo
13 El Farolito
14 Pancho Villa Taqueria 
15 Taqueria el Buen Sabor
16 Panuchos
17 Taqueria Gudalajara
18 La Palma Mexicatessen
19 El Tonayense
20 Tropisueno
21 La Espiga de Oro
22 Papito Hayes
23 Tacos San Buena
24 Los Compadres Taco Truck
25 Cochinita Mayan Cuisine
26 El Taco Loco
27 Gordo Taqueria
28 Nick's Crispy Tacos

Below is my top 10 for the Bay Area in case you were curious.
1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 El Jaliciense
3 Taqueria Sinaloa
4 Garajito
5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme
9 El Norteno Taco Truck
10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description: Eat here if you want a tiny quesadilla and the workers talking smack about you because they assume you don't understand any Spanish.
author: Tyler B.

description: Gordo's is a small taqueria on Clement yummy super burritos and tacos. Usually a line forms around lunch time but they work quick to get you in and out. They also make your food right in front of you so you can adjust the amounts of everything they are putting in. Most of the time I come to order 2 chicken tacos to go. It is delicious, quick and cheap, about $4 a taco and you got it stuffed with chicken, beans, rice, tomatoes and hot sauce. You can pay extra to get guacamole and sour cream. One of my colleagues went to Tommy's Mexican resturant nearby and ordered 2 chicken tacos they came to $20!!! They are $10 each so I told him about Gordos and he comes here to get 2 tacos for $8 and he says that the quality is much more tastier and more bang for your buck! Super good and must try.
author: Annie L.

description:
Utter disappointment. I've been to the sunset loc many times with great success. This spot just ensured no return visits.

1. The Meat - the bottom line. The carnitas were (was?) dry. SO DRY. Couldn't even chew it, had to spit it out DRY.

2. Awkward ordering flow. I literally had to ask for every individual ingredient. And why are you putting rice n beans in quesadillas? That's what burritos are.

There's a Taco Bell on Geary. Your $10 is better spent there.
author: Ross H.

description: I have not been around this neighborhood . found this place on Yelp and drove here around 940 pm on Monday. The Neighborhood Is super dark, and there are bags of trash left at the curb. My parking experience wasn't pleasant due to the environment. Also, the restaurant was hard to find or it could be closed that day while it says open on Yelp. I eventually could not find the restaurant with such minimal lighting & left for another place.
author: Jess W.

description:
This one seems to be better than he one on 9th. Why? I have no idea. Seems funny that it is so close to the one on Geary, but I figure they have their reasons. 

Generally though Gordo taqueria is a good call. They fill their burritos up real full (no going home hungry) and their meats are tasty. The grilled chicken is surprisingly good for chicken. My husband says the carnitas are the best, and the carne asada I had a couple nights ago was spot on.

They steam their tortillas which makes them very soft and so they don't break.  Heavy on meat, rice, beans - not on salsa, but the sour cream and guacamole are healthy amounts if you get them. 

I suppose they sell things other than burritos - but not that much - pretty sure you are just supposed to get a burrito.

Cons: no chips and salsa included.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Decent food that's on the small portion side. Small interior so seating might be an issue during peak lunch hours. 

Parking is almost impossible in the area day or night. And if you are able to find a parking spot during the daytime don't forget to keel those meters fed. SF makes a killing of unpaid parking meters.
author: Benny L.

description:
Applies to Clement St. & 9th Ave. locations:

Their steak is dry and tastes like it's been sitting for days, with a weird jerky-like aftertaste. I'd avoid it at all cost. The carnitas are better, but just average. Chicken options are all pretty forgettable. The only redeeming item on their menu is the Spicy Pico de Gallo. It rocks because it's actually spicy with generous chunks of peppers! (Is there anything sadder than mild pico?) But the quality of it (spice level) is so inconsistent you have to get lucky to get the memorable version. Sometimes you'll get batches where they skimp or short arm the pepper density. They even once used blended peppers which was strange. Bad quality control here for sure. Again, you have to get lucky. 

Also note: If you order this place for delivery through Postmates or DoorDash, they are REALLY bad at order accuracy. Order the Spicy Pico de Gallo (really the only thing worth ordering here) and there's a 50/50 chance you get the sad arse mild version. 3-stars only when they manage to not screw up your order for Spicy Pico. Otherwise 1-star for the rest of the menu and for zero quality control.
author: Rob D.

description:
Eh. Just Eh. 

Pros: cheap. filling. fast. 
Cons: completely flavorless. no chips included!

I am used to carne asada burritos that are bursting with flavor, coming from both the beef and the rice. The burrito I got really didn't have any of that. It was very bland. Granted it was quick and filled me up for lunch and dinner, it wasn't necessarily that good. If you want a quick cheap burrito that will fill you up for hours this is a good spot. Personally I probably won't be coming back though.
author: Michael P.

description:
I randomly stumbled upon this tiny taco place because I noticed a line had formed out the door. My sister and I were looking for a place to get lunch, and it looked promising. The place is extremely small. There are limited number of seats indoor against the walls. Where the seats are and the line forms are on the same side which might make eating inside awkward.

Service: One person takes your order, the next fills your taco/burrito/etc, and the last person rings up your order. They had their work flow down pat. However, because they were so efficient when completing the order and with the line, I felt rushed. 

Food: I got a regular size Beef Burrito.  They give large portions of whatever filling you request making the burrito very large. I didn't think that the burrito would keep its shape because of the way they folded the burrito. However, I was pleasantly surprised when I opened it back home. The burrito kept its shape for the rest of the meal. Aside from the large portions, I didn't find it anything exciting or new. Just another good 'ole burrito. They do have options for spinach or wheat tortilla.

My sister ordered a taco and a quesadilla. In my opinion, she pretty much ordered 2 tacos but one had a slice of cheese that they grilled on. So you're really not missing out on much if you don't get the quesadilla.

I had high expectations for this place, but in the end, it was just a burrito. I would recommend it if you need something quick to grab to eat on the way. However, if that's the case, do not get the tacos because those are A LOT messier to eat. Burrito would be the safer option.
author: Helen H.

description:
I have to admit - there are probably lots of places that offer better food than Gordo Taqueria. The burritos don't offer much in the way of rich flavor or texture, but there are good reasons why Gordo's is such a favorite. (Count on lines for lunch or dinner.)

The big plus is consistency. Gordo's offers tasty burritos every time, and I've never, ever been disappointed. Other places offer lots of sauces, with sloppy burritos that can amaze; Gordo's offers a limited set of meats and fillings, and you'd be surprised how consistency can be so comforting.
author: Thirsty C.

description: This place was SO good. Thanks to Yelp for the advice. My husband and I were starving after a long (and hilly) bike ride and we stopped there for a late lunch. The burritos we had were absolutely excellent, the guac super good too (although a very small portion). Small tiny place with 3 counter seats or so. Very good food.
author: Jessica S.

description: Yummy! I tried the steak quesadilla and added everything to it but got rice on the side. They put in so much steak!! I wish they added more pico and guac but I should've asked. Overall, it was awesome and a super satisfying meal. My dad and sister got the steak burrito and the crispy chicken taco respectively and they were both satisfied. We also got a side of chips and pico de gallo. The total was $30 for all those - so pretty standard for some good Mexican food. This place definitely hit the spot and is on a nice place in Richmond. The seating area made me feel like it was a little dirty - but other than that I really enjoyed the food.
author: Anna L.

description:
Been coming here since 1992 and definetely tasted the changes . Here's my update and I'm happy Gordos has made some changes !!!

Came here on a Friday around 8 pm and got my usual bean and cheese .

I'd like to say that the new staff is on top of it and are very friendly.  I gotta admit  the older guys definetely weren't as attentive and nice .

Flour tortillas are still dry and flake off easily . 

I'm glad Gordos hired cool people ! 

The burrito tasted great today !

Love how the price is a consistent price with the screen and how they don't automatically charge me for bags when I don't ask for one.
author: DOM d.

description:
After trying two Gordo locations this one is my favorite. The staff is pretty friendly, quick, and the food is pretty great!
I love getting the chicken burrito, and its just a no frills, full of meat kind of dinner. The tortilla is steamed with cheese so its soft and doesn't crack, and they always give you just huge portions! 
No complaints here, I will be back!
author: Larissa S.

description:
Been almost 5 years since I've been here. Also full disclaimer: this place was my first burrito back in 1989 when I first moved to California and 10 years ago I did climb on my motorcycle and ride from San Diego to SF just for Gordo's. Speaking of which, moving to San Diego for almost 2 decades and being a stones throw from Mexico has a bazillion burrito places all which fall short. Over cooked, dried out, poorly (or none) marinated meat is unfortunately so common and disappointing.

Back to this weekend: OMG did not disappoint and still have some of the same staff from decades ago!

Super beef, pinto beans and everything with extra extra hot sauce is hands down the best burrito ever! Something about the blend of homemade ingredients and the correct cut of carne, meticulously prepared & seasoned and cooked to perfection wins this place hands down. Also the fact that I've been eating here since 1989 and it's been consistently incredible pays homage to the dedication and pride this family puts into each dish!
author: P C.

description:
First time going here. I bought a regular. Told them I didn't want any beans and asked if I could have cheese instead. Was told it would cost an extra .85 He tore a piece of sandwich cheese in half. This cost .85

What got me was when I bit into my burrito there were tons of big chunks of black charcoal. The kind that falls off your B B Q grill when you clean it. I can only assume they don't clean their grill. GROSS! It was impossible to eat.

*Update* My while family got super sick from here. Awful!
author: Susan D.

description:
Pretty small spot with very limited and uncomfortable seating along the wall and window. Fast service. Food was pretty good, but my mate over-hyped it for me. Wasn't as flavourful as I had hoped. Not bad, just not a culinary orgasm as I was promised.

Easy location with parking at lunch hour.
author: Captain C. Branagain G.

description: I came here for a quick meal on a weeknight and got the carnitas quesadilla. The corn quesadilla was fried with cheese and was left open instead of folded. A heaping pile of carnitas was added to the tortilla. The generous helping of meat was unfortunately very salty. I could hardly taste the cheese. The salsa and crispy tortilla added a much appreciated balance to the meatiness. For ~$4 the carnitas quesadilla is not a bad deal. It satisfied my hunger without leaving me overstuffed.
author: Lauren H.

description: Absolute worst burrito ever. I use to eat here years ago and it was great. Now there is absolutely no flavor, I don't think they even use seasoning on anything. Ended up throwing mines about after about 5 bites
author: Dvonte C.

description: Super steak burrito everything spinach wrap, enough said. Always on point and never misses its mark, you see them prep right in front of you. Usually long lines during lunch but it's totally worth it.
author: G L.

description: Hands down the best burrito I've ever eaten! Fast service and super fresh food chili verde the rice was cooked to perfection the black beans were great! I would highly recommend Gordo Taqueria to everyone I know!
author: Tristin P.

description: BEST BURRITO EVER, people are super nice! great selection, everything is delicious!! especially carnitas and refried beans, not too expensive! great for on the go
author: Amelia S.

description: Let me just say I live in Newark Ca which is 40 min away from Gordo Taqueria. and i only go to Sf to get some good burritos from this place. and to all the people giving bad reviews you people don't know bout Mexican food this fkn burritos is like going to Mexico if you don't like it go to taco bell haha anyways im on my way to this restaurant to get a burrito I honestly don't care if they're rude as long as what goes in my mouth is good idc about anything else anyways thank you for the good ass burritos yall give me
author: Teresita F.

description: Ordered a super burrito and it didn't even come with sour cream or guacamole. No chips either. Weak. There are so many other good taquerias in the city, why go here?
author: A C.

description: A decent option for tacos and burritos when you live in the Richmond and don't want to go all the way to the Mission. Are they as good as the places in the Mission? Of course not, and I would pretty much only come here out of convenience. A decent option after some drinks but generally, not too great. Definitely "average" so 3 stars. I would never come here out of choice or as a first option but I'm sure I'll be back since it's close to where I live, relatively cheap, open until 10, and not horrible (high standards, I know). Compared to the rest of SF probably lower than 3 stars but for this area, it's at least 3 for sure. This place is TINY by the way- best for take out and eating on the go.
author: Seema U.

description: It's been a few years, but this was my original favorite burrito place. My usual was the Super Chicken. They had the best guacamole and everything tasted so fresh.
author: Patrick B.

description: Always bomb breakfast burritos here! One of my favorite spots in the outer Richmond for Mexican food!
author: Tyler Z.

description:
Love me some Gordo's burritos! It's fast, yummy, and so affordable for how much you get. I've tried a few of the different meats and it's hard to say which one was my favorite, but the chile verde burrito is was got me to write the review. The carnitas was looking a little dry the most recent trip I went, so that might be a meat to avoid, though I may have just gone at a bad time.

Definitely recommend getting a burrito here if you're in the area and unsure of what to get! Super with Cheese don't be a chicken!
author: Dillon G.

description: This is absolutely among the best Taqueria's in San Francisco. I love both the Clement Street and inner Sunset locations. A lot of the staff has been working there for years and knows exactly what to do. They serve up delicious burritos that I continue to crave over the decades. There Carnitas is probably one of the best meets on the menu but a lot of times I roll asada just because I like steak. Regardless I will make a special trip and circle around 30 minutes for parking just to get a hold of one of these babies. To let you know how big of a fan I am this was my birthday dinner :-). Please don't close Gordos I'll be lost without you.
author: Robert C.

description: I have been to both this Gordos and the one on Geary and have to say this one definitely tastes better.  I love the beef burrito, its a good size burrito packed with a lot of meat for a good price.  The only thing I wish they did was make lettuce available for your burrito.  Also it sucks that you have to get a super burrito in order to get cheese in your burrito.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I was craving for burrito since the morning. Get here ordered a SUPER burrito, but I am not satisfied with their SUPER burritos are like the same size as regular size burrito from other places. 
The place is hard the sit and not much seats. Not much room around since I don't know why the line was long most of the time.
author: Victor C.

description: Supper good food, super good customer service and verry helpful I woulf so recomend it to people so stop by and try it :)
author: Pedro M.

description: To be honest I have been eating gordo's for 26 years. They have not changed in 26 years and that is great. They serve fantastic burritos that put the other chains to shame.  Great job once again Gordo. Don't change  fantastic hige burritos. And the carnitas is the best.
author: Todd C.

description:
This is a quick place to grab a meal as they don't have much seating. I got a grilled chicken quesadilla and it was okay. The chicken had just enough flavor, but I wish there was more cheese and I wish that the tortilla was more grilled.

Overall, not much to say except it was a quick meal on the go stop. It was alright, but I've definitely had better.
author: Sophia Y.

description: The main thing they have going for them is they have no competition in the area of the city they are located. If they were in the mission they would not survive. They charge you for the smallest burrito you will ever get in sf. Why does a super not include everything and is the same size as a regular burrito you would get in the mission?  We just travel a little extra now to go to La Corneta. A super baby burrito is about the same size as a regular burrito at Gordos.
author: Angel C.

description:
DON'T WASTE YOUR $$$!!!!! 

The food is mediocre. I ordered a chicken quesadilla, and maybe this happened because of the way it was executed as a taco (wtf), I went in for a bite and all of the juices from the beans and salsa came pouring out! Eater beware, VERY messy. 

The cashier had a HORRIBLE attitude. I've experienced the same rudeness from their other locations, maybe it's a thing? Idk. 

Better food and better service at LA TAQUERIA in the Mission!!!!! Hands down!!
author: K. E.

description:
A non-shimmering three stars.

My friends who live in the neighborhood told me this is a great place for some Mexican food.

I was hungry for a good burrito, and when I walked in, I liked the feel of it.

It's a tiny place, but it's just fine. There are a few places to eat inside and outside. Most people seem to be taking their food to go.

They have a very steady stream of customers and they keep things moving.

The prices are OK, especially for the area. 

I ordered the Chile Verde burrito. It was a  good sized burrito, about the size of a burrito you'd get at Chipotle. 

The burrito was super salty. So salty I couldn't finish it. It was my lunch, and I was thirsty the rest of the day because of the high salt content. 

I might try them again next time I'm in town, but try something different.  My friend said he had the Chile Verde burrito before, and he said it's the only thing he's had there he didn't like...because of the saltiness of it.
author: Nick A.

description: In regards to vegan options, I would have rather spent my money at chipotle to get a better quality burrito.
author: Lauren T.

description: Hardshell tacos arrived soggy. All of the food was bland and tastless. I don't think they even salt the chicken before cooking. Not even sour cream and cheese could bring this food to life.
author: Scott G.

description:
Second time here and a little disappointed. Their "Super Burritos" are extremely simple and pretty dry. The chicken was large chunks, most of them were blackened giving it a burnt taste. Then just rice, beans, a little cheese and Pico de gallo. 
To be fair, they dont list the ingredients of what a "super burrito" is, but there is no sour cream, guacamole, lettuce or anything that is usually standard in a "Super". 

Price and size is decent, but I'd rather pay a little more for a burrito that wasn't so bland and dry.

I would say the tacos are the better buy. Very large, filling, and tasty.
author: Chelsea V.

description: It's  a really nice  place for a quick bite and I love it. My favorite thing there is a super burrito with carne asada. It has a perfect texture and rich flavor. The taqueria is always crowded so I like to take my burrito  to the  beach nearby. It's a  perfect  combination!
author: Siarhei F.

description: This place has tasty burritos at a good price. The carnitas burrito is one of the best out there. My wife ordered their carnitas quesadilla with a flour tortilla. The quesadilla can be ordered to resemble a burrito. This is going to be next on my list. The bag of chips could be a little larger, but other than that this is a good place to go for a quick bite.
author: Marty M.

description: Burrito wasn't soggy like the Geary location. Taste is fine. Chips were crispy with being stale. Nothing amazing when compared to the mission area of sf, but for being one of the few burrito places around Richmond it's acceptable.
author: Jason C.

description: I got a bean, cheese and rice burrito and it was amazing! I'd definitely come back just for the burrito!
author: Morgan E.

description:
Lazy version of Mexican food. I don't know who Gordo is and how Gordo ended up with so many locations. The burritos are pathetic. They take store-bought pre-sliced cheese, slap it on a tortilla, throw on some meh-worthy fillings, and wrap it in a hurry. It's getting harder to find a burrito under $8, so I thought their burritos were a good deal for less than $6, but they are more like mini burritos. The super burritos are more like regular-sized burritos, which explains the seemingly low prices.
At least they offer crispy tacos.
The only thing really worth ordering is the Gordo Plate (~$7), simply because it is cheap and filling. But with none of the robust Mexican flavors. It includes pasty beans, watery salsa, rice, and a choice of meat. It's mostly rice with very little meat. Sour cream & guacamole cost extra.
Their saving grace is the service is fast. It shouldn't take more than a minute to scoop things into a box, ring it up, and get you on your way.
author: Joy W.

description:
Delicious beef and carnitas tacos. I had the "crispy" tacos which weren't on the menu but they had no problem making it happen! What they do is add a bit of oil and a layer of cheese. Sounds good right? 
The only reason I am giving them 4 star is because I wish that the crispy taco would have came with an extra soft tortilla in order to keep this Gordon from falling apart easily. I'll most likely be returning and ask if they can honor the request!
NOTE: Portions are big, two tacos should fill you up bruh.
author: Eric R.

description: I was super impressed with my carnitas quesadilla!! My husband got a burrito and wished he'd gotten my order!
author: Kathleen H.

description: The Yelp Menu said Burritos cost 5.95 when I went to the restaurant the cost was really 7.95. The burritos tasted bland. The Yelp Menu also advertised they had steak and al pastor no luck. Only has chicken and carnitas.
author: Ron G.

description: This place is everything your local hole-in-the-wall taqueria should be: clean, affordable, delicious. It gets packed around lunch or dinnertime, especially on weekends, but the service is so quick that you barely notice. Their carnitas are the absolute best I've ever had.
author: Elaine T.

description:
I eat here because their black beans are authentically made, spot on. I never even feel the urge to eat meat here when the beans are truly the star of the show. 

I have frequent cravings for this place just for properly cooked black beans. Also my burrito is like $5 so I really could eat here everyday if I wanted to. Always feels good. 

I wish they delivered to take my frequent cravings online. Like what if they just did a burrito on demand set up where a guy rode a bicycle or scooter? Sweet lord, please?
author: Priya S.

description:
Much better service at this location than the one on Geary. The space is a little smaller, but I always feel like the employees here are happier to help you out.

The roommate normally gets a Carnitas super burrito while I get a Beef super burrito. I like that the Geary location offers an All meat super burrito, but sometimes, all you need is beef!

Parking here can be a pain! There are times when I wanna drop by, but since parking at times is impossible, I end up going to the Geary location or another taqueria closer to my house. If I'm with the roommate, he normally just pulls over while I go in and get our order.

This is probably my favorite burrito pick up place in my area. Just wish parking was easier!
author: Elena N.

description: Pretty solid burrito, decent for its price and quite tasty. The only thing I didn't like was their tortilla was rather chewy and moist which I wasn't used to.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Good burritos but dirty and bad quality. Found four bones in my burrito. Dirty atmosphere bad quality meat.Good taste and cheap though.
author: Gigi S.

description: Giant tasty traditional burritos....I had the chicken which had a great grilled flavor that went well with the cool and mild guacamole and the very spicy salsa, while Terri had the carnitas burrito, also very good....definitely would go back....next time to try the chili verde
author: Wylie T.

description: One worker made my burrito with no gloves, very unhygenic. It made me feel like my appetite was ruined. Burrito was soggy, not wrapped enough, the condiments and toppings were just falling apart,everything became messy. I'm never coming to this place again.
author: Romin B.

description:
I may still have one burrito love when im in San Jose (Iguanas) but when I'm in the city, and I'm not feeling a Senior Sizig burrito Gordo's is the spot!

Carnitas or shredded chicken with extra cheese, black beans, rice, sour cream, guac, and some tomatillo hot sauce.
A side of chips and I'm out the door on the way to enjoying burrito bliss.

This is a whole in the wa'll place, so don't let its appearance prevent you from devouring some top tier SF burrito.
author: Justin K.

description:
Wow! Do they have awesome burritos. It's a tiny dark place but don't let that put you off their burritos were some next level shiz. 

I got one and was so blown away I had to go back and get a second for the ride home. Expertly crafted burritos from ingredients to wrapping. 

I got the gordo burrito with everything. I think this might be the best burrito I've ever had. The memory of the taste on my tongue makes me sad every time I go to a chipotle

Highly recommend this place when you're in SF
author: Alex C.

description:
Best burrito in SF!
Fresh pinto beans, moist shredded chicken, everything is perfectly cooked and paired. I know natives each have our favorites, but this is consistent and enjoyable every time.
author: Cass B.

description:
Warning: you may get 'gordo' if you try this place...because it's the tastiest Mexican food I've had in SF. 

These amigos love making tasty tacos and big 'ol burritos. 

Fresh and authentic food and welcoming and friendly service. 

Seating is tight, but walk a few blocks to the beach and enjoy a side of sea breeze with your savory salsa.
author: Willis D.

description:
Definitely my favorite of the three locations. The chile verde is the bomb. The boiled chicken is always moist & juicy. Salsas/guac always fresh. Always huge portions whether it's a burrito, taco or Gordo platter.  
There is usually a long line, if you think about it order ahead and skirt the line when you get there. Getting a spot to eat inside is a matter of luck as well.
author: Kevin M.

description: This is my favorite place to grab a quick bite in the neighborhood for a very affordable price. Their burritos taste simple, yet fresh which I highly recommend. The service and staff are great!
author: Bryan W.

description: Trash. I live right next door and I will only eat here if someone buys for me. The burritos are so plain, unseasoned meats, gnarly smell. My roommate eats here every day and I swear to god it stinks up the whole house!!! That boys gonna die from all that sodium!!!
author: Ryan M.

description: best Burritto in SF !!!! Grab a burritto and head to Baker beach for some of the finest dining in SF
author: Ryan B.

description:
This was awful.

This review is mostly a bookmark to remind me never to return and at the same time share with you that this will be a meal you can never get back.

I came in on a slow Sunday afternoon and was immediately greeted. Bonus!! The service is fast because there where three people working on my burrito! Maybe not efficient but fast.

This is a classic Mission size burrito and while still wrapped up, very promising. As soon as you start to unwrap though your dreams are crushed and expectations shattered.

I guess all of the expected ingredients are present but the flavor profile is reminiscent of soggy cardboard. There is a taste reminiscent of what the memory of guacamole once may have been which just makes you mad. Same can be said about the sour cream. All of the other ingredients are equally as underwhelming. 

Please remember to request a spoon because this mess is more like burrito soup then anything else.

I won't be back.
author: Justin S.

description:
We called in a pickup order for a carnitas super burrito and a chicken super burrito. Not sure if you can go straight to the front of the line for pickups, so we just waited. There was a line out the door and it took about fifteen minutes to get to the order counter. Said we had a pickup order and one of the men behind the counter directed to us to the register. Didn't mind the wait because the staff was super friendly. Fast or friendly, gotta at least be one. 

The burritos were OK, but nothing to write home about. Not necessarily bland, just kinda meh. Didn't help that the tortillas were soggy and mushy from the wait.  We might go back again if the line isn't out the door. I heard their quesadillas are good
author: Jeff M.

description:
My first love, Gordos on clement. Boiled chicken super burrito is my go to. Or a flour quesadilla with super burrito ingredients. Can't go wrong with chile verde or carnitas too. 
I've been going to this same burrito party for 15 years and in no way is that depressing
author: Alex E.

description: I am so mad; I can't believe I got so much food for little money. I mean the burrito was practically busting open with delicious contents. Is this a free hand out? It's like a charity for tasty guacamole and free salsa. Not to mention, the service felt like I was the president. However, I am more used to sub-par service from past taquerias. This overall experience was awful... Awfully delectable
author: Elexise C.

description:
I don't care what any listicle on the internet says, but this is hands down the best place for a burrito in San Francisco. They have a couple of other locations, as well as some across the bridge, and there's a reason for that. They're so damn good.

The carnitas here is top notch. I don't know how they do it, but it's perfectly crispy every single time and just the right amount of saltiness too. It's a build-your-own style place like Chipotle, but it's actually real Mexican food, ha. Don't forget the guac--it's extra, but they don't charge $2 unlike other places.... 

The service is quick, efficient, but don't expect them to chummy up to you. Forgive the employees if they're hard to understand or you can't hear them. It's a loud environment with a lot of people coming and going, and these people probably don't speak English very well. Y'all need to calm down. The employees are there to make sure the line goes by pretty quickly (especially during dinner time when it's so busy), and for such cheap prices, I wouldn't expect more.
author: Bettina L.

description: Wow, I'm surprised. I didn't know a burrito can taste so bad. The place looks very dirty. Location is great though. However, I would recommend to drive somewhere else for a decent mexican food.
author: Dim O.

description:
On my last day of SF I decided to explore Golden Gate Park. Somewhere mid-day I was hungry and wandered off towards the southeast end of the park to get some food. I have not had any kind of Hispanic food during my travels and thought I would give Gordo Taqueria a try.

Service - 2/5. Nothing outstandish... guys seem preoccupied talking to each other in Spanish. I can't understand a thing.

Food - 2/5. I come from Las Vegas where there are many authentic Mexican restaurants. I surely did not expect anything too much of a place in SF, but literally there is no difference between the burrito and quesadilla and tacos minus a few things. Authenticity gets a 1 if it were a category... the quesadilla was literally their taco with cheese on it lol. 

It wasn't *too* bad tasting, I suppose. The tacos were large in size and very fulfilling. Normally tacos are very small in size, so I would get 3-4. I only needed 1-2 here to get full.

Ambience - 3/5. Nothing special. The wall paintings gave the place a very Mexican feel, but I didn't like the vibes inside it.
author: Toby Y.

description:
It's been my go-to for years.  Whether after a movie at the 4Star, a round of golf at Lincoln, or just a quick pick-up on the way home from the airport, it is my "comfort Burrito or Taco" joint of choice.  

Several locations but I prefer the location on 24th and Clement despite parking difficulties sometimes.  I usually go for the carnitas or the boiled chicken burritos.  

There's an art to ordering and not holding up the line.  So don't hold it up or us locals will be pissed!  All you need to know when ordering the burrito is if you will be having a Super or Regular size.  And if you want a regular size do you want cheese?  Then after they steam heat your tortilla they will walk you through it (kind of beans?  Meat?  Tomatoes?  Guacamole? Sour cream? Hot sauce?

Are you cool?  Can you order in Spanish?  Go ahead, it's the Richmond District, not the Mission.
author: Erik H.

description: Just wow. First let to share that I'm from the Mission/La Mission; born and raised here in SF, I've has my fair share of tacos and burritos. This place is on a whole other level of BS. You have to order every specific ingredient and there's virtually no difference between the Super and Regular Burrito. Except for the price...This was also the 3rd time I paid the extra for a Super, asked to guacamole and sour cream then didn't get it. I allowed the cashier to distract me. Shame on me. Then I'm asked if I'd like some picante sauce, but i would tend to think 1/4 of a teaspoon doesn't meet any Latin standards on any level. My estimation is the cashier will talk to you while your food is being made, you're charged for the extras, but you won't get them. I confirm the ingredients for the Super weren't in there by the time I got home. (I was in a hurry and I didn't want Jack in the crack) Complain? Sure maybe, but this is the 3rd time I know this has happened and it's a good chance it's done intentionally. So I'll take to Yelp and give them 2 stars instead. 1 - star for appearance (it looks the part)  and location, 2nd star because I won't be coming back, it's the least I can do. That's petty and a shame because I live here in the area now, but I'll make the trek to the Mission for my Super Burritos. Dear owners, don't write me, don't apologize, have them make those burritos right. I won't come back - not even for a free one.
author: Steven A.

description:
Service is mediocre, they could care less if you buy anything or not. 
They try to up sell expensive sour cream and guacamole without saying it cost extra. 
Hard to understand them at counter. 
Food quality is mediocre. 
You can basically get this unimpressive burrito anywhere, not very good. 
Guacamole is runny.
author: Bert V.

description: This place is quick and cheap! Came here on a Sunday around dinner time and there was no line. Ordered the carnitas burrito and it was yummy and filling. The staff was also pretty friendly! I'd recommend if you're looking for a quick bite and you're feeling Mexican food.
author: Bing L.

description: This place is where you can get clean, authentic Mexican. I always get the super burrito with shredded chicken! The shredded chicken is so moist! The also have tomato and spinach tortilla.
author: Candice L.

description:
If you've never had the Gordos carnitas quesadilla with tomatoes, hot sauce (not too spicy) and guacamole, you may be missing out on the most delicious food you've ever put in your mouth. 

I've only ever had the burritos here which are just ok. However, today I tried the above quesadilla and it rocked my world.
author: Shannon V.

description:
Neighborhood gem. Of all the Gordo's Locations, dis be da one boi. 

Super(b) Burritos? Start with the cooked/pulled chicken, then maybe the grilled, and then venture to the carnitas and chile verde pork if you're about that life.  

Pay attention in line and don't hold it up or you might get roasted in espanol, nah mean?
author: John K.

description:
What to do when nobody wants to cook....???

Gordo's plates. For less than six bucks...1 2 3 4 5 6...yes thats right . You can stuff yourself.

For those uninitiated: a Gordos plate is your choice of meat....sorry no vegetarians here (HA HA). Carnitas, Boiled chicken, Grilled chicken, Carna Asada or Chile verde. Type of beans black, pinto, or refried. Your choice of corn tortillas or flour tortillas....I recommend the corn tortillas. And Fresh cut salsa, hot sauce and their really good rice.

With a Gordo's plate you make your own tacos....4 ahmazing tacos...stuffed to the gills....it really is a ton of food for the money. 

I think you could actually feed a family of four on one of their gordo plates....there is a bit of hyperbole in that statement...but it is a ton of food for the money.

Check it out ese. Orale!
author: David G.

description: Stopped by for a quick late night dinner and walked away highly disappointed. I asked for sautéed veggie burrito and after asking which condiments I wanted I was told they didn't have any veggies. Sour cream and guac cost extra and didn't add any taste to my burrito. The service was pretty lousy especially since there weren't too many people in the restaurant.
author: Shristi R.

description:
Why oh why is this place so popular? In the Richmond District, pickings are incredibly slim when it comes to taquerias, so I suppose it's this very scarcity of options that drives people to gorge on Gordo's subpar menu. 

They don't even grate their own cheese! Instead, they melt a square of plasticky cheese onto the tortilla before proceeding to slather it with additional ingredients of a burrito. I once ordered a chicken super burrito, I nearly spat out the first bite. The meat was charred and saltier than anchovies on saltines. Alas, it was a to go order, so I was stuck with an inedible meal that cost me at least six bucks. Thinking this might have been a one off experience, I tried a few more times and was disappointed with the food from both Richmond District locations. I guess that Gordo's near total lack of competition allows it to thrive, but for the life of me, I just cannot wrap my head around its apparent popularity.
author: Carole B.

description: Stumbled upon this place by coincidence, but keep coming back. The burritos and tacos are flavorful and delicious!
author: Bogee B.

description:
Pretty good, could be a lot spicier. I had 2 chicken tacos cause they're quite large. Tortilla and chicken are quality ingredients so if you're lookin' for a quick eat that's good, come here. 

3 star cause spicier would have added more flavour. I feel like they're marketed towards folks who don't wanna run for the water machine. Small parking lot next door @$3.50-1/2hr or parking meters. No restroom.
author: Steve A.

description: I love Mexican food, and this place is as good as they come. The prices there are okay, and the burritos are huge and delicious. I can easily say that this is one of the best Mexican restaurants in SF.
author: Billy B.

description:
Still beats all of the SoCal burrito places I've eaten at since I moved to Long Beach a year ago.

Now that I'm moving back to the the SF area soon, I'll make sure to come back here whenever I have a burrito craving.
author: Mike O.

description:
As an SF native there are the main three taqueria joints you have to try: La Taqueria, El Farolito & Gordo.  Sad to say the only one I have not tried to date is El Farolito (hopefully soon)!  I finally got to try Gordo last month after many years of walking pass it on Clement with grandma as a little girl.  

We called our order when we were leaving CPMC and it was done by the time we arrived.  We both ordered a regular carnitas burrito (minus beans) and shared an order of chips.  Prices were cheap, parking was hard around 8 on a Friday, so he double parked (expected for Clement).   One thing that turns me off is that they don't give out free salsa, I mean, I guess that's fine if you don't have a salsa bar like some Mexican places, but the fact that you bought the chips and you still have to pay extra for one little container of salsa is kind of lame.  

We finally were ready to indulge once we got home.  It was still a good portion despite only being tomatoes, meat and rice.  The meat was tender and flavorful and the rice was great too.  Okay, totally can see the hype in Gordo's.  I'll forgive you for the upcharge on salsa if you open one in Outer Sunset because I ain't got time to go to 9th & Irving, what do you say?  4.5ish for now!
author: Cat C.

description:
The best burrito in the Inner + Outer Richmond. Gordo's is reliable and I can even manage to finish an entire burrito in the two blocks from the clement location back to my boyfriends apartment. Plan on ordering your burrito to-go, it is a very tiny space fit for the line out the door of burrito eaters. 

Try the carne asada super burrito. While you're at it buy one for a friend too, they're only $6.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Gordo is my go-to for cheap, delicious burritos in the Richmond. 

The carnitas are outstanding, and the chicken is also really good. Its one of the few places where the chicken is shredded and poached, instead of chopped chunks of grilled chicken. It's a great option if you're trying to stay healthy. A shredded chicken street taco with salsa or avocado is actually not bad for you at all, so check out Gordo's for a quick lunch or dinner that you can make as healthy or heavy as you like -- it's tasty both ways!
author: Laura J.

description: Absolutely delicious. If you're ever in the area I would definitely recommend Gordo's Taqueria. Everyone is friendly and patient, even if you're indecisive about what you want to eat on their limited menu. I ordered the chile verde super burrito and I split it with my mom. It was just enough. I added sour cream ($0.55), cheese ($0.65) and guacamole ($0.75) but it is an extra cost so be careful. When they take your order it goes by REALLY fast so make sure you know what toppings you want prior to order. My only complaint would be in regards to seating because it is really small.. But that's not the restaurants fault, in fact, it adds charm.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description:
Gargoyle balls taste better than their burritos.


No kidding. I was quite drunk when I went to this place, and you know how drunk people think everything is good, but this place - it sobered me up (the bad way).
author: Mike D.

description: I really enjoyed my lunch here! I had a chicken burrito with rice, beans, pico, and guac. SO much better than your everyday chipotle - authentic Mexican food. I also asked them to put the burrito on the grill for a little so that the outside got a little toasty and they did it no problem :)
author: Jamie F.

description: I dropped in for a quick bite at this spot in San Francisco. I got a chicken quesadilla while my cousin got a chicken taco. The chicken was charred beautiful and was really tasty. The only thing lacking for me was the level of spice. Even after I asked for extra hot sauce, my quesadilla was pretty bland which is why I am giving this place 3 stars.
author: Manpreet B.

description: Fast set-up and great tasting burrito for a reasonable price. I would have liked my chicken to be less charred but it was moist. Small place but quick and convenient.
author: Iliana S.

description:
Good burrito. 
Liked the guy behind the counter more than my burrito. 
You can't look more Mexican that that guy ;)
author: Zhenya V.

description: Fast, reliable, great! Love the quick predictable burritos and competent service. Recommend this place.
author: Breee R.

description: Gordo at Clement, ahh the infamous spot to grab a burrito after a long day of work, or perhaps just your daily pit stop for lunch. Hmm, let's not be fooled now... spending $8 for slop wasn't at the top of my priority list today. But hey, I get it, when your hungry you see a taqueria, what else are you gonna do? Well I can tell you what you don't want to do. Get a carnitas super burrito from here and have H1N1 swamp butt for the rest of your life, not really my cup of tea. Is it yours?
author: Elijah C.

description: Good food, very authentic. Staff could be a little friendlier- they seemed distracted all taking to each other and made me feel like I was interrupting when I ordered. They have a small seating bar-like area inside which is nice! Great portions they are generous! I'll ignore the service and give them 5 stars this time only because the food was fresh, authentic, and delicious.
author: Priscilla Q.

description: Probably doesn't compare to the places in the mission but it is quick, fast and delicious. I got a chile verde super burrito and then added some guacamole to it as well! (Only .65 extra for the guacamole) Solid place overall, will be back for more in the future!
author: Kristie M.

description:
I was famished and opted for a "super" burrito mistakenly assuming it meant it had all the proper burrito fillings like most of the other taquerias I've been to. But here, "super" pertains to its size (wrapped in a tortilla that measures 14" in diameter), which actually makes more sense. Flavor was definitely there and the burrito was nicely rolled up which ultimately lead me to regrettably scarfing down every last bite.  

The shop itself is small-ish with seats lined up against the front window and continues around to the side wall facing their wall of business cards. Although there were about 8 chairs, I would say it seats 5 (perhaps 6) comfortably as rubbing shoulders and elbows with strangers is my not my ideal way to dine-in. 

Next time I'll stick with their regular sized burritos. Otherwise, I'll probably start sizing up to this taqueria's namesake - gordo.
author: Esther A.

description:
Came to Gordo's on a saturday afternoon with my boyfriend. I was starving and Gordo's was in the area. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Gordo's is pretty small inside. There are a few seats along the front window and sides of the wall. 

Taste: 
My boyfriend ordered a grilled chicken quesadilla and I got a regular carne asada burrito without beans. The burrito was just eh; it was kind of dry and just... not too appealing even with the hot sauce. Usually when we go to Gordo's, we just get the quesadillas. This time around, I thought it was not as good as I have had in the past. It might of been because the outside was not as crisp, so everything became soggy really quickly because of the steam and pico de gallo, but they do put a lot of meet in the quesadillas. I hate how in both the quesadilla and the burrito, it would leak through the aluminum foil. 

Overall the food was okay. The total came out to around $11 something. I don't think I will be returning for a while, unless I am in dire need of Mexican food and quick (they get your order out pretty quickly).
author: Vivian Y.

description: There was a long line right outside as we pulled up off street. The place is very small and we were expecting to eat here but instead took it to go. Anyways, I ordered the Carnitas regular burrito with refried beans,cheese, and hot sauce. It was pretty good except the Carnitas was hard on some parts.
author: Mary S.

description:
I have been going to Gordo for over thirty years.  The food is consistently good quality at fair prices.  They do a really good job of getting you in and out the door quickly.

The food is fresh and tastes great, even though it is served from a steam table.  They make it right in front of you, so if you want adjustments (i.e. more salsa) it is easy to see it as it is being prepared and to ask.

The only reason I did not give five stars is that the seating is very limited and if want to eat it there, you end up with all of the to-go customers and the chairs are really uncomfortable.
author: Gary A.

description:
SEXUAL HARASSMENT - LADIES BEWARE!

First, I come from San Diego where you can get a real burrito.

Second, my ancestors would be ashamed that I don't speak Spanish (yet), but I do know the word for "whore" in Spanish and one of the cooks hurled this word at me as I was walking up to the counter before I could even get a chance to order my food. No mistakes, this was not said in conversation to anyone. He was looking directly at me when he said it and smiled at me as if he was certain I had not heard it and that he would get away with it. 

I guess I interrupted the afternoon sausage soccer party or something. I guess if you aren't a bloated truck driver you are not worthy in their minds. If it wasn't enough being insulted they thought it was quite funny and strange that I opted out of guacamole for once and very much enjoyed making it a topic of ridicule, discussion, and debate. 

^I think this is called harassment? What kind of place allows its workers to bully and discriminate against anyone, let alone its own customer, one who has come in regularly and lived in the neighborhood for years? 

Even before this incident it was apparent to me that the dudes behind the counter were talking about me like a bunch of high school girls. When I finally called them out these "macho men" were looking at the ground like they might piss their panties. 

Yeah - safe to say I'm not going back for more verbal abuse over a cheap mediocre tasting burrito. If you care about women - boycott this crap hole!
author: Lady G.

description: Gordo has a good reputation but when I ate there last Saturday evening - I really don't know why people were lined up.  First of all, don't order the Quesadilla appetizer - it's a complete rip off for $2.99 a small tortilla deep fried with a slice of cheese on it folded in half.  It was too greasy and not even suitable for any child to consume.  I could have made a far better one when I got home.  You can buy a whole stack of tortillas for $3 and put as much cheese on it and the tortilla you get at the grocery store would be fresher than this.  Secondly, I ordered the Carnitas plate with refried beans and Spanish rice.  The most edible portion on the plate was the Spanish rice.  The Carnitas were oily, hard, dry, and too salty.  I could barely eat part of it.  I ended up throwing away most of my meal.   I know there are very few Mexican places in this part of the Richmond but better to just avoid going here all together and eat a burger across the street.
author: Annette C.

description:
This is one of the best burritos around. The food is so good that sometimes there can be a line, but well worth the wait.

Whether to eat in or togo the food is always great, and for a family on a budget it doesn't get any better than this!
author: Mike S.

description: I have been going hear for 20+ years (being that I'm only 27 that's pretty amazing lol) this is most likely the first burrito I have ever eaten lol so kinda bias. . . the place is always packed ever since I was a kid, even with that being the case you're in and out! Their burritos are clean and classic no frills or thrills just good clean ingredients. If you live in the city its a must try!!!!
author: Keno M.

description:
Love this place.

Great carnitas tacos (not sure how widely known it is that they serve tacos -- most people seem to order burritos) if you're not hungry enough for a burrito.

Been to all three Gordos; interesting to note that the flavor of the food differs somewhat by location.  Irving & Geary locations have room to sit down; Clement not so much (take-out only for us).
author: Paul M.

description:
Worst super burrito ever. I rather have eaten at Taco Bell. They make a better burrito then this spot!

I ordered the super burrito and all I got was 2lbs of beans in each one of the four burritos I ordered. Steak taste like chewy non marinated rubber. No taste whatsoever. So if you want to spend $7.00 for 2lbs of beans, then by all means this is your spot!
author: Anthony M.

description: My gordo plate with mostly burnt grilled chicken was not enjoyable at all. I started craving Chipotle's after a few bites.
author: Tian Q.

description: The best vegetarian burrito ever (as i don't eat with meat). These guys are very fast.
author: Olga K.

description:
Order the boiled chicken!

Carnitas was too dry/salty and from reviews chili verde was super salty as well. 

Ordered boiled chicken quesadilla and carnita taco
author: Jimmy L.

description: To this day I've never had a better burrito. And I live in Texas now.  The Carnitas are the best in the world
author: Vincent C.

description:
Very unprofessional. Guys take 20 minutes  to make a burrito. Stood in line and didn't even have a burrito to show for it. Bailed because the employee with a short beard was too busy talking to his coworkers in Spanish. He didn't listen to anything anyone was saying for their order. This customer repeated his request for guac and tomatoes three times before the guy got it right. A line built up behind me and they didn't seem to mind. This is not the first time. 
The food has always been okay. Standard burritos, quesadillas, tacos, etc. They just don't seem to want to pay attention to their customers. Maybe if there was a working TV to distract me I would have stuck around another 20 mins to get my dinner.
author: Tyler S.

description: I've been coming here for a long time, ever since I can remember and they've always gotten my order right and in a timely manner. Tonight I ordered a regular chicken burrito, with black beans and salsa only. Not only did they give me sour cream, they also gave me guacamole AND charged for it! They were in a bit of a rush -- both workers looked pretty frazzled so hopefully this was a one time thing. But I have to say I was pretty disappointed tonight.
author: Samantha W.

description: Burn baby burn!!! This place makes a gordo taco, loaded with meat!! Oh baby, chips and salsa ... me love the spicy salsa! Cheap, fast service, tasty food
author: Elizabeth J.

description: The chicken super burrito I got here was extremely subpar. Zero flavor, and somehow it was very watery. If you want real, good Mexican food, do not come here. A previous user wrote that this is the best burrito in SF. That could not be farther from the truth. Don't go here. Confused how it has 4 stars.
author: Mia C.

description: super burrito is small. steak is chewy, i have had better burritos from food trucks. would not come here again
author: anthony n.

description:
**SNOB ALERT**  Fair warning, I'm probably going to sound like a Mexican food snob in T minus 3...2...1...

Why, oh, why do I always fool myself into believing that I like Gordo's? I do the same thing with Chipotle, so it must be something about my brain where I think "mmm Mexican food" and I forget that all Mexican food is not created equal. *Cue the snobbiest remark I will have in this review* I'm from southern Arizona, right up there snug next to the border, so I have had some fantastic Mexican food in my life and Gordo's is just not real Mexican food, in my opinion. It's only slightly better than Chipotle and I have a very low opinion of Chipotle and the teens and tweens (and wanna-still-be-in-college-types) who love it so much.

Probably the biggest problem I have with Gordo's is that I cannot get anything from there that isn't soggy. No thank you, burrito, I would not like you to drip all over me. Criminy! What's a girl gotsta do to keep ALL of the contents of her burrito INSIDE of the tortilla?!?!? Then I think to myself "okay, Stephenie, just don't get the burrito. Go for something with less sog and more crunch." So I decide on a quesadilla instead. Love me some quesadillas. Nope. NOPE!!! Why is my quesadilla soggy, too?!?! Just stop, Gordo's, for the love of God. I don't know if you're putting an extra dose of water in my food or what, but the madness must stop. "Soggy" is never an adjective I want to use to describe my food, unless I'm eating (some types of) cereal. If you have the exact opposite feelings about sogginess that I do, then hey, maybe you'll like Gordo's.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
Come here at least twice a week. 
Super burrito is the way to go!
I like the boiled chicken a lot more than the carnitas. Any type of beans. A little tip: if you get the boiled chicken have them drain it. A little pricey but I love it.
author: Sabrina M.

description: Delicious food and fast service. I went on a Friday afternoon, found parking right in front, and had to wait 2 minutes for someone to get up from the counter so I could sit (this Gordo's is smaller than the one on 9th Ave.) Great experience!!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Quick? Yes. Cheap? Sort of. Best burrito I've had? Hardly.

This is a definitely a get in, order, get out type of joint. They tend to slop your toppings on quickly so if you don't intend to eat your order quickly, it's probably going to be really soggy...at least I imagine so. I went with the chicken super burrito...you have to pay for a lot of the extras (sour cream, guac, etc) and the cheese looks to be cheap kraft cheese melted onto a tortilla...you don't taste it at all. 

I used to come here a lot in elementary school and remembered it being better. Guess my tastebuds have changed quite a bit since.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I love everything about Gordos! The guys who work there are all nice and efficient. The carnitas is fresh and full of flavor. The burritos are addictive and filling but somehow leave you wanting more. The location is perfect...around the corner from mi casa. Me encanta Gordos!!!
author: Ravi K.

description: I definitely won't come back here! Staff is rude as they speak in Spanish to one other. And they don't care if you speak Spanish, they will still insult you in Spanish. They called me el guerito cabron. Definitely something you don't say to your customers. Food was decent, so I won't give them 1 stars pero por favor traten a los clientes con respeto y dignidad gracias
author: T M.

description:
Just had the beef quesadillas. Real good. I could eat more and more. Cheap and tasty. 

One thing: When they are asking you how you want your dish, they should speak louder, clearer. Still, very good.
author: Lucas F.

description: Maybe I'm biased, I grew up eating gordo's since I went to Presidio Middle School and George Washington High up the block.  My go-to is the flour quesadilla with everything you would put in your burrito, usually carnitas, chili verde or the boiled chicken for me.  Lots of hot sauce, crispy flaky tortilla and fresh ingredients.  This is the best of the three locations in the Richmond and Sunset.  Just don't expect to sit and eat inside.
author: Stanley W.

description:
My favorite burrito place. I recently moved to Los Angeles and I miss this place more than my friends. 

I me how they steam their tortillas it changes the texture and tastes so good. Their rice and chicken are amazing. What really sets them apart is the hot sauce. It's hot enough to feel a little heat but not too hot too torture you but still packs flavor. I would log to be able to buy a bottle of that. 

I would love for them to expand their business to SoCal. I crave their burritos weekly.
author: Michael A.

description: Gordo burritos are okay. They are not expensive. I've been to the Gordo's on 9th many times. Went to this one for the first time today. The burritos are very simple and okay but maybe missing something compared to other places or Chipotle. The name of a restaurant makes a difference because how can you not be attracted to the name Gordo's?
author: Denise C.

description: Amazing burrito! Got super burrito no rice no beans carnitas guac sour cream tomatoes etc.
author: Nikola M.

description:
Update:
Upon insistence of my roommate, I gave gordo another shot. It does fulfill it's niche: a burrito under $8, made in under 12 seconds, with as little conversation as possible. 

Now that it's known exactly what to expect and now that my second encounter with the food went much better, gordo can serve a purpose in my life: when I'm antisocial, in a rush, and starving, I can get in and out with food and without one person asking for the name on my order or how my day was.
author: Frankie S.

description:
Gordo's is one of my fave spots in the Richmond district. I've been a regular since I was 12 years old, going to school down the block at Saint Monica. I typically order the same thing, regular beef burrito with hot sauce and black beans. But occasionally I get their quesadillas as well. The quesadillas are BOMB, minus how messy they are. Some people hate hard core on Gordo's and don't think they put enough meat in their burritos but I'll remain a loyal customer for the rest of my days in SF. 

Also, their hot sauce beasts on a lot of other places in the city, it's actually really spicy!
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
This is the best burrito on the city, no question in my mind. I'm not saying it is head and shoulders over your favorite Mission spot, but I prefer it over any place in the Mission, myself.

Why?

Every thing is exactly how it should be. No weaknesses in any ingredient. Sure, some places might do chicken better, some might do rice better, some might have a better tortilla... But, each part of a Gordo's burrito is a solid 8 or 9 out of 10 and when you add them up the sum of the parts is just consistently really satisfying.

Green hot sauce puts it over the top and is a must add in my opinion.

I also love the chile verde gordo plate.
author: max m.

description: Great place! Consistent flavors for their burritos! I recommend the chile verde burrito! They also have very generous portions!
author: Chris L.

description: This place makes a great flour and carnitas quesadilla. In my opinion the quesadillas are better than the burritos. The line moves quickly and  the staff is friendly. This is my go to burrito restaurant in the Richmond. Please give this place a try.
author: Charles B.

description: So so veggie burrito. It had all the fixings (black beans, rice, guac, sour cream, salsa) but lacked a certain oomph. It filled me up though!
author: Ada C.

description: This place has the worst customer service, the tacos are not even good! Was visiting SF and was very disappointed!
author: Dannia M.

description: One of the tastier Mexican taquerias in the city, we came here for lunch the other weekend. To my delight, they had a smaller burrito as most standard sized ones are way too much for me. We also had ordered a set of tacos and two Mexican sodas. Despite the place being really busy, our food was made quickly. The smaller portion size might not be for everyone, but we left feeling like we got our money's worth and enough food to fill us up without leftovers or feeling too full. Yum!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
This review is for Gordos on Clement @ 24th Avenue in the Richmond. I've been going here for over 20 years now with long breaks in between when I lived elsewhere and not in SF. Last time I came, they told me they don't have red sauce anymore. I order the same exact burrito and ingredients every time but prices are not always the same. I've been tolerating their sexual comments because it's convenient and fast. And I always order jalapeños & hot sauce to cover up the bland flavor of the burritos. I was hoping these guys on Clement would stop talking shit about me. I gave them plenty of chances to be classy gentlemen. They have no idea that I can understand and speak Spanish.  But alas, they still talk about my tits and ass every single time I am there. I never let on that I can understand them because I'm spying on them, and quite amused since I could give a shit. But these sexual connotations really need to stop. Listen up Clement Gordo boys -/ there are people in this world that speak Spanish even if they aren't Latino. Wake up!
Plus your burritos are pretty nasty. I'll be going to Chipotle where the meat is safe and the other ingredients are not genetically modified. I hope you go out of business soon. Your food doesn't taste authentic Mexican anyway.
author: Mary P.

description:
:( 

If you love burritos, stay away. If this is the best that the Richmond+Sunset districts can offer then, "I don't want it. I don't want IT."--Amy Pond in response to choosing a reality without Rory in Doctor Who's "Amy's Choice."

Do yourself a favor and head anywhere in the Mission. 

Nothing about this place is good. Salsa and guac so flavorless it made this grown woman cry. Carnitas so horrible and salty, I'm still trying to clear my throat. Wah. 

Just don't.
author: Margaret S.

description:
I strive for variety in my eating, even in my home city - so it's rare for me to hit the same in-person dining place more than twice a year.  There are two notable exceptions to this personal rule: Nopa (to which I've so far deemed myself unable to do justice due to the weakness of my writing), and Gordo Taqueria - which I have almost literally gone to every week of my life since discovering it a few months into moving to San Francisco.  As near as I can tell, I've eaten there roughly 750 times.  

Every one of those times but three, I've ordered the exact same thing - Super Burrito with "Crispy" Carnitas and "Everything".  That's not to say that there's anything on their menu that I haven't tried - I've just only done it by trying other people's food - because I can't waste my weekly fix on anything but the Carnitas.  And I have introduced virtually everyone who comes to San Francisco to this quintessential.  Multiple guests have told me that they later literally had dreams about their burrito.  My firstborn son's third word was "Gordo."

For the haters who are gonna hate - San Francisco is full of amazing taquerias and I've given up convincing people from here that mine is better than theirs.  Taqueria loyalty in SF is stronger than religion for a lot of folks as far as I can tell.  
Suffice it to say a few things seem to differentiate this place for me specifically - total freedom in the ordering process no matter what dish you've selected (I've noted that some places enforce a more Soup-Nazi-like purity in their receptivity to modifications and additions), the quality of the carnitas themselves - juicy / rich / crispy, the tendency of the burrito rollers to add the ingredients as larger chunks which leads to a more heterogeneous mouth-feel that adds a little bit of uncertainty in each bite (as opposed to carefully balancing every square millimeter via a stirring move like many other places seem to do).

Downsides: the pico de gallo can be inconsistent - and be warned that ordering a side of spicy salsa REALLY means spicy - they're not playing around.  Also the to-go number seemed to be a well-guarded line-skipping secret until recently, when more and more folks started glomming on to this.  I myself no longer take chances with it, as I prefer to aid the line chef in selecting my crispy carnitas, but for those who are comfortable with more variability - use the number to call ahead.
author: Andrew F.

description: Solid place over the years.  Been coming here since a teen and it has the same guys running the place, the food is just as consistent as it ever was. The best thing here is the flour quesadilla- done right by frying the tortilla in butter. All it needs is some pica de gallo and you're set. Yum
author: Matt A.

description:
**TAKE-OUT REVIEW**

It's close by the sis's house... the nannies and I got take out for dinner here a couple of days ago... It gets packed but they're pretty fast.

I got a regular beef burrito ... it was jam packed with rice but not enough beef... I felt a little gypped... but for the price... it was what it was. It's not as tasty as I would have liked it (spoiled from Mexico Au Parc for lunch) ... overall... bland. 

I also ordered a chicken quesadilla but I ended up not eating it since it was swimming in oil... such a turn off to see. 

Will probably have this place as my last go to "must feed me" moments around the sis's neighborhood...
author: Cath M.

description:
I am not sure why it has taken me so long to tell you how much I love you Gordos. 
This is the best Gordo to go to out of all the locations. 
The team of mexican men are so nice and always have a smile.

Super Burritos are about 8 dollars and they definitely pack on everything. Carnitas is delicious. As much as I love mission burritos....somehow Gordos burritos seem to be 10 times less greasy than in the mission without sacrificing taste. good job Gordos!
author: Dee N.

description:
Terrible service!  Was next in line to order food... Guy making the burritos was stuffing his mouth while I was standing there waiting to order.  Guy behind me shouts out his order and the burrito guy starts making his order. Told him I obliviously was next to order since I was standing right in front of him!! He then replies "do what do you want, hurry hurry".
WTH!! I turned around and walked out... Watch out for the rude fat dude.
author: Linda S.

description: The food was great. My favorite or usual order is the carnitas with cheese and everything. It is delicious, BUT the service is pretty bad!!! The last time I went there was after school when my friend and I went here, I had to order 2 (one for my sister and one for me) and my friend wanted one, so we ordered 3 in total. The people working were very rude and making RUDE COMMENTS about how we were ordering SOO much in SPANISH thinking we couldn't understand.
author: Ivy L.

description:
Summary:  Overall excellent burrito experience.  Competes with top burrito places in the City, and worth the drive.

Pros: Great tasting food, everything looks fresh (check out their pico de gallo), and it's priced reasonably.

Cons: Long lines, but hey, that tells you something.  Location - far from us. :-(

So my wife and I live in Russian Hill.  One day (sometimes two) every weekend we need to get our burrito fix.  The closest joints are Nick's Crispy Tacos, Pancho's, and the new Uno Dos.  But, each of these, while good, has its flaws that keep them from being in the upper echelons of the burrito competition.  So, we typically drive to La Corneta in the Mission (see my separate review) while looking for some closer alternatives.

Gordo on Clement has a whole different philosophy than La Corneta, and a much smaller menu, but it will now be our go-to burrito place on the north west side of the City.  The food was great and the prices right.  

I had the carnitas super burrito, with extra black beans of course.  The meat was tender, flavorful, and unlike a lot of other places, not at all fatty.  As I chewed my first bite, I thought - Man, that's delicious.  It continued that way through the entire burrito.  My wife had her usual - veggie super burrito no rice, no sour cream.  She said hers was also delicious.

Normally, I like to fire my burritos up with pickled onion, habanero sauce, etc., but these aren't available at Gordo, so I had to take it as their chef intended.  That dude knows what he's doing.
author: Xaman E.

description: I don't complain about food because I choose it . But service is very bad they don't use gloves , they rape my burrito with dirty hand . N they talk about races also I'm Asian , they said cheena, chetiko ... In Spanish I understand what this people mean  . It's very bad . I don't go any more n don't recommend because it's dirty . Do you people eat dirty food ? I don't ...
author: Darjeelinga N.

description:
I have been going to Gordo's in berkeley for as long as I can ever remember being able to hold a burrito. 
It has been a family fave for decades.

Still just as simple and delicious as I remember. Could use a little more hot sauce to heat things up but other than that it's simple and great. 

I committed burrito fraud and ordered without rice, and the workers were completely fine with that. I also wasn't substituted more beans or pico just because I didn't want rice. Plenty of carne asada! yum 

My favorite meat is still the boiled chicken or grilled chicken. The carne asada is a little on the tough side for me. 

So cheap and so good! A family staple for generations.
author: Alexandra C.

description:
Not much special about Gordo. Is it fast? Yes. Is it convenient? Yes. It is cheap? Yes. Does it blow you away? Not in the least.

Here's my theory about Gordo. If you're craving a burrito and need one immediately and live in the neighborhoods, Gordo is the place to go. It's also one of the few burrito places open on a Sunday... surprisingly. 

I like that I can get my fill at Gordo without spending a whole lot. But to be honest, it's not a great burrito. It tends to be dry, their guacamole is mediocre at best, and it's not a very flavorful burrito. However, I must admit that their carnitas is bomb and the size of the super burrito makes me blush.

When in need of a quick burrito fix, Gordo is on my mind!
author: Junel S.

description:
Gordo's is semi-decent, but there is really nothing spectacular about this place. People keep raving about the food here as if it is the best taqueria outside of the Mission, but quite frankly, I'm unimpressed - or maybe my standards for Mexican food are too high for San Francisco. 

Regardless, as overrated as Gordo's is, it's one of the very few taquerias in the Richmond, so if you're really, really craving Mexican food, Gordo's is not a bad place; it's convenient, fast, and you get good portions for what you pay for. 

What I don't understand is why they use sliced cheese for a burrito? It's a damn burrito, not a chicken wrap from McDonald's. And why do they put very little queso in a quesadilla? I've seen more cheese on a caesar salad. 

Overall, I'll only come back here if I'm desperate... or if I lower my standards for Mexican food.
author: Mark B.

description: Love Gordo's burritos. Super size it! Totally worth it and affordable. Fresh ingredients and everything tastes great.
author: Siosiana T.

description:
If you're from socal, you're indeed going to rave about El Taurino. I've been to El Taurino, and it's seriously AITEEE...i don't get the whole hype. Being from NorCal, Imma rave about Gordos just to follow the trend. 

On the real, Gordos is a Mexican food joint that literally makes my mouth salivate. Something about the subtle melted cheese on top of the thin tortilla, the well-marinated salty chicken, the pico de gallo that's just on point juicy and tangy, the spicy jalapeno sauce that's not too spicy, ALL wrapped onto this big fat (gordo) burrito JUST HITS THE SPOT.
