I'm telling you, despite the autheticity of Mexican-ness, which I'm not even sure of...it's the best burrito I've ever had...and I'm a Mexican food fanatic.

 To me, Mexican food is the type of food that's good even when you're full or hungover. Gordos on the other hand, is just a whole nother story to tell. I'm telling you, idc about no El Taurino or El Farralito, can't beat a Gordo's burrito. I suggest getting chicken over steak with everything on it, extra pico de gallo and jalapeno sauce...and yes I vouch for my obsession for this place..it will NOT disappoint you;P
author: Joyce L.

description: As Real Méxican...if you see a yellow cheese in your TACO...We should  run. ..fish taco...nasty. ..the rest...who knows we left
author: Jakuna M.

description:
Carnitas - great
Green Hot Sauce - great
No complaints about service  - I love this place
author: Laura S.

description: Went there after seeing the ratings , not so great , where is the Mexican spice ???? Very americanised Mexican suiting their taste buds , probably the reason for the ratings , kinda disappointed , nothing to complain though , a little bland for my taste (and I can't take too much spice myself ) , good prices and more of a takeout not much place to sit kinda cramped up as I was there with five other friends ..
author: Sreeram K.

description:
This is the only decent taqueria that I knew of in the richmond. The burritos used to be big with lots of meat and flavor but latey they have been skimping on the meat! The burritos got smaller a little while back but I kept coming anyway for the delicious carnitas, but the last few times I only had a few bites of meat on mine! My very last burrito from here was so greasy it was dripping out of the foil.

I kept giving these guys a chance but I'm never coming back again.
author: Ellie R.

description:
my favorite sleazy burrito. they're made fresh and fast, they weigh about eight pounds, they're juicy as hell, and who doesn't love a steamed tortilla with cheese?

the best no bullshit burrito in town.
author: Cat G.

description:
Came here before going to a Giants game. Service is INCREDIBLY slow so don't go if you're strapped for time. 

I only ate the chips and guac here. The small size of guac is not enough for a bag of chips. If I went again, I would get extra guac or get the chips + salsa and a side of guac. I hate when there is a bad chip to dip ratio. The rest of the chips went into the trash. We wanted to find a homeless person to give it to but the area was seriously lacking (which is usually a good thing haha). 

Their guacamole was awesome. Steady stream of customers the entire time I was there. They don't have enough tables for all their customers though so keep that in mind.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Super Crap Buritto. The most enjoyable part of this meal was the stale chips. Never come here.
author: Aaron O.

description:
Super Carnitas Burrito with beans, pico de gallo, guacamole, hot sauce. Was good. Carnitas was delicious... it's way better than the steak. However, still not that great by SF standards.

We also had the Steak Quesadilla with Sour Cream. The Quesadilla is the way to go... but skip the steak... it was very bland. Can't eat anything from here without hot sauce
author: Zoran L.

description: Another great Gordo's location. In fact, this one is probably my favorite, although they are all basically the same and never fail my needs :-)  Easy parking and generally quicker than others, I will be back again soon for my favorite carnitas in SF!
author: Andy S.

description: Great mexican food, big portions! Love this place. All the ingredients seem really fresh!
author: Mike B.

description:
Gordo makes a mean, GIANT taco loaded with MEAT baby!  Cheap, fast, and friendly service. 

They also have legit hot salsa - thank you for not toning down the jalapeno flavor - some of us actually like the burn! :)
author: Jana S.

description:
Taqueria Can-WHO?!? I hungrily entered Gordo yesterday in sheer desperation while waiting for the bus and apparently must have good Burrito karma cause holy shit their Chicken Burrito put Taqueria Cancun and dare I say even my neighborhood homies Papalote to shame!! The meat was the magical ingredient...so flavorful and grilled to perfection.

Dear Burrito Gods: I am your humble servant. 

Dear Gordo Taqueria: I will be back, and I'll bring my eatin' pants and my gordo posse next time!
author: Serena Q.

description: I am super confused about why people think this place this good. It's a mediocre mexican spot at best. Only good if you are in a pinch. Also, it's cash only which is not super convenient as there is no ATM in site.
author: Morgan B.

description: Very good chicken super burrito in the Outter Rich.  I give a very slight edge to a tier 1 Mish burrito, but if you are out this way this is probably the best burrito in this part of the city.
author: Tom F.

description:
We had a craving for burritos and no desire to go all the way to the Mission, SO we found Gordo in our neighborhood and were pleasantly surprised :D

My bf and I both got carne asada super burritos to go and WOW they were great! Tender, flavorful meat and tasty toppings. And they were still warm by the time we got home. 

Next time we need quick burritos close to home we will definitely be coming back to Gordo.
author: Liz G.

description:
Same as the Geary location, so mediocre mexican food with surly service.

The added bonus of the Clement location is you get to eat off a plank with your nose about three inches from the wall of business cards. 

If you must, take it To Go.
author: Meg W.

description:
This place has won my heart. My new #2 burrito in San Francisco. El Farolito is still untouchable but this is a close second.

Funky looking green(spinach) tortilla is soft and fluffy. Carne Asada is marinated perfectly, and you have your choice of the usual add-ons like beans, hot sauce, salsa. 

What I Like best is the simple ordering menu. No fuss. Just pick your burrito and you're out of there.
author: Chris E.

description:
This place makes an average burrito.  This place used to be my favorite burrito when I was still living in this area as a kid.  But now I have explored the Mission District and Santa Cruz.  I would not mind a burrito from here once in a while though.  

I usually get the grilled chicken burrito.  It's pretty good.  The ingredients are fresh and they do not charge you more if you want extra rice or meat.  

I will be coming here again, whenever I'm in the Richmond.

-1 for poorly wrapped burrito. too wide and not long enough. no homo.
author: Victor L.

description:
This was our favorite taqueria. My wife and I would go every Wednesday night for a bean and cheese burrito (who knows why we picked Wednesday). The staff was always indifferent and seemed too busy to help us but we liked the food and kept going. 

Wednesday Dec 17th at about 6:30pm we went in and the guys behind the counter were involved in a conversation. Even though I was clearly waiting to order they just kept talking. Finally the guy asked for my order. When we got our burritos they were super small like a kid's meal. I didn't really notice until we got to the car when my wife looked at them and went back inside and asked for hers to be remade with reasonable portions. The guy grabbed the burrito and said "chinga puta madre" and reluctantly remade the burrito. I know enough Spanish to know what that means.

When I heard what he said I went back in and forced him to apologize to my wife amid a big scene in front of the other customers.

I hope Gordo's management reads this and disciplines or hopefully fires this guy. Manager: your workers know who he is (the guy who starts the tortillas at the front of the line and wears his hat backwards). I took his picture if you want it.
Anyway, you've lost our business until this cretin is removed!
author: Steven J.

description:
The first time I had Gordo was least than a week ago at the one on Geary. I had been having a tough day, and I just wanted a burrito, man. I heard good things of the place from a friend, so I needed to try it for myself, of course.
I guess I'm boring since I get the same thing every time: (preferably boiled/ shredded) chicken burrito. It's like getting vanilla at an ice cream shop, if you can't get a chicken burrito right, then why bother. 
Final verdict: I bothered all right. 
It was so good, I had to come back, to the one on Clement this time, and the quality of the food is just as great. The service was quick and the servers were nice both times. 

It's dangerous for me to live this close to Gordo.
author: Sarah Grace D.

description:
Excellent burrito place. Beef and grilled chicken are my favorites although carnitas could stand to be a little less salty and a bit more flavorful. There are 2 of them in the neighborhood, the tiny one on Clement St is great too but seating is very limited, it's almost a taco stand. Geary one is larger and has more seating.

Coming up from the East Coast this is certainly better than any Mexican I had over there.
author: G. C.

description:
Gordo was just featured in the top 10 Burittos in the USA Today 

http://www.usatoday.com/media/cinematic/gallery/1778337/best-burritos-in-america/

Gordo in my old SF neighborhood is listed #2 - secret menu item, the corn-tortilla burrito is remarkable. However, it may take several daily visits to convince Gordo to make one for you. (Tip: don't go when it's busy - a long line will rush this work of art and put Gordo on the spot to make one for everybody behind you; How To: six corn tortillas laid out on the foil to start and covered with jack cheese slices to make them stick together when put into the steamer) You don't get as much filling but the hot, steamy corn (masa) creates a tamale-burrito hybrid flavor that will blow your mind.)
author: Matthew S.

description: One of the best burritos I ever had. I order a super burrito with double meat (grilled chicken). With everything including guac. He hooked it up. Although the double meat and quac was extra it was a reasonable price and was very filling. I loved the meat it was very tasty. I went back later that night to get me another one. I totally recommend this Resturant to anyone!
author: Mohamed A.

description:
Little did I know, the taqueria across the street from the room that I lived in while I attended SF State for six months would become the home of my favorite burrito in the world.  My love for Gordo's burritos pre-dates the creation of Yelp.  True story: I once had a full meal at PPQ involving roasted crab and garlic noodles then proceeded to order a burrito down the street from Gordo's and finish it.  And no, I am well within the average weight range for someone my size!

On Friday night, I was stuck in a screening of Alexander Payne's Nebraska at ILM@Presidio, and was seriously contemplating leaving early if Gordo's closed at 9pm.  I resigned myself to the fact that they would be closed, and checked their hours in vain.  I literally whooped and jumped when I saw that they closed at 10pm!  It was one of the most glorious eating experiences I've had in the past few months, and that includes a whole steamed crab and clam chowder from Swan Oyster Depot and dim sum from Koi Palace.  That is not to put down either of those fine establishments.  I thoroughly enjoyed their delectable food.  I don't care what anyone else says, Gordo's on Clement is my number one house of burritos.

For my all-time can't miss burrito configuration, try this: spinach tortilla, boiled chicken, black beans, pico de gallo (salsa), sour cream, hot sauce.  Warning: Stray from my burrito configuration and I cannot take responsibility for your actions.
author: Danny K.

description: 3.7 stars, rounded up to 4. This my first experience eating "NorCal" burritos. It's a little different than what we have in SoCal. It's wetter. Instead of refried pinto beans, the beans are watery. It makes the burrito more wet, but not overly wet. It's loaded with lots of rice and beans. Decent amount of sour cream, guacamole and meat. I ordered the carne asada, because that's what I like to use to compare. I thought this place, the carne asada was a little bland and didn't have the nice charred taste to it. I had the "super" and felt stuffed after. Although I wasn't a huge fan of the meat, I thought overall the burrito went well together. Next time I'm trying the carnitas. I think that's what they're known for.
author: Arnold W.

description:
I heard about Gordo's a few years ago, but never attempted to go there until recently. I am so glad I did!

I love LOVE love Mexican food, especially quality Mexican food. While the burritos seem to be all the rage here, I opted for a super quesadilla with shredded chicken and spicy chili verde sauce. I think this should be the item they are known for. It was one of the best quesadillas I have had. The tortilla had some crunch to it, the meat was flavorful & fresh, the cheese was melted to perfection, and the salsa gave it that extra kick of flavor. Muy delicioso! I highly recommend stopping by for this delightful treat.

AND they take card- awesome!
author: Surge C.

description:
For what I paid for, wow that was really great! 

I got the Beef Supreme Burrito, oh dude, I was stuffed and I still had leftovers! Friendly staff with great prices. The beef tasted amazing, and all of the flavors went together so well. Definitely happy to have found this place and plan to be back whenever I'm craving a burrito!
author: Cara O.

description:
As someone who frequents this joint at minimum once a week for the last 4 months it makes me feel fatigue to write this review.

I believe in consistency.  Giving a place a review based on one visit is extremely flawed.  If you had asked me 3 months ago how I felt about Gordo I would have given 4 stars.  

Instead, if I erased that memory and used the last month it would be 2 max, if not 1.  Why?  

Meat portion.  It used to be very significant portion of the burrito.  And damn good intoxicating flavor at that.  Lately, minimal.

I think it is related to the smaller younger employee who seems to be new.  The portions he serves is extremely small in comparision to the other bigger employees.  Keep in mind I eat 4-6 burritos from them a month minimum so it isn't a one-time ' well bleep ' occurence. 

I noticed it about a month ago and shrugged it off, again, then again last week while getting the mouth-watering steak super burrito.  I came away perplexed at how little meat was in the burrito.  Now today I ordered carnitas super burrito.  I (insert swear word here) you not I only got about half a cup, if not less than a quarter, of carnitas in the whole burrito.  I couldn't even TASTE the meat.  I think he used his fingertips to pull the meat out after he chopped it up.  The remaining chopped amount on table he put on 2 other burritos which I suspect were for employees since there was no line.

And don't get me wrong, the carnitas is very salty, very dominating, and very GOOD.  But if you order the saltiest meat on the menu and you can't taste it?  Something is going wrong.  If I wanted a burrito with nearly 60% rice, 35% beans and 5% meat I would ask for it.  No, I would ask for a vegetarian burrito because that is what it was.  

I take that back. I wouldn't even order a vegetarian. I'll take my service elsewhere if it happens again.  I took a picture of it in the MIDDLE of the burrito to illustrate the point and put it up on Yelp.

Oh, side note, if he is doing that because he was trained to give less, then that is just bad business sense.  Give too much and you get a return customer.  Give too little and you lose a customer completely.  

Signed,

Panda

P.S.: Obviously, I could choose to make it at home, but i'm too damn lazy, why do you think I order a burrito after a long day at work?  Not gonna lie.

P.P.S: When order burrito ask for jalepenos when telling them you want salsa/sour cream.  Not on menu.
author: Jered G.

description:
I THINK this is a chain..but I could be wrong about that.

It's not trying to be more then it is.  It is simply put its a burrito place!  If you want a giant burrito that will keep you filled for days (and you doesn't crave that once in a while) then this is a great place to go to.

If you want anything else...look elsewhere.

Not the best quality, but its crazy cheap...so you don't expect it.
author: Red R.

description:
Pretty small inside. Couldn't really enjoy my burrito inside the restaurant. Typical taqueria restaurant you'd find yourself in for authentic Mexican food. 

It was a plus for me with their choices of whole wheat tortilla, spinach, and tomatoes!
author: Jaycel B.

description:
Good food, clean, fast!

I just got a chicken (boiled) burrito, black beans, rice, & guacamole. 

Chicken was amazing- flavor wise, it was just chicken, nothing special, but texture wise, it was awesome. All white meat, not fatty or chewy bits. I'm VERY picky with meat, and a lot of places will just chop up their meat leaving gristle or fatty bits, but I did not have any of that in my burrito! Delicious! 

If you want some good, solid food, that isn't overly processed or trying to be fancier than it really is, this place is bomb.
author: Ashley H.

description:
I love Gordo's, and especially their burritos.  The filling is always fresh, and they always give more then enough.  They even have healthier options, which what my boyfriend loves.  I must admit that I at first I felt like it tasted a little different.  But once we had it a 2nd and a 3rd time I fell more and more in love.

The service and quality at this one, to me, is better.  And parking isn't as bad as the other locations.
author: Pia V.

description: Delicious And reasonably proved Mexican food! I love that the store has food truck style authenticity inside a store front. Their tortillas are fantastic. I always get the quesadillas which are more like really cheesy burritos because they stuff them with tons of ingredients. The place is pretty small, only has a couple seats, and the menu isn't extensive, but if you're looking for pretty standard Mexican food this is the place to go!
author: Kylie B.

description: We were hungry and didn't want to be let down by the food, so we searched on yelp and we're not disappointed. Well, not fully disappointed. The food was delicious hubby and I both had a chile verde burrito. My son had a cheese quesadilla, and my niece a good 'ol bean and cheese. Totally hit the spot and I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good bite for a decent price. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it's really small and not really a sit down spot. At least not for a family with a toddler because we ended up eating in the car. BUT it is yummy :)
author: Sandrah G.

description:
- They are my neighbours and therefore perfect if I am too lazy to cook at home
- It's fast and fresh food (I always go for the super burrito if I am super hungry)

Go check it out!
author: Daniel J.

description:
I think these were the biggest chicken tacos I've ever eaten. They were a complete mess in the best possible sense. 

Two tacos and a drink, $7.25.   I'll definitely try again. Their Burritos looked delicious.
author: Dusty B.

description:
Super bean and cheese burrito with a spinach tortilla. Add lots of hot sauce. 

You're welcome. 

Parking isn't ideal but your stomach will thank you.
author: Allison P.

description:
Love Gordos.  I go here at least once a week.  Inexpensive and consistently good.  That said, I only have ever gotten the burritos, personally.  Get the spinach or tomato tortillas, they're better than the default regular.

For extra credit, bring someone that speaks Spanish but doesn't look like they would and a pretty girl, and listen closely, they are hilarious the guys that usually work there.. I've never heard anything vulgar, just funny, kind of adorable, they seem like nice guys.

They also seem to always wash their hands when they return from anything, and they have a different guy handling money than handling food, which is crucial to me and oddly rare in small places like this in the city.
author: Eyre C.

description: Ordered the chili verde plate for pick up and it was ready in 10min on a Friday night and only $7! Portions are huge and the food is delicious! Definitely going back again
author: Melissa R.

description:
Nothing special, but great place to drop in if youre hungry and in the area with friends
Cheap, fast, good.
Just nothing special.
Only thing that bothers me is Sour cream and guac is extra $$$$$. 
Rawr! I love sour creeam and guac!!
author: michelle w.

description:
It's a basic burrito place, no bells or whistles. I do appreciate them putting the sizes on the wall so you can see how big the burrito is. Parking can be an issue. 

On a side note, this place must be making a ton of money. It's a small place, mainly a pick-up and go with very low overhead. No wonder they have multiple locations.
author: Mark A.

description: I probably eat here, on average, like 5 times a week. Delicious, cheap, and consistent!
author: Courtney A.

description: Today I came here and there was a couple people ahead of me. The wait was not that long even though there was only one person making the food. I got the chicken super burrito with refried beans, salsa, sour cream and hot sauce. I thought it was lacking flavor. Maybe not enough salsa? A little disappointing.
author: Carmen L.

description: Small portions of tastiness.   I grew up on this place but after sampling other taquerias in San Francisco, this place is 3 stars tops.  However, if you are itching for some Mexican in the Avenues, this place will scratch the itch.
author: Frank C.

description:
Can't say much that hasn't already been said. Basically it's dangerous that I live so close to here. Having preciously lived in the mission I was scared that moving to the Richmond meant not having a delicious burrito in walking distance. Thankfully, Gordo's saved me from that sad fate. 

Go to order: chicken super burrito (carne Asada, my usual protein choice, was sub par when I tried it :/) with black beans (less beans, more rice), all the fixings, and a little of their spicy sauce.
author: Brittany V.

description:
We have come to love this Gordo's location much more than the 9th Ave. one. The pico de gallo is fresh fresh fresh and not soggy. Maybe there's just a teensy bit more love in the food, tho I do not think you would accuse the burrito makers to their face of putting love in anything. They are tough guys with a swagger, these fellas.

So maybe it's not quite as good as a Mission taqueria but this is the outer buroughs and it's the best we got.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I love Gordos! LOL

I've been eating Gordo burritos since I was a little kid and they always make wrap it to perfection. The place is cheap and the mural on the wall is nice to look at.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Gordo represents everything that's wrong with burritos in this city. Expect to get a large helping of rice and beans and then a much smaller one of meat.

Pros: Good guacamole, decent quesadillas.

Cons: Food is pretty flavorless and the Carnitas, which so many people love,
are too salty. No free chips and salsa bar.

This place isn't the worst you could do,
I guess, but it drives me insane how much people love them.
author: Tis T.

description:
If you live in the Richmond district, this is the best place to get a quick fix whenever you crave for mexican food.  
This Gordo's has always had a special place in my heart since I've gone there ever since I was an elementary school kid. It was the place to go with friends whenever we wanted to get something cheap to eat afterschool. My favorite two items to get are the chicken quesadilla + rice or the rice cup.

What's the rice cup you ask? 
It's pretty much a small burrito cup with a combination of rice, beans, your choice of meat. You have the option to add guac/sour cream and hot sauce. If you feel the need to satisfy your mexican craving but dont' feel like buying a whole burrito or just want a snack, just get the rice cup. It's pretty cheap-costing approximately $2 but don't expect to get it for the sole purpose of getting full.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Love gordos. Amazing staff, melt watering burritos, fantastic burrito-like quesadillas, and good selection of yummy toppings.  And the price???Can't beat it! Recommend always sticking the boiled chicken ( grilled isn't great), or of your having a shit day, go big and get the carnitas. Also, can't see on display, but you can get jalapeños and my recent favorite, a whole wheat tortilla!
author: Katie S.

description: The Gordos on Clement is consistently good and the prices make this one of my go to lunch/dinner spots when I don't want to cook.
author: Jen S.

description:
Been coming to this original Gordo Taqueria for 25+ years, since college days.  Its carnitas and th corn quesadilla are the best.
You cant beat the Super Burrito for $6.

I asked them if they use lard (authentic), and they said "Si senior".

Just be careful of the almost foot long 3 inch wide burrito in your stomache after consumig this yummy log.
author: David H.

description: Another outer richmond main stay!!! Love them always consistent and good. 1 star off for the times when they see that you're white and automatically assume that youre gonna have pinto beans, mild sauce and beef. I've been coming here for a while and its been great otherwise. Always a safe bet for lunch on the go!
author: Anthony M.

description:
Yum, Yum & YUMM!  I can never get enough of Burritos -- and I do have to say that out of all the Taqueria spots i've gone to, no one will ever top Gordo!  They get a lot of customers of which most of the time, the line is long... But, they're quick with their service.  

Burritos always come out FAT & every bite is filled with MMMmmm-Ness!!

One thing that I would like to see in the future is for Gordo to have a bigger location and have it restaurant style...

LOVE this place & I LOVE their Burritos!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I'm not sure how clean this place is, but the food is good.
Three male workers in the kitchen. A few seats along the wall and window but don't look comfy. 
Didn't see much difference between Burrito and Super Burrito.
author: Alex S.

description: They put rice on everything, including tacos, which I originally thought was weird, but it works out. From what I've seen and eaten (tacos, burritos, quesadillas), they can't really do wrong. I am a vegetarian, so I can't attest to the quality of their meat (they also don't have al pastor, which is a staple of San Franciscan Mexican cuisine), but from what I had, their tortillas are crispy, the salsa is spicy, the guac is creamy, and the ingredients are plentiful. They pack everything to the brim, and it's extremely cheap. Options are more limited than taquerias in the Mission, but where else are you going to find a spot like this in the Richmond?
author: Danny C.

description: Solid carnitas burrito, fast service, reasonable price. Ratio of meat/salsa to rice/beans would be only improvement, dulled down the flavor a bit.
author: Eric M.

description:
pretty good, I go there a lot.......  would like to rave and rave about this place, but ...  the basics cost extra, like sour cream and guacamole.  It would be a pretty empty burrito without them.  

The burritos are great, and despite not wearing gloves I've seen all the guys wash their hands well after the restroom and the guy that handles the money is never the guy that touches your food, which is a plus, and to me seems like an important thing many places this size don't consider.  It is slightly unfortunate there's no lettuce, but even without they keep me coming back to all their locations on the regular.

I would avoid the corn tortilla items cause corn tortillas always come out gross, especially in comparison to their great tomato/spinach flour tortillas, but that's not  gordo's-specific.

Parking can be tough at this location depending on the day/time..  but that might just be because I am not willing to be one of the assholes that parks illegally out front while waiting in that sometimes long line...

Not much room for eating inside at this location in particular, so I would avoid it.  There's a little stool & bar situation at the window, but if the line gets longer than 3 you're gonna have a crowd standing over you while you try to scarf your rito.
author: dule i.

description:
Pros: Cheap, reliable, tasty
Cons: Little seating options

With a wide range of inexpensive items that will fill your deepest Mexican-American food cravings, Gordos Taqueria sports a homely environment that directly reflects the friendly neighborhood that it is situated in. Yes, it is not as big as the other Gordos that can accommodate a party of 4-5(ish), but the burritos are consistently fresh and tasty. They also have drinks available  should you feel compelled to buy something to quench your thirst. 
Highly recommended if your party of 2 or smaller is looking for a quick fix.
author: Wing C.

description:
When I lived in San Francisco it was a few blocks away from this place, so I used to visit once or twice a week.  Now it's only once a year, which isn't often enough!

I'm a So. Cal (Imperial Valley) native with a taste in mexican food to match.  Most of the taquerias up here don't impress me all that much, but I did like the Gordo's.

My favorite is the special quesadilla, a grilled tortilla with cheese and meat.  Have had burritos and tacos, everything was fine.
author: Frederick H.

description:
Oh Gordo. You are so delicious. What is your secret?

With a few hours left before a friend's wedding reception, I was getting hungry. I wanted to try Taqueria La Cumbre because I was determined to go on a Man vs Food run in SF... However around New Years Eve the traffic inside the city was No Bueno. So my family and I decided to try out Gordo's based on a recommendation. It was very strange going to a local Mexican food shop completed suited up. I know we looked gansta, but we were just hungry and felt like some good Mexican food. 

Surprisingly, there were a lot of customers in the joint, but we happen to enter with no line. Since this was a new place for me, I didn't know what to order. I always hate that feeling whenever I walk up to any restaurant counter and don't know what to get.. because you know this annoys most workers. I quickly scanned the menu and decided to get the Super Burrito All Meat. I thought this would be pre-made order with no options needed, but I guess you need to pick what you want in the burrito. After placing my order, I wasn't sure if the server heard me because of how noisy it was in the kitchen. So, I repeated my order ALL MEAT. So he literally gave me a lit bit of each type of meat. No Rice No Beans No cheese No filling of any kind. I realized I should have been more specific with the fillings. Oh well, this time it worked out for the best. Carnitas, Carne Asada, Chicken, and Chili Verde. 

I took one bite and I was in love. I felt satisfied that if this was my last meal on earth I would die happy. Add this to the list of items to rub in my face if I ever think about become Vegan. There's really nothing special about Gordo its just simple and delicious food. No silly names or brown rice, just a burrito, taco, or quesadilla the way you want it. Maybe it's lard or maybe it's made with love, but this 6 dollar burrito is way better than a lot of expense dishes I have tried. 

I will make sure to stop by Gordo again next time I'm in San Francisco again.
author: Jason L.

description: I love the burritos here, especially because they offer black beans.  I'm not a fan of their chips, although I might've gotten stale ones because I went there in the evening.  Otherwise, this is my go-to place in the Richmond when I want something quick and cheap.
author: Vira P.

description:
Super. Burrito. 

Two words that speak to my soul and cause me to reminisce about my chubby, Marvel-obsessed pubescent years.

You can customize anything and everything and they NEVER skimp on portions. You'll always have more than you need. Some items, like the tomatoes (aka chunky salsa) and guacamole are a bit bland, but the food makes up for their lack of flavor. And like Ray V. says, the bigger dudes give you bigger portions. Always.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I love Gordo's burritos!  I just moved to the area, and my friends didn't speak too highly of the place, but I still went, and thought my friends were out of their mind.  I got the boiled chicken super burrito with everything on it.  The only thing I could complain about is the lack of hot sauce, but that is okay. 
I got some chips and guacamole to go with my burrito.  Very good!
And they take debit card - that is always a plus!
author: Jill B.

description: Yummy fresh food, huge burritos for less than $8.00. My only critique is they have no salsa bar and the hot sauce is good but could be hotter. Very limited menu but a great place if you want a  burrito. Service is good.
author: Kay C.

description: Man, there's nothing quite like an incredible Gordo's all meat burrito after work. I used to eat here all the time. Only four stars since the line is sometimes ridiculous.
author: Richard W.

description: Gordo's is great if you're in need of a quick grab n go. I mean it's not set up for dine in really - classic taqueria. But it's also not that great. I wouldn't come here and expect to experience SF's best Mexican food, but the people are nice and the food is reasonably priced. If you want a killer dine-in experience, go to Tommy's. If you want to grab a burrito for the road, go to Gordo's.
author: Rachel K.

description:
This place makes a fantastic burrito...juicy and full of flavor, and their menu is short, simple, and to the point. But I'm giving them 3 stars because they don't know how to wrap!

If your serving burritos in california and you can't wrap the tortilla tightly and give the customer a fighting chance to consume it all without it all falling out the bottom then you need to take and oragami class or something.
author: Philip H.

description: I gave this place a 1 star. The reason being it got lucky enough to get to 1 was because I didn't die, which is great. I got a super beef burrito. This place is not authentic at all. The salsa is watery and not spicy. Next the beef was very repulsive. There was no actual meat, I was just chewing on fat. Yeah, you pictured it, gross. Next the people in there are not friendly. They give a blank expression and are like next, next, and so on. If you want a burrito avoid this place. It will make you hate this place and make you stop wanting Mexican food. To all the people who read my review and though "aw it can't be that bad". Be my guest and try it out. I'll be waiting for your reply. Enjoy picking another place.
author: Shaneel A.

description:
I have definitely eaten better Mexican food. My carne asada burrito lacked flavour, so did the hot sauce I was given when trying to add a bit of kick.

The price is cheap and you get what you pay for.  If you just want the curb your hunger, this is the place for you. If you want to feel like there is a party is your mouth and everyone is invited, this place is not for you.
author: Sally T.

description:
The food here is great! It's super cheap and yummy. I recommend the rice and beans quesadilla or whatever meat you like. It's basically like a grilled burrito and it's awesome.
The reason for 4 stars, it's super super slow. There's always a line (a good sign) but the guys behind the counter work like molasses. Probably because their work space is so small. So just give yourself some extra time, and expect a longer wait if you order in. 
Funny story: The lady in front of me ordered a burrito with a spinach tortilla, refried beans, sour cream, and guacamole. The guy looked like he wanted to kill himself, but he started slapping down the ingredients. It was the most squishy and floppy burrito I've ever seen.
author: Juliet H.

description:
Sometimes I dream about Gordo's Carnitas.  This place is straight up the best quick Mexican you can get - and with locations all around San Francisco and Berkeley, you can get it all over.  I am one of the least carnivorous omnivores you may encounter, but the meats here are fantastic.  My favorite would be their carnitas quesadilla with everything (I mean it, put stuff that doesnt belong in there, like rice and beans, guac and sour cream!).  

The staff is friendly, the prices are super cheap, the service is quick.  While they have seating, its limited to stools and a narrow counter to eat your meal, so consider grabbing your food and eating it at home or somewhere nice outdoors.  I'd love to see them make a bigger sit down restaurant, but until then, I will continue to come here regularly!
author: Virginia B.

description:
I had a beef super burrito with refried beans and all the fixings. The burrito was super delicious! I enjoyed it a lot. It's up there with all the good burritos I've had in my life. Perhaps not the supreme pinnacle of my burrito experiences, but still a pretty damn good burrito at a great price for this ridiculously over-priced city. I would not describe it as overrated, as some have here in the comments.

The super burrito isn't necessarily super in size, it's about average. So if you want a standard sized burrito, go with the "super". The regular sized burrito is a nice smaller option for people that eat more sensibly. It could be nice to have a "super duper" sized burrito for those that want to binge eat like it's Cinco de Mayo.

Yeah. Go check it out. It's a good place. I'll be back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Kim S.

description:
The burritos taste more like your standard burrito, than Mission style, so if that's your thing, you'll love it.

The plates are the most consistent things on the menu, as far as the serving size and over quality is concerned.

Price point is pretty high for your standard take out burrito joint.

No frills, walk up, order, GTFO kind of place.

If you're looking for a Mission style taqueria, you'll have to go elsewhere, but this place seems to make other people happy that enjoy the more traditional burrito style.
author: Darrell L.

description: Incredibly rude service. At the Berkeley location. The man ask me if I wanted a lewd male body part in spanish on my burrtio.
author: Cloey S.

description: Pretty good for a quick get in get out food run. I get the carnitas all the time and it's a little salty but I love pork so I keep getting it.
author: Peter K.

description: I've never had Mexican food where I'm like, "Whoa, that was the best meal I've ever had!" But, Gordo's sure seems to beat out a lot of the other local, quick taquerias... in price and taste. I'd come here over Chipotle any day.
author: Timothy L.

description: My daughter took us here as it is blocks from her place. It is a takeout  joint and is clean, with friendly employees. We had the carnitas quesadillas loaded. I can only say AMAZING! I will definitely return when I come out for Christmas.
author: cathy s.

description:
My girlfriend once came back from Gordo's with a burrito for me, which I thought was a very sweet gesture. She expressed concern that we would not be able to tell our burritos apart without further investigation. She said, "maybe they labeled the burritos."

The staff at Gordo's slap beans onto the tortilla with the enthusiasm of a listless lunchlady serving up slop to an elementary school student who has just seen her imminent demise reflected in the beaming eyes of the young student that she hates. Of course, it is not the student him/herself that the lunchlady hates, but the idea of lost youth and wasted dreams. There is no way that the Gordo's staff is going to write a big C for chicken on the wrapper of the burrito. That's going to take too much.

You may have noticed I gave Gordo's five stars. That's because it's excellent! Some people may be turned off by the vibe of the employees. Not me. I think it's hilarious!

The burritos are great. The hot sauce is interesting. You don't notice the spicyness at the time, but it sneaks up on you like a barefoot samurai tiptoeing through daffodils on a cold December morning. The minute you are done with the burrito, you'll think, "oh yeah. The hot sauce."

It's good, it's fast, it does not require much to go there. When you get an appetite after reflecting on your useless existence, you can wear the pajama pants you have been wearing for several days and shuffle on down to Gordo's.
author: Ryan L.

description: my absolute favorite !! I live in Sacramento and I'm talking EVERY time I visit the city I have to stop here and get a super carnitas quesadilla with my mother. ever since I was a baby and lived in the city I have always loved this place. never disappoints, always delicious, and always makes me regret moving away.
author: Adrianna B.

description: OMG... gordos is A-MAZING.  For the extremely cheap prices and super fresh food, as well as their fast, yet easy-going service.. this place deserves 5 stars.  It's not that tidy/cleanin the dining area.... but the food is :D
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Quick, cheap and simple! 

The staff is very friendly and are quick. I've kind of became a regular there so they know what I want/like. 

This is just a good place for a quick Mexican fix. I'd recommend it. Their burrito's are huge & tasty. Unfortunately though they steam their tortilla's rather than putting them on a plate, which makes them soggy/sticky. Other than that, great!
author: Helen D.

description:
Burrito was okay but workers there need to have better hygiene. I originally ordered a carne asada burrito and the worker thought I had ordered chicken, so instead of making a new one, he scooped the chicken out of my burrito with his bare hands and tossed the chicken meat back to the chicken pile. This happened right in front of my face! I was very disgusted and felt sorry for the person that will be eating a chicken burrito. 

I will never go there again.
author: Wine L.

description: Phone ordered a carnitas and carne asada super burrito.  Hands down, the smallest super burrito I've ever had.  The burrito was the same size as most regular burritos at taquerias. Was also missing guacamole. Paid $7+ for this? Burrito was also very loosely wrapped.  I'm still hungry. bleh. Yelp has failed me.
author: Rob L.

description: Good quick friendly cheap Mexican.  Wasn't mind blowing but it hit the spot.  Carnitas were better than the green chile we tried.
author: Rich L.

description:
I went here yesterday with the girlfriend to pick up a few burritos since we had purchased a groupon deal ($10 for $20).  We ended up getting 3 burritos (chicken, beef, and chile verde) and chips and salsa. Total was $19.96.

The price was about $5.35 per super burrito which consists of beans (option of black or pinto), rice, salsa (pico de gallo), meat, and then additional sauce (salsa verde, salsa rojo).  The person assembling our burritos asked us if we wanted "additional sour cream and guacamole" which we both thought would be included in a super burrito but to our dissatisfaction no guacamole or sour cream was included.  All the places I've gone to always include sour cream in guacamole in a super burrito..otherwise it wouldn't be super at all)

As mentioned by other yelpers, they use a steamer to not only warm up the tortilla (nice that they have 3 options though; regular flour, wheat, spinach, and tomato) but to also melt the cheese.  I prefer my cheese/tortilla to be warmed on a skillet to get a crispier/harder texture (personal preference). 

The beef was alright (still a little dry), chili verde was good (tender), chicken was good as well.  The chips and salsa (pico de gallo) wasn't bad but still had to pay $1.50 or so for them.  I've gone to places where you can have as much chips and salsa for free.

All in all, it was alright but I've had better. Great if you're on a budget and not expecting guacamole and sour cream in your super burrito.
author: Solomon Y.

description:
"Super burrito with everything" 

"$6"

"Thanks so much" 


This is the sort of dialogue that goes on here, if you come at the right time you can be in and out in under 5 minutes. There really is nothing to complain about, especially given that we are many miles from the Mission. The Cigarette Depot next door has a good selection of drinks and sweets if you are feeling peckish.
author: Owen C.

description:
Gordos is an amazing place where salty deliciousness meets meaty, bean filled goodness.  It's cheap, quick, and never fails the taste buds.  Make sure to order the Carnitas Quesadilla! It's by far the best and if you like crunchy mouthwatering Mexican quesadillas, you're sure to fall in love with this bad boy. 
Just make sure you get it with Sour Cream and Guac- you might not want the added calories, but it keeps the meat and cheese combo extra juicy. Enjoy hombres!
author: Martie A.

description:
Biased

But I blame living so close to the Mission where my biases are purportedly based and yet affirmed on a daily basis when I need my burrito/quesadilla cravings satiated after hitting the lounges/bars late or the morning after ritual with a fat juicy chorizo burrito.

Waited in the long line and when I stepped up to the counter, first off, not as cordial or smiley as the ones I'm use to the ones I hit in the Mission.  The cashier and the preparer were having a negative conversation and it was reflected in their demeanor.  In addition, due to the obvious PC types more aligned in the Richmond as opposed to the Mission, they seemed to be more inquisitive about the fillings and condiments.  Refried versus black beans.  No sour cream.  No avocado.  No salsa.  Mild salsa.  "No, I want a normal quesadilla.  Refried beans.  Sour cream.  Spicy Salsa."  When in Rome, I do as they do.  Which means everything.  Spicy.  Jalapeno peppers.  Plain and simple.

When I walked away, they started asking me what kind of beans.  

"What?  Just refried."

They thought I wanted the black beans.  I said everything.  They asked me if I wanted salsa.  Dang.  What Mexican place does not include salsa with their food?  And when these questions were being peppered, it was done with an air of indifference and sarcasm.  The big dude did not even smile once, tossing the items onto the tortilla with disdain.  If he did not have gloves on, I would have walked out the door.

My giant quesadilla came out flat and not thick at all.  No avocado when I asked for it and the shredded lettuce and tomatoes lacking. The Pollo shredded chicken was tastey but watery and the stewed remains soaked through my tortilla, making it rather inedible.  I ended up just poking and picking out the shredded chicken while the fellow was lucky in that his burrito was a good one.

In reflection?  I probably won't hit this burrito place in the Richmond, although I'm definitely open to trying new places.  I'll just return to the Mission for my usual loud and dirty Taqueria experience with all the yelling and chaos that ensues with the typical staff behind the counter.  "Everything, Miha?"  But it is what I'm use to and what I've grown up with.  That is what I love: the ambiance.

My quesadilla here was mediocre, but when it is being delivered with a frown and put together with a  I-don't-give-a-shit style, my food ends up tasting just as bad.  Maybe we caught them on a bad day.  Given that, I can give them another try soon enough  : )
author: Miika M.

description: The burritos here are always so soft and delicious. Refried beans are excellent here. Not the biggest burritos but they do fill you up. :) Horchatas are pretty good as well and the prices are very cheap!
author: Anonymous ?.

description: This place is great I grew up in the Richmond went back there and I'm happy it's still there great fast food. ...the only thing I would say is it might need a remodel
author: Charles F.

description: There aren't too many Mexican eatery in the Richmond, but Gordo make some best burrito.
author: LL Y.

description: OK food. They should really mind what they say about their customers. Especially in a city as diverse as San Francisco.  They went on and on in Spanish talking smack about their customers.  I normally don't post reviews but this left a bitter taste in my mouth. Not worth a burrito you can find in plenty of taquerias.
author: Jessica P.

description: Been a loyal supporter for over 20 years. I live in SoCal now but this place is a just every time, chicken/steak super burrito...extra green salsa,,,the best,
author: Alan S.

description:
Jesus. $4.95 for a super burrito. NO room for seating, but this place is made for grab and go. With a normal burrito at $4.25, why not pay the extra couple cents for the super burrito? I ordered the carnitas burrito which had that nice crunch to it. Flavor was good, but might have been added with their hot sauce and tomatoes.

I felt kind of dirty eating the burrito because the meat didn't look too fresh, but with the power of alcohol, anything tastes like a million bucks. I also made a good decision and opted out on the guacamole and sour cream, which would have been quite punishing in the morning.

Gordo is good if you're looking to fill up for cheap. I'm not sure they have the best taste, but it's quit a bang for your buck.
author: Michael W.

description:
I'm not a fan of their burritos but they might have the tastiest tacos around (especially after a rather sad nick's way taco at Underdogs :( )

Go for chicken or carnitas, with guacamole, black beans, and spicy sauce. One taco for a snack, two for dinner, three if you're really hungry. 

Their guacamole is great as well, and isn't Chipotle-expensive.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
After reading all the reviews on Yelp I was excited to try Gordo...Unfortunatley that never happened.

I was ordering two burritos, one for me and one for my girlfriend. The very large man behind the counter got very frustrated with me when I asked my girlfriend who was saving us a seat what kind of beans she wanted. He says to his co-worker "waht the fuck" in Spanish. I responded in Spanish and told him that if he had a problem with it he could ask her himself. He then went on to call my girlfriend a "pendeja", which means moron. 

I told him where he could stick the burrito and left. 

I am sure he probably was happy about being able to eat two more burritos, looked like he had had about fifty today alone.
author: Luis B.

description:
Chicken quesadilla only had chicken, and pico de gallo, rolled like a burrito. Soaked by the time I wanted to eat it.

Not flat and folded in two, no chips, no cheese, no sour cream, no guacamole and it cost $4.79? So exactly how much would lunch with chips and a drink cost here? $10?

Go somewhere else.
author: Alexia R.

description: I would call a Gordo's burrito the ambrosia of the gods, but such a platitude would do their Super chicken and steak burrito a grave disservice.
author: Lucas H.

description:
This is my 2nd favorite Mexican joint after El Farolito!! 

Super Steak Burrito w/ Everything 
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/gC4uyjJgxMPeFs9fOvUF2Q/l 

(Tuesday, March 31, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description:
Simple, Consistent and Tasty.

I have never been disappointed by eating here, they are EXTREMELY consistent.
Never been OMG blown away either, but when you're really craving a burrito in the Richmond, this is the spot.

A lot of people claim they know the best burrito place in SF, and it "has to be in the mission". Unfortunately, most mission burrito places are just overpriced and overrated. Tasty for sure, but not amazing. Gordo can hold up to all of em any day.

Basically, everything there is the same, just different shapes and tortillas.

My personal favorite thing to order is the Quesedilla, but just have it with rice as well, making it just a fried burrito.

Service is friendly enough, nothing over the top, never been rude or anything like that.

Out of all the meats, the grilled Chicken is my favorite, but one of the best options is the ALL MEAT burrito. You could probably share this with 3 other people, or be a pig likemyself and try to down the whole thing.

And when they say SUPER burrito, they mean it. Grab extra napkins, and probably a fork too, these things a BIG.
author: Dan B.

description: I have been eating here since I was a kid so this is the ultimate comfort food for me.  I love that they steam the cheese onto the tortilla.  The carnitas are delicious and the chips are addictive.   Great for burritos, but I recommend the gordos plate.
author: Courtney C.

description:
In short: Very good, but inconsistent.

Living in the Richmond, I sometimes crave Mexican without going all the way to the Mission. Mission this ain't, but it's probably the best burritos I've had in the Richmond. 

The carnitas and steak burritos are pretty good, though they don't offer Al Pastor :( 

The wait is also never very long, and the price is quite low for SF. The horchata is good.

However, more than once I've gotten an ingredient cold in the middle of my otherwise warm burrito, which is just not OK. The service seems pretty unfriendly most of the time- not rude, but not warm. That's nitpicky, but it parallels the ingredients within their burritos.

I'd definitely recommend this place if you're ever in the Richmond and want good Mexican, but it's nothing to trek out there for.
author: Ned D.

description:
I love this place! Whenever I get home from work and discover that I don't have anything to make dinner with, and I need something quick and cheap, I know I can count on Gordo's to come to my rescue.

I usually get the super beef burrito with a large drink. The burritos are fresh and very filling!
author: Bernard D.

description:
The food is consistently good, but lousy service is beginning to outweight the benefit. 

Low stars for the two gordos who prepare your food. Gordo #1 renders the tortilas sticky and soggy by oversteaming; it never holds up. You'll need a plate. Yes, I know that spoils the fun. Many pairs of pants have been ruined by hot spillage coming out the sides of the tortilla as it disintegrates or from the bottom of the burrito, not having been rolled tightly.

The two don't listen to you. You have to interrupt their conversation to order. I've never been asked, "What would you like?". I've had them wander away or start talking while I'm mid-sentence. That might even be forgivable if they didn't screw up my order again and again. I usually order the same thing: beef burrito, black beans, NO RICE. The first thing gordo #2 does is reach for the rice. Then, he asks what kind of beans I'd like... EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. Today, I ordered a corn tortilla quesadilla. I get home. It's flour. 

Deaf, dumb, or contemptuous?

I've heard them occasionally muttering in Spanish, making fun of people standing right in front of them. News flash, boys: lots of people speak Spanish!

The Geary store is much, much better. The quality is much better and you'll be treated with dignity. It's not far from the Clement location.
author: S S.

description: Good taqueria. They got all the regular things that a burrito place has. Got carne asada and it was good as well. The thing that is different from the ordinary is that they grab slices of cheese and melt it on the tortilla before putting in your meats and beans. I thought that was interesting. So it's a little more americanized than your average taqueria but it's tasty and reasonably priced. Good place to grab a quick bite or some drunk munchies.
author: Jeromy G.

description: I have been dining at Gordos for over 10 years now and it is still, without a doubt the best burrito I have ever had. I live in SoCal now and still have not found a burrito out here that ever matched Gordos. Everything from the fresh, moist, juicy meats, the awesome black beans to the cheese, salsa and hot sauce. It makes for one amazing meal. You will not be hungry after getting a Super burrito here. They also offer bowls and quesadillas and veggie options. I recommend the Super Beef with black beans. Been getting that for years. I have turned many people onto this place and will continue to recommend it to everyone else I meet. There are at least 3 locations close by in SF. Clement, Geary and 9th near Irving. All of them have tricky parking as does most of San Francisco, so bring a friend. Clement has been the easiest to park at.
author: Michael S.

description:
By far the best location of the Gordos chain this has to be one of my favorite burritos in the world.  I am partial to their burritos since I grew up eating them but I think they would be delicious wither way.  The carnitas are out of this world and they steam the cheese onto the tortilla so it is all perfectly melty.  Love it.  

Good chips, great smooth guacamole and never underestimate the Gordos plate!
author: Cork C.

description: First name comes in my mind when I wish for Mexican Burritos. This place is nice, clean and with completely friendly nature staff. Best in menu for me, as I am vegetarian, Vege Super Burritos. Its really awesome in test and I always carry-out but they have little arrangement for inside eating too.
author: Sawan P.

description: Why is everyone comparing Gordos to taquerias in the mission district? Im not going to drive all the way to the mission district to buy a damn burrito. Bottom Line- Gordos gets the job done.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Grew up on Gordo's beef burritos... literally. I lived about half-a-block from here during elementary. Always good. ALWAYS. Never a dry burrito.

Then I got older and discovered their carnitas burrito. Damn... Why was I sleeping on this deliciousness? Shredded pork in a generous amount, folded up in a big tortilla for less than 5 bucks? No brainer. The super burrito is even bigger. Just as good but for the heftier appetites. Thanks for the years, Gordo's. Be back soon.
author: Chuck D.

description: The super burrito with chile verde in a spinach wrap is good here. The prices are reasonable and the service is fast.
author: Jennie W.

description:
My 2nd fave spot to grab burritos from in the city besides Papalotes. I don't know why I haven't yelped this place before! It is one of my all time favorites! 

Their burritos are soft and and sometimes gushy (i like it like that!). They make the burritos right in front of you adding whatever you like. I always get their Carne Asada burritos. The tortilla is so steamed and fresh! I came here the other day and decided to get a Rice Cup. It's not on the menu, but its only $2.50 and its basically everything in a little cup but the tortilla (salsa, guacamole, carna asada, rice, beans..etc). Honestly it is just as good! I ate it super quick within 5 minutes after purchasing it! It is enough and you dont feel "gordo" after. Their food is always fresh! And every time you bite into their burritos you will leave wanting more.  

The only thing about this place is every time I have come here, it is difficult to find parking on the street! Plus when you do find parking the place is too small to eat in.
author: Katrina T.

description: Chicken taco wasn't really particularly good and I didn't think the salsa had enough kick. I can see from these reviews that I should be getting the burritos so 'll go back and update after that.
author: Misha T.

description: I grew up on Gordo's. The carnitas burrito with black beans, jalapenos, guac and hold the rice... that's the DEAL! Of course, in the Mission you find a cut above on just about every corner... but you shouldn't diss Gordo's on principle just because they are on Clement. Excellent and over-filling quesadillas too!
author: Josh K.

description: Bleech. The carnitas meat was soupy, greasy & flavorless. The guacamole was green paste. Inedible.
author: Akasha A.

description:
Overall, meh!

I visited Gordos based on the stellar recommendation from the Burritoeater Blargh (Burritoeater.com). However, my visit was so disappointing!

My friend and I each ordered Super Beef Burritos. While the burritos were steamed masterfully and packed tightly, both of us agreed the meat was extremely dry. It  lacked moisture despite Gordos' salsa applied to it. 

On top of that, the overall size of the burrito and the portions of beans and rice are substantially smaller than its competitors (from my experiences at Taqueria Cancun, El Farolito, La Espiga de Oro, Pancho Villa, etc). Maybe Gordos pays higher rents than its competitors. 

For real value, it's hard to top Taqueria Cancun's Mojado ("wet") burrito that is 25% larger and includes sour cream, guacamole, tortilla chips and salsa!
author: Mystery S.

description:
the mission meets the richmond.

the burritos are nicely sized, larger than mission's smaller than chipotle's.

the ingredients stack up perfectly so you can taste every element evenly and thoroughly.

parking isn't horrible.

i come here twice a month.
author: Peter T.

description: Excellent pollo asado.  If you get the older gentleman at the geary location, he makes it just right every time.
author: Rat F.

description:
Just OK.
I've had better but its the only burrito joint in walking distance.

Slow service.
author: Courtney S.

description:
Love this place! Always high quality, affordable, great value.
One star off for the line which can be long, but it moves fast.  Wish they had about another 5 locations throughout the city. When you want a quick, filling and delish meal this is my go to spot.
author: Roberta W.

description: Carnitas burrito was delicious . Carnitas cooked and seasoned expertly. Hot sauce was not hot at all. Beef taco lacked a bit in flavor and fell apart making it difficult to eat. Great little dive.
author: Michael D.

description: The Carnitas Superburrito was ok-- not as good and seasoned as the Barbacoa at Chipotle, and the carnitas were a little dry. Maybe next time I should add more salsa. Still, the beans were good and the tortilla fresh and pretty darn strong to hold all that they put in it. I'll try them again but they should really put more seasoning on the carnitas. I actually disagree that the burritos are expensive. They were some of the cheapest I've had. $5.95 for a SuperB is pretty good.
author: Rob W.

description: Other reviewers seem to be raving about the meat selections and I'm sure there good but for a vegetarian this place is pretty much a no go. You can get a bean and cheese burrito but who wants that? If they added grilled veggies or calabacitas or something I could knock it up to a totally passable 3 stars.
author: Stephen F.

description: I highly recommend this place . Always fresh burritos , the stuff is always accommodating and nice .
author: SF G.

description: I started going to Gordo Taqueria in the 80s.  I enjoy their burritos.
author: Karen S.

description:
Totally bummed by my burrito. My question is always, how can you fuck up a burrito that badly?

I'm a California girl and I need my burritos. I know a good one when I see it. Unfortunately I live in the Richmond and don't have many choices when a craving comes along. I've been here twice and both times the carnitas was dry, they jacked me on the guacamole I paid extra for and the entire thing was tasteless and bland. The men who work the counter seem so on mechanical mode that I hardly even get a smile out of them- even when I speak Spanish. I do have to say, I don't think I've ever seen anyone make burritos that fast--which isn't necessarily a good thing.

Basically, I just got back from traveling in S.E. Asia for 2 months and this place did not satiate my craving.

I give it 2 stars because as previously stated, I may be forced to return when burrito cravings hit and I'm too lazy/far away to head to the Mission.
author: Rachel G.

description: Tried this place for the first time and was very happy with it.  Orderd the chicken burrito and hubby got the carne asado one.  Guys were nice, quick and efficient.  Ordering was very easy and food was very fresh tasting! Great hours too. I will definitely be back.
author: Tina K.

description:
This place rocks!  The options are pretty simple, but the quality of the food makes it well worth the trip.  The only reason it doesn't give a five star review is because they only have one food station open late at night and they always have a line. 

You'd think that a burrito place would realize that if they make great food (and they do) that late at night is an obvious time to have a lot of stations open for people coming from the bars, or just looking for good solid comfort food.
author: Seton B.

description: OK Norcal, you've impressed me with your burritos. I think both Norcal and Socal burritos have their own merits, and I enjoy both of them equally. That said, carnitas burrito, pretty damn good. I'd come back/recommend.
author: Penson L.

description:
Gotta love Gordo's. 

Spinach tortilla.
Grilled chicken.
Black beans.
Cheese.
Salsa.
Rice.
Sour cream.

Yep. That's how I roll. 

Good thing I don't live in the city, otherwise I'd be here several nights a week and weigh well over 500lbs.

If they add a carne asada this could go up to 5 stars pretty quick.
author: Liz K.

description: Quesadillas are huge.  Burittos are good.  they need to be open late so we can have it after clubbing.
author: Kurt N.

description: Pretty good burritos for the Inner Sunset.  Obviously cant quite compete with restaurants from the mission, but they do a pretty good burrito.  Carnitas super burrito is pretty good, and I also like their tacos al pastor, though that can be hit or miss depending on how long the meat has been cooking for (sometimes it gets kinda dry and chewy).  Pretty good deal for the price.
author: Max L.

description: I used to love Gordo's, but lately have been somewhat dissappointed. The last few times I've been there, the food has been overly salty and yet lacking in flavor at the same time. The burritos are not as large as they used to be and the flavors just don't compare to the many other better options that are available throughout the city. Other branches of Gordo's may be better, but I wouldn't count on it.
author: Iknowasianfood C.

description: For some reason I like this Gordo location better than the one on Geary. I had a decent quesadilla here that included guacamole and sour cream. The hot sauce was good, but was not supplied in a generous enough amount to satisfy my craving past all the cheese on the quesadilla.
author: Austin P.

description:
There's a reason I've been coming here for 21 years!  After preschool, at the tender age of 4, I would demand that my mom or dad take me to gordo's.  Most ignorant children would want a happy meal because they wanted their baby Fozzie toy to complete their muppet babies collection or their Kit Cloudkicker figurine to join pantsless Baloo.  Well, not me!  I valued a good burrito then and treasure a great burrito now at age 25.  Even when I lived among the hispanic people of southern California, explored the different taqueria's of the Mission district, my stomach and heart still yearn for the tender love of a Gordo's burrito.  

My personal favorites are the super steak or super carnitas burritos with everything on it.  The chicken isn't bad either, but i highly recommend the tender, juicy steak or the flavor-packed, not too salty carnitas.  If you feel like pushing Mexican food to an instant heart attack, get the quesadilla put everything on it as if you're filling up a burrito! Delicioso!

As a seasoned Gordo veteran, here are my tips and recommendations:
-get one of the fatter dudes to make your burrito cuz they hook you up and they drain the beans and meat more so that it's not as messy [unlike the some of the skannies]
-if you're low on cash but want some sugar, just get a water cup and fill it with soda...i confessed to the owner's daughter that I used to do it in grade school and she was cool by it
-eat in and enjoy the custom, one-of-a-kind patented leather weave stools
-don't stare at the mural on the wall of the half naked mayan people while you eat...eyes on the prize
-hit up the other 4 gordo's locations around the bay...same great burrito...i promise!
author: Ray V.

description:
It's cheap, but that's about all that they have going for them. The food is bland and the burritos are limp.

Be sure to know what you want to help speed things up. Also, I would suggest trying the quesadilla which is basically a crispy burrito.
author: Alfonzo J.

description: This place delivers great mexican food.  Im not sure if its the best but its consistent each time.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Yum Yum! A great burrito outside of the usual Misson suspects. I love their super beef or carnitas burrito in a spinach wrap, no beans please! I like that they don't charge extra for the fancy flavored tortillas and that their portions are huge. The burrito has a good amount of heft to it. OH CARNITAS HOW I HEART YOU. The swine makes me blush! I get especiually giddy over the crispy bits you get when you bite into perfectly cooked carnitas. Pig lovers - you know what I'm talking about.
The quality of the meat is excellent (not a lot of fatty gristle) and the flavor of their rice is superb. Its the perfect fast food that doesn't make you feel too unhealthy. Quick and cheap right in the hood and the guys who work there are so friendly. Loves it.
author: Stacy T.

description: Came by with my dad to pick up lunch after I got my nails done down the street. The menu isn't as large as your typical taqueria but it gets the job done. I ordered the carnitas burrito and my dad had the carne asada plate. I was pleasantly surprised by the carnitas because it wasn't salty! I normally avoid ordering it for that very reason. My dad ended up finishing his plate over two meals because there was so much food (he's a big guy too). The carne asada was very tender and flavorful. Don't come here expecting all the fancy extras. A super burrito is just a larger version of the regular burrito instead of being filled with sour cream, guacamole, salsa, etc. If you can appreciate simple but flavorful food though, this is your place. The food here doesn't need all the extras.
author: Sarah L.

description: Simply put: Gordo's is the best take-out/easy Mexican food in the city. Perhaps anywhere. They are cheap, fast, and delicious. Their carnitas is the best I have ever found. I don't like compound sentences. Order a quesadilla (flour tortilla) with carnitas, add beans, rice (basically makes it a burrito), then lots of tomatoes and hot sauce, and add guac and sour cream. Done.
author: Michael B.

description:
What happened to this place? 

The walls, tables, and seats were dirty. I felt like the place hadn't had the walls and floors scrubbed in years. 

The food...It used to be better or maybe now there are more places to compare it to.  I just did not want to be there after giving my order and the guy telling me I didn't want what I ordered.  

Oh well.  Maybe I'll try it again in a year.
author: Jason C.

description:
I really, really want to like this place because I LOVE BURRITOS. But alas,  I don't and would just not eat than waste calories here. 

My husband and I came here for dinner last night. When we got there, the line wasn't even that long. Five people were in front of us but we waited in line for about 20 minutes before it was our turn. I've never seen people work so slow, I could have sworn time was standing still. In the time it took them to make a burrito I think I could have made 10 of them.  

Finally our turn to order. I get the regular steak burrito with the spinach tortilla which comes with rice, beans, meat, pico de gallo, and salsa. My burrito was so sad looking because it was so so small. I've never seen such a small burrito, I think it was made for kids. My husband gets a quesadilla with carnitas, rice, beans, guacamole (which is $0.75 extra), pico de gallo, and salsa (basically a grilled burrito). 

My burrito was not satisfying or good at all. If I liked wasting food while people were starving, I would have thrown it away. The rice was bland, the meat was not even close to flavorful, I needed more pico de gallo and hot sauce (which wasn't even good in the first place, I just needed more flavor some where). I was still hungry afterwards. My husband said the carnitas was dry, choke down the throat dry. 

I really can't believe a burrito place in California does this well. I should open one too then since it doesn't seem to require much to make a burrito. I would rather go to Taco Bell than get a burrito here in the future.  

Service is slow, price is decent, but for the quality, I would rather cough up a few more bucks for something better.
author: Lang T.

description:
Ah Gordo's.  This is my go-to spot for a quick meal at any time of the day.  I love having them right next to where I live.  Their burritos are the BEST!  

The guys who work here make burrito-making a true art.  So efficient, and they always put just enough of every ingredient.  Boiled chicken is so, so good.
author: Justin L.

description: This is one of my favorite Taquerias in the bay area.  Their quesadillas with boiled chicken or carnitas done extra crispy is my go to order...it never lets me down. Simple, easy, awesome...
author: Derek S.

description:
I used to come here all the time when I went to school a few blocks away. The prices were perfect for a youngin' that still received allowance. As an adult, I have come to appreciate the combination of flavors that have a party in my mouth. The prices are still dirt cheap. I feel I'm robbing them every time I go, but hey. 

I usually get a carne asada or canitas super burrito or quesadilla and a red jarrito. The salsa and chips are good too but be careful, the heat of the salsa is a creeper.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Super Burrito = Super DANK! 

After fiendishly needing a cheap, quick fix to an empty stomach and marijuana-induced hunger panic, Gordo Taqueria on Geary saved the day with an extremely satisfying meal.

I chose the Super Burrito, because I need cheese with my burritos, and also added sour cream. Carnitas was the prepared meat of choice this visit, although more often than not I choose chicken when eating mexican food. It surely didn't disappoint. The pork was tough, and meaty, just the way I like it. It wasn't too salty and tasted fresh. It was chopped up right in front of me seconds before being laid onto the tortilla.

The chunks of tomato in the salsa were bright red, and a very tasty and refreshing addition to the rice and pinto beans. The rice and beans were also very good tasting, and had the perfect proportion to the rest of the ingredients (ie It didn't feel like I was munching on a log of bean and rice with small chunks of dry chicken every now and then).

I purchased a small drink to go with it, and opted not to pay extra for chips and salsa. All in all it was under $7! 

The one, albeit small, problem that I had with the burrito was the tortilla itself. I don't know whether it was steamed too long, or not long enough, but something wasn't right. It tasted alright, however, a little bit of it got stuck to my teeth with every third bite or so. I've experienced this "difficulty" at other burrito joints, so it's NBD. It wouldn't have gotten five stars in my book, even if the tortilla was better.

This was my first time, surely won't be my last!
author: Brian G.

description:
Edit: 5-18-08: 4 stars

I ordered the regular carnitas with salsa, beans, and passed on the rice and cheese.  This time around, I enjoyed my burrito way more.  Definitely satisfied.  My friends, who have never been here before, enjoyed their super burritos.  Convenient location to my apartment, and the line that went out the door during the lunch time hour definitely  says a lot about their burritos. 
___________
Horrible! What a waste of $10 for two very dry, small and plain burritos. They did not even have bell peppers or onions!!! (*Note: Cheese is extra charge). The person who made our burritos didn't even understand English! DEFINITELY had WAY better burritos than this dump. Never coming back again. 

PS. If it were possible...we'd give them half a star for trying!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Delicious burritos and very, very speedy service..

I was literally in and out in about a minute and a half.  Real delicious and CHEAP burritos.  Size of the burritos aren't too big but just perfect for a nice lunch/dinner.  The carnitas are nicely seasoned and full of flavor.  The lines for this place are crazy sometimes so a big plus for them having such speedy service.
author: Chai S.

description: The burrito are good but I find it's heavy on the rice and beans, light on the meat.  It seemed like everyone getting the hot sauce added to their burritos. Since I've never been there, I didn't get it. I found my burrito (carne asada) lacking flavor and wondering if the hot sauce was the missing link.   Overall the burrito was good but not the best. They do offer Spinach, Tomato or Whole Wheat tortillas for an extra charge.
author: Michelle A.

description: I've been spoiled by the East Oakland taco trucks and their variety of meats, but Gordo's is solid.  The carne asada is extremely flavorful.  The only thing I dislike is how thin their tortillas are.  The burrito will fall apart to hell.
author: A L.

description:
Ah, Gordo Taqueria. This was my one-stop burrito stop when I first moved down to the city. Conveniently located just two blocks down from my front door, I quickly became a Gordo fanatic. Being a broke-ass SF resident, I Gordo was a lifesaver. After all: the portions are ginormous, the ingredients are fresh, and the price is oh-so-right. There was a week, or two, where Gordo was the one real meal I ate -- and for that, I'll always be grateful.

The only downside? Flavor. As far as Mexican joints go, this one is a little on the dull side. That being said, if you're not afraid of a little spice, ask them to throw on their *SECRET* red hot sauce, as well as their salsa verde, you're taste-buds will get a little weak in the knees. Add a little of their homemade guacamole and you may have just found the best budget burrito in town.

My menu item of choice? A super polo asada burrito on a tomato tortilla, loaded up with all the amenities: black beans, Spanish rice, sour cream, pico de gallo, salsa verde, red hot sauce, and jalapenos. Mmm-mmm, fuckin' delicious.

TL;DR -- Highlights include: various tortillas, large portions, affordable prices, and drool-inducing hot sauces.
author: Gabriel S.

description: I love Gordos. Cheap, huge burritos with really good meat
author: Kevin M.

description:
This is hands down my favorite taqueria. I've been coming here since I was a wee lad in elementry school, 25+ years ago(...actually just down the street from this place). Ahh...such memories! I used to get a super carnitas burrito AND a carnitas flour quesadilla (yup, I ate both at the time!) before balling it up after school in the yard(kick/war or hand ball)!

Well, times a changing...I can't eat both anymore. Thankfully the taste has not changed. Both the super carnitas burrito and carnitas flour quesadilla I normally order, taste the same as I remember it when I was a kid. (Maybe a very slight difference...and that it's not as greasy nowadays as I remembered it. I guess due to health consciousness.)
