One of my favorite things about this place, the carnitas flour quesadilla...it tends to seep a liquid (not thick nor light) tasting of cilantro, tomato, onion, and grease from the cheese and carnitas that tastes of....I dunno...something of awesome goodness! Man, I tend to sip that stuff from the foil!

I love me some good carnitas, and these guy here do it right. Not too dry, good texture, great taste.

Also, this location (which is also the original location)  is different/better then the other two locations in SF. Why?...because the guys that work here are bigger then the workers at the other locations!...even though it's a small place. Why do I say that? It's because of a theory I have. My theory is this. At a taqueria, you get a better/bigger burrito, or what not, depending on how big the guy/gal who is putting together your order. A big/huge guy/gal makes a bigger/better order, whereas a small/tiny guy/gal makes a smaller/not so great order. Ponder this, a bigger person makes a better burrito or order because they like to eat! They put it together as how they would make it for themselves. They are hungry, and will not hold back!...whereas a smaller person has a smaller appetite, they will hold back. They will not put together an order which they would not eat or finish for themselves. I call this the FAT=PHAT! theory.

Long story short, try this place out. If it's not one of the best, then at least expect a very solid (or more then) taqueria. This is a very tiny place, no thrills, no nothing,,,,just a straight up good taqueria. 

Enjoy!
author: Paolo V.

description: Not happy at all. After reading good reviews of this place, I went there today and ordered a carnitas burrito. Big scoop of beans, big scoop of rice. Not enough meat to even taste. I should have said something when I saw the guy put a thimbleful of meat on it, and didn't say anything, but now that I've had a few hours to let it sink in, I'm taking the only recourse I have and telling everyone tat there are many, many better places to go in SF, and I'm a native whose been eating at burrito places in this city for 40 years. Thank you.
author: Sean E.

description:
I just don't get it.  I've had so many better burritos - this is just not that special.  Try papalote or chipotle (or any one of the places in the mission) - you will be much more satisfied. 

It was inexpensive, fast and a big portion, but wouldn't you rather spend a couple of more dollars getting a really satisfying and tasty burrito?
author: Natasha T.

description:
Ordered a carnitas super burrito, thing is when you want everything on it, it adds like 2$ to the price of the current burrito. Not cool. The pork looked dry as hell, but it was actually pretty flavorful and not as dry, big problem was that they hardly added any pork to the burrito. 
-Basically a decent sized burrito made with A TON OF RICE, beans, lots of sour cream and guac, and very little meat and salsa. Also, NO SALSA BAR AND FREE CHIPS.
author: Alek M.

description:
Mmm! Love Gordo's. If I'm in SF during the day, I usually try to hit up one of the Gordo's.

Always delicious. Parking is tough. and not much seating at this location. Ideal for pick up while someone sits in your double parked car.
author: Kelly B.

description:
We didn't feel like cooking tonight so on my way home popped into Gordo's on Clement Street and ordered two steak super burritos and two bags of chips - cost $14.45.

The burritos were tasty, chips not as fresh and I think they overcharged me a few bucks.  Oh well...
author: Rich W.

description:
The closest burrito place SF has to my once favorite Boston stop, Anna's Taqueria.  The quesadilla is great and the burritos are big.

I rarely get anything other that carnitas since it is so good.  The only way to make it better for me would be more cilantro and some limes.  They're very accommodating to just serving me the meat with fixin's so I can eat paleo.

Great meal for a great price.
author: Jeff S.

description: Love Gordo's super burritos! Don't expect much in terms of chatting/ ambiance but the food is delicious. We especially love the boiled chicken super burritos- so juicy!!!
author: Whitney T.

description: A neighborhood classic.  The staff is really nice and the food is good.  Can't beat the price of the food.  The burritos seems to be the healthy version of a burrito.  It's no Poncho Villas or anything but it's still good for the price you pay.
author: L C.

description:
Bes authentic mexican foods.
Been to many mexican restaurants and I must say this burrito is the best and not dry.
Huge serving portions plus price is reasonable.
Clean casual place.
Miss it, want some now.
Try ordering large carnitas burrito with cheese, guacamole, sourcream, salsa...mmmmmmmmmm. bona a petit.
author: Noucha A.

description:
I ordered the super quesadilla, carnitas on wheat. It was damn good! Beans, cheese, guacamole, sour cream and hot sauce topped it off perfectly. 

I also "shared" a carne asada super burrito and I beasted that as well. Best burrito I have ever had in SF....

5 stars!
author: BYRON D.

description: Gordos!!!!!!!! lolz i've been to gordo taqueria since i was in middle school and it's still the same, i like the clement location the best irving st. location is ok but they give you less... if your looking for a fast take out mexican spot this is the place
author: jonathan h.

description: I eat here about 3 times a month (girlfriend's edit: "more like 3 times a week!"). It's good, but I'm a San Diego taco snob and it doesn't meet my high standards for dirty street food. The burritos are the standard SF style. Read: everything in the kitchen sink. I prefer the Gordo plate- carne asada (or whatever meat), rice, beans, salsa fresca, sour cream, guacamole, and 4 tortillas for under $7. They give you a ton of fillings, so the secret trick is to buy your own tortillas and make a bunch more tacos at home. Hah!
author: Peter T.

description:
OMG GREATEST BURRITOS EVER IN SF!!  i've acutally never been to the location before..my friend always picks it up for me when he's down there and delivers it to mi casa!  yes i know..i'm spoiled..but i hate driving in sf!! 

anyways..i always order the carnitas super burrito and boy is it DELICIOUS!!  they're SUPER big so it can serve as three meals for me!  (yess..cheap food.)  it's also perfectly moist..the carnitas isn't too salty either (like most places i know)
author: Kristen T.

description:
Good taqueria in the Richmond. This is my go to place when I don't want to travel all the way to the Mission. This location in particular is also better location than the one on Geary because they're not shady at all with the meat portions and are way friendlier (just my pro-tip).

Gotta get the super burrito with extra chile sauce every time. Thumbs up.
author: Tay R.

description:
Dear Gordo, thank you for being so delicious in my belly. If you've ever read my friend Kristen T.'s review, she is absolutely right about the carnitas burrito. 

It's delicious, not too salty, not too greasy, and they give you a LOT of it. The name of the place pretty much describes the size of their burritos. They are VERY gordos!

QUALITY: BIEN! MUY BIEN! Chips are good, too!
QUANTITY: A lot. It's called "GORDO" for goodness sake! If you don't know what that means....it means "fat".
PRICE: Cheap. There is no excuse NOT to buy one of these when you're in the area. ESPECIALLY if you're visiting San Francisco.
SERVICE: There isn't much talking between me and the guy I buy it from, but he seems pretty nice. I give him a thumbs up.

When you buy a burrito from here, make sure you come with an empty stomach. You won't regret it.
author: Daniel M.

description:
Gordo's burritos encompass life and happiness wrapped in an enigma (how can something so simple possibly taste this good?) wrapped in a tortilla perfect for your mouth! Seriously. Your taste buds will leap and dance! 
I've eaten at a few Gordo's around SF and what keeps me coming back is consistency. Always fresh. Always appealing. Always great-tasting. 
SF is in need of more great Mexican food places. Gordos delivers that need with efficiency and generous portions!
author: joanna r.

description: Not all Gordos are created equal. I have sampled, this one is by far the best, the one on Irving rolls loose sloppy burritos, the one on geary seems to have things sitting out longer. This one on clement is always fast, things seem fresh, choose this one you won't be disappointed.
author: Dan M.

description: Amazing authentic burritos...drooling just thinking about it. You get a lot of food for the money. I honestly don't think I have had better.   this place rocks..definitely worth the wait if you run into a line.
author: Kristine R.

description:
I will keep this as short as possible:

1.  i grew up on this place...started off as a young buck in middle school who couldn't afford anything so had to settle for the $1 rice cups and share with my best friend...we literally got 2 spoonfuls each and rock paper scissored for who could lick the cup clean

2.  "quasidilla with boiled chicken, extra sour cream please..o btw...make that 2 of 'em"

3.  the boiled chicken makes the burrito/quasdilla very wet and juicy

4.  gordos runs in my veins...i take everybody here and stoutly refuse to admit there is a better mexican joint...i'll defend gordos to the death...some call me foolish, some call me ignorant., some call me stubborn..i call it principles and loyalty...i wave the brown gordos banner 'till my arms don't function no 'mo
author: Brian V.

description:
It can be kind of weird.  There's a protocol you have to learn.  If you try to jump the protocol, they don't really play along.  Just go, learn, and observe.  Then it will flow.  

They call the chunky salsa  "tomatoes."

Enjoy.  It is very wholesome, and a great value.  Sometimes I'll get the "tomatoes," sometimes I just get the "chile," or thin hot sauce from a squirt bottle.  The guacamole is excellent.  The corn quesadillas are an incredible value; they really pile them with meat.

The seating is too low, too little, too crammed, but, with the caveat about the "protocol," this is a fantastic hole in the wall.
author: Inda N.

description: The food looked good as I ordered, but the beans, rice, and chicken lacked flavor.  Food is definitely in need of some cumin and salt among other ingredients. Chips were good.
author: Nska52 C.

description: In my quest for an amazing burrito in SF, we tried Gordo. It was ok. Not much to really write about. Service wasn't great and the burritos were just O.K.
author: Kari D.

description: If you can finish a Gordo plate, you will be well on your way to becoming gordo (pleasingly plump) as they serve huge portions.  I ordered the chicken gordo plate and the hubby had the chile verde.  Each meal came w/ four corn tortillas.  My leftovers are enough to feed two people!
author: Janet S.

description:
I've been going to Gordo's for years, so I'm a bit surprised that I'm not gordo myself. 

Their burritos get down to business. They are unpretentious, wet, and sloppy. Choose a size: small or super. Choose a meat: carne asada, green chili pork, boiled chicken, grilled chicken, etc. Add salsa and hot sauce. Sour cream and guacamole accrue extra cost.

The staff is neither friendly nor mean. They've formed a camaraderie with each other from the years of serving gringos.

This location is too cramped for eating inside, though they have a little booth. If you actually want to eat inside, consider the nearby Gordo's on Geary.
author: Nik D.

description:
Oh, Gordo's.....How I love you so.  You are one of the few places I would wait in line foreverrr and a day for (although I may have to kill some people standing in the way of my burrito before I ever get to that point).  I have heard of mouthwatering "real" burritos in the Mission....but let's face it, I live in the Richmond District, and there's no way in hell I'm gonna drive that far.

Gordo's will never fail me.  I love that everything is customizable, as I am uber-picky about what goes in my burrito.  Even a single ounce of beans in my burrito will pretty much ruin my day.

I looooooove the quesadillas, but I cannot possibly eat that much fried food..... Okay, I'm totally lying. I would, but the quesadillas get a little too messy.

My usual order: burrito on tomato tortilla with cheese, chile verde, rice, extra salsa, sour cream, extra jalapenos.  If I feel like being healthier, I'll switch it up to a wheat tortilla.  But F that, make it a Super Burrito please!
author: Betty W.

description:
Best burrito I've had sober.

It's greasy, but manageable.  Large, but not expensive.  Really tasty chicken, super burrito-- I think I'll give the carnitas a try next time.

Quick and painless ordering/construction time.  Check out this small and humble shop if you're ever way out here.
author: L J.

description: I went back after almost a year and the chile verde still tasted like rubber, and very salty.... Still don't like it and won't be back again.
author: Sfscubaman T.

description:
What more can I add to the list of compliments for this little place that make delicious burritos and tacos and more. Always friendly service and quick . 

It is consistently good and a neighborhood favorite !
author: C. H.

description: Awesome burritos! Nothing fancy-schmancy about them but always a great burrito. I absolutely love the rice...yummm! I've been to this location multiple times and also recently got a Gordo burrito at Outside Lands and the quality was exactly the same.
author: Gina C.

description: Hole-in-the wall place where they serve super delicious burritos, I prefer this one over the one on Geary and 18th/19th avenue because they give you more meat!!!!  Like some other reviews have said, they should warp the burritos better so you don't have pico de gallo, rice, and meat falling all over the place.
author: Dustin W.

description: Great for quick food. The poultry and beef are not dry. One of my favorite places. You know a burrito is good when the juices drip when you bite into it. The hot sauce is good too. Depending on time, however, parking may be a little hard to find.
author: Sylvia V.

description:
I like Gordo's burritos (3-stars), but definitely have had a lot better relative to flavor, size, and price.

What I'm a big fan of are the Gordo's Plates (4-Stars). Wow, what a meal deal! For a little over $6, you can get a to-go box filled with meat (beef, chicken, or carnitas) beans, rice, pico de gallo, jalapeno peppers, hot sauce, sour cream, and 4 hot corn tortillas. 

Top off with margaritas made at home and you have a fabulous "value meal".
author: Kimbalee W.

description:
The first time I've ever tried Mexican food was at Gordo's.  I've been going here since I was 5 and it has always been my favorite after school snack stop.  Sixteen years later, I still think Gordo's has the best quesdillas and burritos.  Gordos is not the most authentic mexican food, but their fast service, mouthwatering burritos, and perfectly crisp quesdillas make up for it.

ahhhhhh I WANT A GORDOS BURRITO NOW
author: Maggie L.

description: OK place. Chips aren't included with meals, prices are average along with the quality of the food. Also, didn't see a health score card posted like they are supposed to and they don't wear gloves to prepare the food.
author: kyle d.

description: I have been going to Gordo's for over ten years.  Their food is always fresh and super tasty.  Their great prices and food put them near the top of my list of best SF burritos.  If you want something different, try the carnitas super quesadilla!
author: Caleb K.

description:
They say you never forget your first...

As an outer Richmond girl (33rd & Geary ba-by) Gordos was the first taste of my long love affair with Mexican food.  Yeah sure, hipsters (oops, I mean people) try to compare them to all the usual places in the Mission,and maybe, just maybe, the Mission joints are better, but REAL San Franciscans who have a connection to the Richmond District have a special place in their heart for Gordos. 

To me Gordos is the taste of afternoon volleyballl games, Evening choir practices with Sister MJ, Friday night slumber parties giggling over NKOTB and care free Saturday's spent rollerblading in Lincoln Park with my best friend Taj. 

Its what Mom brought home for dinner the day of the '89 eathquake and Dad's fail safe lunch option when it was 'his' weekend.

Yeah, yeah, i know, this review is totally sentimental, but the meats & veggies that go into their burritos / quesadillas are all so deliciously fresh and flavorful, its a taste you'd recognize anywhere. The guys who make them are insanely fast, and work together like a well oiled machine (with a few chaffs in between).  

I've had my fair share of burritos up & down California, even across the country, and though many of them are arguably good, none of them are as memorable as a Gordos burrito / quesadilla. Its one of the things i miss most now that i'm in Oakland, and i nearly pissed myself with glee when I found the one on College Avenue.
author: Kris R.

description: Not sure why but it just didn't taste right. The texture was off, like everything was sitting around too long. Regular burritos start at $4.25, and Super burritos start at $4.95. But the price difference is more of rice and beans. Like most places if you request super they throw in sour cream, guac, and cheese, NOT gordo's.  Spinach tortilla, sour cream, guac and cheese will cost about $.30 to $.50 EACH. So if you want your burrito to come out like a mission burrito it comes out to $7-8 for a burrito. I've been to the 9th and Lincoln location and it was way better. 9th has tables where clement only was booths.
author: Robin L.

description:
I'm from LA, so I am used to very authentic Mexican food. Since moving to SF I have yet to find great Mexican food, which is slightly depressing. 
Thank God for Gordos! 
Big, fresh burritos for under 5 bucks?! Yes please! 
I'd suggest the Carnitas or chicken super burritos. Can't go wrong!
author: Amy B.

description:
Er..I don't know how this place gets such good reviews...seems pretty mediocre and bland to me.  Where's the sabor?!  Not many other taqueria choices in the neighborhood though...

Dang I wish Castillo would open up shop in The Richmond.
author: J. V.

description: No doubt, the food is cheap and great, but the employees appear to be miserable captives in a Mexican fast food serving gang. Even if I hated my job I wouldn't  be indifferent to the customers.
author: Morgan S.

description:
Gordo's has the best burritos ever!

First time I tried Gordo's was in middle school... It was so good! I always get the chicken burrito and it never ever disappointed me. I'm so glad this place is around my neighborhood. Regular burrito is about $6 but that's when you put everything in.
author: Vivian L.

description:
this place is really a 2.5.  It is so-so at best.

he reason I give it a low score is because it is not good given the other options in northern CA.

You can easily find better mexican in San Jose. There are a handful of Mexican joints in Stockton with better food.
author: Jeremy R.

description: After moving to San Diego I realized that I miss my friends....and Gordo's. Every time i'm back in the city this is my first grub spot. So here's the deal, I have been going to this place for 15 years. If you want the best thing ever from here, get a "quesadilla burrito", as I like to refer to it. They toast the tortilla to perfection, melt the cheese and then you get to put your usual whatever you want into it. So much better than just the plain tortilla. Oh, and ask about their spinach and tomato tortillas if you want to change it up. By the way, "gordo" means fat, so don't go here if it's a Monday or the first of the month and you've started your occasional fad diet ;)
author: Rina C.

description:
I've never been to Gordo's until now.  I just don't believe taquerias outside of the Mission.  But SOMEONE was fiending it so we went.

For the burrito:  The beans looked strange, looked hard, not mushy enough. Eh...and if you don't ask for hot sauce there is none given....very very strange.

For the quesadilla:  Skin was extra crispy, and wrapped perfectly...forgot to ask for hot sauce...UURRRGHHH!
author: Jenny K.

description: Fresh ingredients, fast service, BEST CHIPS&SALSA&BURRITOS. What more can you ask for? Gordo is golden.
author: Mileti A.

description:
I grew up on Gordos' carnitas quesedilla - the quality was good then and it's still good today.  This restaurant does not believe in the 'less-is-more' theory.  The price is good and their food is fresh.  

There's a reason why the line is out the door most of the time.
author: Reese M.

description: After a bike ride through the city and across the Golden Gate Bridge, we ended up here for lunch.  I had the steak super burrito and it was less than average.  It was dry and the steak didn't taste fresh.  Also, how is it called a super burrito if sour cream isn't included.  I'll stick to the burritos in the Mission district.
author: Ricky M.

description:
I'm sorry, I'm one of those people who are NOT fans of Gordo.

I know there's a facebook group and shiz for Gordo fans, but sadly, I'm not one of them.

Not exactly cheap, not exactly great quality, not exactly flavorful, not exactly a fan. I'm pretty sure I've seen dirtier (hello, Mexico), but seriously, coming from Los Angeles, I've had much, MUCH better Mexican food at cleaner joints.
author: Tori S.

description: Fresh chopped tomatoes and tender chicken over flavored rice - yum. Ideal for to go food that's quick and cheap.
author: Jan S.

description:
First of all, do not expect any seats. It's way better to do take out! My first time there was pretty decent, I ordered a Super Carnitas Burrito, the second time I got a super beef burrito, then it went downhill from there - THEY FORGOT THE VERDE SALSA! Come on now, it's a burrito and the guy asked me if I wanted salsa and I said yes! 

The burrito tasted pretty good, lots of beans, lots of cheese, lots of salsa, however you should watch out for the additional toppings that you add son the burrito. For example, guacamole and sour cream are extra and with those on it, the total was about $7!! Holy moly! 

I'll probably find another burrito place to satisfy my cravings.
author: Andrew L.

description: Good Cheap and fast mexican food. Parking is kinda hard to find depending on what time you came. Food is usually consistent and the staff here are nice and friendly. Definitively come here as often as I can.
author: Anthony V.

description: Hate to be a buritto ball buster. I just thought this place sucked. Sloppy. dry carnitas, no soul, just ingredients slopped and rolled. just gross.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I've been to a lot of burrito places, both far and wide.  Gordo's remains my all time favorite.  In fact, every time I am in the city I make it a point to come to this place and eat.  My favorite dish: Super steak burrito. Hold the guacamole; add extra hot sauce.

There's something about the meat and the way everything comes together in your mouth that leaves you satisfying for more.  The steamed tortilla wraps and holds all the ingredients and balances itself delicately in your mouth.  The only thing that makes it more euphoric is to add a little more hot sauce and salt. 

I have been eating this same burrito consistently for the past 20 years. Congrats Gordo's, you are my #1 favorite burrito place.
author: John C.

description:
If you're looking for healthy or non-greasy food, move on. This is not your spot. But if you're looking for greasy, drippy, abundantly cheesy and authentically crunchy; this is definitely your spot. I highly recommend the quesadillas. For real! 

Anytime a great big fat man is the one asking you if you want black beans or re-fried, it's usually going to be damn tasty. Well, the dude wielding the spoon here is a big mo' fo'! That's real. So, using the transitive property of equality like them lawyers do, that makes this place mo' f'n damn good. 

Just thinking about those beans and cheese and carnitas and crispy tortillas make my stomach whine for the savory sustenance of a gordo's quesadilla. Tell the fat man I'm on my way...I'm coming from LA so keep the open sign up!!!
author: Joseph S.

description:
Meh, sorry to all the san franciscans but this is mediocre mexican at best, granted its better than most places i've been to in the city but it just doesnt hold a candle to the stuff i've grown up on.  The beef is sub par, more than likely as a result of using sub par grades of beef, the carnitas does have a decent flavor although without fail i always end up with about 1/3 of it wasted because of it being fried to a solid block of whatever. The chicken is ok, typical poached though. 

i do like the fact that they use pinto instead of refried - the refried are available - the rice is good, as well as the hot sauce they use. As for the burrito itself, since alot of the ingredients are dry they leave alot of the water that this stuff sits in in the burrito, so they will fall apart. 

At this point i say just go for the plate, its decent enough.  

Its good if you want something quick, cheap and filling, but if your looking for something like home. No bueno.
author: Cooper M.

description: As a SF native, you gotta understand the Mission is the standard for Mexican food, specifically El Farolito.  Like a lot of taquerias outside of the Mission, Gordo is just aiiight.  It's not bad for what it is, but you can get much better.  It was odd that they used slices of cheese instead of shredded.  Another thing I'm not a fan of is diluted guacamole.  Put plain avocados in those burritos/quesadillas/tacos!  The meats here are decent, some are marinated fairly thoroughly and pretty flavorful.  Overall taste is average, nothing spectacular.  Portions are filling, but stick to the Mission if you're looking for good Mexican grub.  It's cheaper out there as well - no brainer in case you're thinking up a pros/cons list.
author: Jeff S.

description: Great local place! been going here for almost 20 years! although it has changed through the years, food not like it used to be back then ,  but overall still good burritos! thumbs up to Gordos! Still good but nowhere near as good as they used to be !
author: Damien F.

description:
One huge tortilla.

Two choices of rice.

Plenty options of meat.

Average amount of toppings and condiments.

Big hunk of master piece rolled up and ready to be devoured.

Mouth-watering. Filling. Delectable.

SHIT. I LOVE BURRITOS, and Gordo Taqueria does not disappoint me.
author: Annie S.

description: i love their burritos!!! i love getting the super boiled chicken burrito with everything on it!!! it gets one star off because when i ask for  everything its inconsistent...like i would only get hot sauce on one side more than the other..same goes with the gucamole and sour cream. overall.....their burritos hit the spot everytime!
author: Stella J.

description: Simple but good Mexican food. they are usually pretty generous with the portions. the carnitas are a must. I usually order the super burrito but the plates seem to give you a heartier portion. Food is always fresh due to its steady flow of customers. More variety in hot sauces would be appreciated but the green sauce they do have, has the right amount of kick.  Only gripe is they now charge extra for tortillas when you order the plate.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Good, cheap and quick.  When I can get in and out of a burrito place in 3 minutes (not during the lunch rush, of course), I'm a happy camper.

Ask for hot sauce...its delicious.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I've been ordering take-out from here for years. I think it's well over 15 years, probably even more.

Of course, the food is not the same as the authentic dishes I've had in the small towns of Mexico, but it is still good. 

The portions are huge and their carnitas burritos are mouth-watering. I always have to eat just half of the super-sized ones. Their soft tacos are good too and their pollo quesadillas are muy bien!
author: Mashimaro M.

description: Same as it was 15 years ago. The service at this location is poor. It's never been as inviting as the 9th Ave location but the food is on par. The current crop of servers are surly at best and will argue with the customers if called out on an error. Best to avoid this version of unauthentic Mexican fare.
author: Josh D.

description:
You know that tag line for Campbells Soup? Mmm Mmm Good...Well, this place should be using that instead of Campbells. Seriously, this place has got it down almost to an exact science. Really...GOOD!!!

I like this place because of the value of the food you get for the amount of money you shell out. This is no frills Mexican eating and that's how it should be. Chips and salsa? Put some more money on the counter, bitch! This is one of the few places that charges for chips and salsa and I totally agree with them on it fully on their decision. I don't need something I won't eat. Most of the time, chips and salsa are part of the price you pay for the entire order. I would rather have them charge me for that than to add that onto my bill and give it to me to throw away at home.

And the menu is freaking simple. Choose your food. Then your meat. And if it applies, chose your wrap. Then the rest is simple. They ask you what kind of beans and meat. You want onions? You want hot sauce? Jalapenos are extra and you need to tell them. Also, if you want the sour cream and guac, now's the time to tell them if you haven't ordered it super already. Then you slide over to the left and pay the man behind the register.

I order a burrito most of the time and when I am really hungry, a quesadilla. This is where they lose a star from me...Their quesadillas are awesome but they have one major flaw...The juices from the meat and onions always flow out of it. Kinda a non matter but when it starts to leak all over everything and then if there was a hole in the bag and it leaks over some other stuff you have in other bags, not a happening thing. But that is my only qualm with them. But usually this meal of both costs less than 11 bucks. What a bargain! And it is freaking filling even without the quesadilla.


So if you are hungry, then bring your appetite here. Super fast and super good! Oh, and if it's crowded, make sure you know what you want before you step in line...I will personally choke you out if you freaking stand at the front and hold up the line. You have been warned!
author: Anthony L.

description:
My last good meal before starting my diet.

I'm tempted to give 3 stars...why?  I asked for hot sauce and jalapenos and didn't get either one :(

*ahem* I should have gone to my usual Gordo's on Geary but Vincent K. keeps insisting Clement is better.  I should have stuck to my gut!  Every time I come to this location I'm disappointed.  Oh well...I ended up eating a regular burrito with a spinach tortilla, grilled chicken, sour cream & salsa.  Yeah I don't do beans.  No hot sauce makes for a boring burrito.

Geary Gordo's is better than Clement Gordo's!  =P
author: Steph D.

description: I Came to San Francisco for the summer. After doing a lot of sightseeing the time seemed to fly by and I was starving. I had heard about Gordo's for quite sometime and decided to give it a try. To my pleasure it did not disappoint. The Super Burrito with Carnitas was AWESOME!!! The menu is very simplistic and if I could draw a similarity to Gordo's it would be Chipotle, though make no mistake I'm not saying they're the same, just somewhat similar. The thing that impressed me the most was the service. They were great and super fast. They didn't make a mistake on how I wanted my burrito. Definitely coming back on future San Francisco visits, it's also located in a nice and safe area.
author: Jean P.

description:
I've never stepped foot in a Gordo Taqueria so I can't tell you about the service... but I can tell you ALL about their all meat burrito.  
All meat?  
Yes sirrr.. all meat.
You mean no rice or beans?  
No rice or beans.  
That's gotta be a small a$$ burrito.. 
Nope!  The size is perfect.  
Every time I've bought one of these manly burritos, I start to sing that song from the Dial body wash for men commercial... you know the one with the guy playing a tuba?  Imagine me walking through the lunch room with my all meat burrito singing, "manly man... the manly manly man... manly man, yes I can"  (probably not even the words they sing)
*anyways*
Aww yes... if you want to keep your Manly Manly Man figure, stop by Gordo Taqueria and buy yourself an all meat burrito.
author: Jamal G.

description:
Small little burrito stand in clement that is very delicious!  This location is soooooo much better than the Geary location, and I have no idea why. Maybe the cooks here just pay more attention or maybe they just no how to actually cook at this one! Price isnt bad either for 2 burritos it cost me under $10 and well worth it. I like the burrito much better than the tacos.....
Some people claim that this isnt as good as LA Mexican food, well LA Mexican isn't as good as San Diego Mexican food. I have to say that for a San Francisco Burrito stand it definitely took care of my burrito craving and I will continue to return. Only negative is that they charge you extra for guac bu that's alright it's not like they are charging an arm and a leg to begin with.
author: James H.

description:
I get paid to be a "yes man" but I can't go with the crowd.. I mean it's cheap..and it's Mexican which usually defaults to 5 stars but in this case it doesn't. I mean the food is big but it's not as good as the Mexican shops in Mission or in Oakland. I hate eating there because it's small and it smells weird inside. I like Pancho's (off Geary at Stanyan) better though it's a bit pricier but still it isn't much better. 

It is convenient if you leave nearby (parking off Clement can get a bit busy) but now I just go with the PB&J rather than the mediocre burritos.
author: Dan T.

description:
I LOVE BURRITOS!!! THEM SUPER BURRITOS! I work right next to Gordos taqueria and when i need a quick burrito fix, this is where i come. 

The burritos are huge, and delicious. The ingredients are always fresh.

One Tip...if you're a big eater, make sure you get the super burrito, the regular is super small. I can finish it in 5 bites....I'M SERIOUS! 

They also offer different types of tortillas, whole wheat, spinach, and tomato. BY REQUEST ONLY.
author: Brian P.

description:
carnitas regular burrito (4.95) add extra quacmo, cheese, sour cheese etc. for .50ish each item. the burrito was gordo (big) but the texture wasn't like the taco truck style.

the problem lies in the construction of the burrito. most burritos are long  and narrow. gordo's are short and fat, pushing too many ingredients into the mouth at once. gordo's burritos are recommended only for people with big mouths.

a serious problem here is the meters. they love quarters and you get 10 minutes. no credit card accessible machines. oaktown's one up on frisco but frisco's racking in the dough. (in parking fines).
author: Victor G.

description:
I live around the corner from the Geary / 19th location so I have had my share of Gordo's. 

Actually the one on 9th between Lincoln and Irving is the best one IMO.

They all are the same for the most part though, and if you are hankering for a burrito, you could get worse but don't let that sound like a recommendation. 

Meh

If you eat enough at Gordo's you won't be a huge fan. It's average at best. I much prefer Chino's on Balboa if you are in the Richmond district and want something a little bit Mission style. Gordo's is white boy burrito city (and I'm white, so I should know) - it's like the Wonder Bread of Super Burrito's

The best deal there is to get the Gordo Plate to go - you get rice, beans, pico, three tortillas heated on the grill, plus meat of choice. If you get the Gordo plate, my suggestion is to also get a bag of chips since you will inevitably run out of tortillas before you are done with the plate and the chips serve as good scoopers for your grub.

Other's seem to like the Quesadilla's, and they are ok but greasy and I think that less is more on the quesadillas (cheese, hot sauce, a little pico, possibly some meat but maybe not) - otherwise, just get a burrito.

If I do get the burrito, I usually just get a regular with cheese, it's more tight and concentrated instead of a few flecks of meat in a sea of mediocre rice and beans.

Head to the mission (La Cumbre anybody?) if you want authentic
author: Joel V.

description:
The only reason this place deserves less than a five is if you don't know what to order.

The only thing to get is the boiled chicken quesadilla with tomatoes and a little bit of hot sauce. Eat it fresh, achieve gordo, and then get back in line to order another. This is not mexican food. This is food for the gods.

Words cannot fully describe it.
author: Toby S.

description:
I love gordos.  The gordo plate is a must have every time i go there.  My old classmate called it a plate of mess because when i eat it, i mix everything together, and thats what it looks like.  But hey, my logic is that it all ends up in the same place anyways.

Im actually craving it right now.
author: Terence P.

description: Mmm mmm mmm, had a long hike & all I could think of was Gordo's Gordo's! Hypnotizing burrito's for such a low price!! You'd think they couldn't possibly be that good for $5, but man they are mouth watering! This location is a lot smaller than the one on 9th Avenue, but the quality & quantity is just the same.  Large portions, affordable, and their meat is always good; no complaints! 5 Stars because they also accept Cards, which is so convenient! Great carne asada, chicken, & carnitas, what more could I ask for, but Gordo himself (if there is one) LOL
author: Christina O.

description:
I come here if I run out of ideas. 
It's sort of like eating cereal with milk when you run out of eggs and bagels in the morning. 
They make basic filling burritos fast and cheap with consistency.

When it's your turn to order, just say the following. "Small carnitas burrito, black beans, everything on it". 

"Hello?" 
- "Hi, a small carnitas burrito."
"Pinto?"
- "Black beans."
"Guacamole sour cream hot sauce?"
- "Everything."

I figure the black beans are better because they keep offering pinto.

I'm just glad they don't deliver. Knowing me, I'd probably order burritos way too often.
author: Jae K.

description:
Call me a SoCal snot I don't care because in SoCal I was SPOILED with YUMMY "Authentic" Mexican food and as for this place it was NOT good aka non-bueno!!!

Had their carne asada taco (yes very generous with their carne asada); by the time I brought it home to eat it, the tortilla was soggy and the beef had no taste!

1/2 chicken 1/2 carnitas burrito - bland & boring, nothing special!!!!
author: Katy N.

description:
Mmmmm, Gordo's.  Super Burrito w/ grilled chicken, black beans, and everything on it, including jalapenos...por favor.  

Muchas gracias, senor tortilla steamer.

The first bite is always best -- puncturing the tender shoulder of the tortilla and exposing its inner goodness of hot, steamy burrito organs.  You must get a little thing of hot sauce so you can pour it over every bite.  

Wax that shit and go home full and happy.

Muy bien.
author: Hodie K.

description: I won't say much because in general i love gordos. but for some reason when i went to this particular one the food and the workers weren't all that great.
author: Arthur S.

description: Mediocre bean and cheese burrito. Would have given it three stars, but for the fact that it is the saltiest burrito I have ever had. Decent hot sauce, though.
author: i z.

description:
Nothing to write home about, but something to write a Yelp review of.

A solid burrito. Normally, rice bugs me, and I go without it. But I forgot to ask them to 86 it, and it turned out not to be bad. The beans were just right, amount of guacamole and sour cream for a super was perfect, and chicken, though diced a little small for my liking, tasted right (I can't demerit for a lack of burn spots, can I?).

In sum, a slightly better-than-average burrito. Why only three stars? They charge for chips. I know, total bullshit, huh?
author: Jeff H.

description:
It could have been the euphoric vibes from setting a Bay To Breakers personal best, but I totally dug this Gordo compared to the one on Geary. These guys stuffed my taco with generous portions of chicken in green sauce, black beans and salsa. Cheap. And delicious.

Pointing to my B2B bib and congratulating me also scored some major customer service points.
author: Jason B.

description:
So my friend and I are in Paris watching The Lizzie McGuire movie. After a long night of rehearsing for her debut with a Paulo Valisari, the mysterious and ultimately sleazy half of the Italian pop sensation "Paulo and Isabella" the latter which has quit unexpectedly right before their big show at the International Music Video Awards and also happens to be Lizzie's brunette doppelganger returns to her dorm (she is on her 8th grade student field trip after all) and exclaims:Wake up Gordo, I HAVE to tell him about this!"

"FUCK I WANT A BURRITO."

That is how much the name Gordo's in synonymous with amazing burritos in my mind. After three months of fucking gyros and croque monsuers I've been fiending hardcore for one, any one will do, even a TJ's frozen bean and cheese at this point.  But my first stop once I land at SFO will be Gordo's. This one in particular, the Geary one is a bit more wet and heavy handed with the hot sauce. Yes, I'm somewhat of a connoisseur, it's not a big deal. 

3 Pieces of cheese, black bean regular carnitas burrito, light tomatoes, guacamole hot sauce. I'm salivating and cursing my  life for my self imposed six month hiatus. Whatever Europe. Open a Gordo's and I'm yours. Until then I don't think I could ever leave San Francisco.
author: Nadia P.

description:
Cheap, fast and tasty, and live up to the name "gordo."

I ordered the quesadilla.  I turned around and the guy wrapped it up like a burrito...it blew my mind!  and tasted good too.
author: Sydney B.

description:
This is for the order in takeout part:

Oh Gordo's, my trusty nearby home favorite taqueria.  I'm so glad you guys do call in too.  It makes my life so much easier when I can just call in, and then head over to pick up my burrito without taking longer than needed.  And yes, Steph D, this one is still better than the Geary one, by FAR.

I ordered a super burriito with carnitas with everything and extra hot sauce.  This was on a Monday morning around 11:30 so I'm thinking the rice might have been a lil on the mushy side cuz its an odd hour to be eating Taq.  Anyways, I still enjoyed my burrito and found a giant piece of carnitas.  mmmm Meat.  Next time, when i say extra hot sauce, Imma try and tell em to load it up.  But for an over the phone order, I'm surely happy with my burrito, such the perfect meal with some beers before going to a warriors' game.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Neighborhood taqueria, how I adore you. 

I'll be honest, their burrito isn't the VERY best I've had in my life, but it's so exceptionally consistent, I must give it five stars. It's always good, regardless of what I order. Burrito, quesadilla, that combo that gives you all the stuff and you can make it yourself... all really good. 

They have a spicy salsa that is bangin' (but not in that gross way that makes you think of your overweight neighbor doing it). I downed a few glasses of water just eating chips with that salsa. 

Thank you for having some balls, Gordo.
author: Jared S.

description:
Gordo's will make you gordo if you continue to eat at Gordo's. I love their burritos, and for the price it can be pretty hard to convince me that I shouldn't go to Gordo's... despite the gordo factor! 

They are not the BEST burrito ever, but they are huge, cheap, and really honestly pretty good. I love to take my dog for a walk and stop in Gordo's to grab dinner. Plus, for both my husband and myself to eat, with extras of sour cream/guacamole, it ends up being like $12. And, we're full ALL night. It's great! 

The service is really quick as well. You better know what it is you want to order when you go in, as they, like most burrito-bar style places, want to hurry up the line. I have yet to be dissatisfied by this place. In fact, I'm ready for dinner... maybe it's time to pitch Gordo's to the hubby and see about going there to grab food...
author: Bridgette A.

description:
OMG...Hot cheezy goodness with extra guac and sour cream...i've eaten all over the place but gordos will always be my home! shoot, its because of gordos that i started liking mexican food!  Nothing beats their burritos..i dont know what they do to them but if im in the city i HAVE to have gordos...even when i was going to mexico i stopped by gordos on the way to the airport!  

yummmm...hungry now...mummmmm gordos....
author: Karisa L.

description:
Cheap.  Fast service.  Big portions.  Very few options for burritos: 2 kinds of beans, cheese, rice, meat, 1 salsa, guacamole, hot sauce.  
I wasn't in the mood for rice, so maybe I'm more unhappy than I would've been, but my idea of a good burrito 
1) has more than just beans, rice & cheese (I don't do spicy) and 
2) is at most 50-50 beans-to-rice ratio.  
What I ended up with was a mountain of rice with a very small, narrow trail of beans along the top rolled up & called a burrito.  It ended up being about 1-2 beans in every third bite - no exaggeration.  I don't think the rice or beans were vegetarian (I am) and TOO MUCH RICE!
My boyfriend's burrito was "okay" - beans, rice, cheese, guac & salsa.
I don't know if I (or he) will go back.  I am very sad, I want a burrito!
author: Ljótur H.

description:
Ever hear the expression 'you are what you eat.' This is especially true for Gordo, the taqueria that's bringing mexy back to the richmond. When I eat gordo, I am gordo.

The burritos are HUGE, the quesadillas cheesy and the price couldn't be more right.
author: Haley M.

description: Good burrito for the price! They tend to give you a healthy amount of food for the Gordo Plate, much more than would fit in the burrito. Just wish they'd drain the black beans more before slopping them all into the tortilla...sometimes makes for a soggy, drippy burrito when you get home as there are only a couple places to sit at the window bar.
author: George P.

description: It s a decent burrito, nothing I would go out of my way for...but I live in the neighborhood. Just be sure you are ready to blurt out your order right when you get to the counter, ex: what type of tortilla, beans, meat etc. The dude just started slapping my burrito together without asking what I wanted! I would go back for convenience, but nothing to rave about.
author: Makala K.

description:
I always end up going to the Gordo's on 18th and Geary. But yesterday, my friend and I ventured further down on Clement in search of parking and figured we might as well try this location.

The staff is much friendlier at this place (though truthfully that is not saying much!). The Chile Verde Gordo plate I ordered was packaged up in a to-go container with rice, black beans, pico de gallo, and tender, moist, beautiful chile verde. I requested guacamole and spicy sauce to be added. The four hot corn tortillas were packed up in aluminum, where they might have gotten soggy if I did not eat in my friend's car (since we're fatties- and since we were famished after hitting up lap swim at Rossi pool).

My friend ordered a black bean and cheese super burrito and we got chips and spicy salsa to go with all of this food. The result? Mountains of delicious, satisfying Mexican for dinner, all in my friend's pick up truck while watching the waning crowds of people at the fruit shop in front of us. While the fruit smelled good outside, our food inside the car smelled better. My Gordo plate was so filling and tasty; I will definitely order it again. 

The spicy salsa was muy caliente, and my friend went back to get more water after trying it. Yummy dinner splurge after a hard swim! That's how I exercise (and fail to lose weight).
author: Anna S.

description:
Mmmmmm

I'm from San Diego and I'm a fan of this place. I would minus a star for putting rice in their burritos, but with my order, it doesn't matter (see below). Good meat, fast service, authentic, awesome.

Here is your new favorite order there:
Quesadilla
any meat is ok, although the carnitas were amazing
Black beans
Guacamole
Salsa

What you get is basically a warm and crispy burrito with melted cheese. Same price as getting just a plain quesadilla or burrito, but wouldn't you rather have a gooey, crispy giant burrito? After ordering the people behind me in line changed their orders to get what I got. That's how you know it's that good.
author: Sarah P.

description:
The ONLY possible reason that this place doesn't have an average 5 stars on Yelp is that some people are just plain STUPID.

The food is fast and tasty.  It's filling, but feels light in my tummy and allows me to gleefully embark upon my daily adventures without feeling like I just devoured a massive helping of grease and cheese at a Jalisco style taqueria.

Top suggestions: carnitas or chile verde.  ALWAYS extra hot sauce, guac and cheese.  These dudes know exactly what they're doing and how to do it.  

If you've dreamed of pigging out on Mexican food in a tight, hand-held form, without feeling totally gross and stuffed for three hours, go to Gordo's my good man.
author: Blake C.

description:
OMFG!!! Did you see the size of that?! 

Seriously, go for super burrito and it will take you through next days dinner. Also, I have a strong suspicion that they sprinkle crack or something on their food. Yes, it's THAT addictive. 

Anyways, superbeefpintobeanseverythingextrahotsause!!! That's how I roll.
author: Misha K.

description:
Not a whole lot to say about Gordo - if you haven't been, they pretty much rock. Especially for those of us that don't live in the Mission (aka "Hipster Alley"). 

Your normal Taqueria fare - for reasonable prices, and the burritos are as big as yer frickin' head! 

Maybe not as good as a Pancho Villa, Los Panchos or La Taqueria, but hey - when you just don't wanna hoof the 33 to the Mission, Gordo's really does the trick!
author: Marco M.

description:
I'm glad I don't live in the Richmond anymore.  Having two Gordos within walking distance meant that I was eating waaaay too many burritos and quesadillas at one point.  And yes, yes, I'm sure *your* burrito place in the Mission is much better, but burritos are a subjective thing and Gordo's is my personal favorite.  Occasionally they'll pile the beans and sour cream a bit heavy (I prefer mine heavy on the guac and rice), but that's OK.

But I always dread being stuck behind the guy with The List.  Burritos for the whole family: "Uhh...I'll take one carnitas with no salsa and one grilled chicken with..." and so forth.  C'mon, I just want one!  That's when the impatient ex-New Yorker in me comes out.     

The one on Geary is just as good, but I wanted to single out the Clement locale because I found myself short on cash one night, but they let me go and told me I could pay another time, even waving me away when I offered to at least put back the chips.  They knew I'd be back!

*Update*: they take credit cards now.
author: DD B.

description:
Since the reviews here seemed a bit all over the board, it actually took me a while to try this place out.  I missed out on months of yumminess!

I love the Super Bean and Cheese burrito.  HUGE burrito with the works, without having to request it with no meat.  The salsa strength varies from day to day (they make it fresh!), so I've learned that it's safer just to tell them to go easy on the hot sauce.

They also make me the most sinful quesadilla on the planet.  Order the appetizer size, corn tortilla, just cheese.  I tasty snack, dripping with grease, to munch on the walk back up the hill.  I know, it's bad.  But it's soooooo good.

$5 and I'm out of there.  Parking can occasionally be a bitch if I'm trying to hit it on the way home from work.  But it's a quick cheap option--my favorite kind!
author: Melissa Q.

description:
Gordo Taqueria serves good Mexican food fast.  When ordering, I practice my horrid Spanish and it gets a chuckle frequently.  I am ok with it.

My favorites are the carne asada super burrito and the carnitas quesadilla.  I can never finish their burritos - for me I have to split it in half saving the other for later.  I get everything on the burrito - rice, black beans, tomatoes, sour cream, guacamole and hot sauce.  As far as my quesadilla, I love the way they cook their carnitas.  I think it is the seasoning that does it for me.  In the quesadilla, I get everything too except rice and beans.

The Jarritos (Mexican sodas) to try are the fruit punch & lime.  If you are brave, try the tamarind to startle your palate -- it has a tart fruity flavor.

Don't be fooled if there is a long line that goes to the door.  I have been at the door a half a dozen times.  When this happens, I pray that everyone before me will order a burrito, which can be made quickly.  Since the tortillas have to be cooked for the quesadillas, the line can move slower.  But overall, Gordos is consistently good.
author: Janet H.

description:
Woke up this morning at 2:30 PM pretty hung over.  I need grease stat.  Walked down and picked up quesidilla with guac, sour cream and beef.  I was not impressed.  It was ok, but lacked the cheese.  He just threw down a single slice of cheese on top of the grill. What the F.*%K

I'm from So Cal, and I know a bomb Carne asada quesidilla when I see one.  I don't think I'll come back here.  I'll make the journey to the mission...
author: Robert M.

description:
Oooohhhhhh Man...

I love the fact that i don't have to go all the way to the mission for some good mexican food.  I will say that i consider this place to be more of a "fast food" tacqueria because of its low prices and quick service, but hey, its really one of the best fast food tacqueria's in the whole city.

Ive been to all the various Gordo's in the city and i have to say this one is by far my favorite.  I don't know why they all vary in quality, but it feel like this one by far has the best tasting food with the freshest salsa's :-D  Make sure that if you ever go, you spring for the extra 1.25 for chips and salsa, they are pretty spicy but you cannot go wrong with fresh tomatoes and onions and cilantro mmmmmmmmm :-)  Oh and another tip, i would say almost always spring the extra 70 cents or so and go super on the burrito instead of a regular. You get such a larger amount of meat and filling that even if you can't finish it, the extra 70 cents goes towards 2 meals :-D

Anyway, if you like good mexican food, make sure you take some time to check this place out, just be warned! Its really REALLY tiny, so give yourself some extra time during the lunch rush.
author: Mark R.

description: Get the boiled chicken burrito with everything on it. Then take a nap. A delightful way to spend your day.
author: Christina C.

description:
Good place. Came here looking for a quick, delicious dinner before walking over to the California Academy of Sciences for Nightlife. I picked up a Chicken Burrito with beans, rice, guacamole, and sour cream for about $5.75. This doesn't come with complementary chips and salsa like other taquerías, but I'm not going to give this place one less star because I'm not a douche. 

Transparency
Pretty common now with delis and burrito places, they make your food as you order it. You can see everything they put into it, and they don't hold back. Ingredients were leaking out from all holes as they folded my burrito, but luckily the foil held everything together while I ate it. It's also nice to have the capability to watch them make your food, so you can make sure they don't add any unwanted..."byproducts"...

Variety of Ingredients
My friends and I liked that the variety of ingredients is fairly consistent between types of burritos. You don't have to get a super burrito to get the additional ingredients that don't normally come with a normal burrito. The only difference between the regular burritos and super burritos is the addition of cheese and the size. 

Filling Factor
I consider myself a big eater; my friends call me a trash can, which makes me sad deep down. Despite that, a regular burrito filled me enough to last until the end of the night, even with all the walking and yelling at CAS Nightlife. 

Taste
My burrito tasted good. Great even. I'd say it ranks among the best burritos I've had. But then again, I'm not the pickiest of eaters. You might not like their burritos if you're a burrito snob who only eats burritos made of gold. Or if you're allergic to burritos.

I haven't tried all of the Burrito places in SF, so of course there may be other equally good or better ones. Even so, Gordo hit the mark by making me slightly fatter and slower.
author: E. R.

description: great burritos here.  i like the bean and cheese with sour cream, guacamole ,salsa, rice and their mild hot sauce.  it is really filling and delicious.  i have to say though that when i have gotten their meat burritos, it didn't really sit well and felt heavy.  but their bean and cheese ones are really really good.
author: Amy L.

description:
This place really is not that good.
The steak is overly greasy and the prices kinda suck for what you get.
It is not terrible, just not that good.
I have heard the the one off of Geary is better, so maybe give that one shot.
author: Brett P.

description:
I work in an auto shop near the Gordo's on Clement and I went to elementary school near that Gordo's, so all of my previous burrito knowledge had come from a great many visits to Gordo's. I can safely say I've been pampered. 

I've ordered nearly everything, and it's all great. 

 I love the feel of the place- it's too small, too claustrophobic, but too great at the same time. I especially love that it is tucked away, but when you look outside, it's smushed between an empty parking lot and an empty smoke shop with a line of 15 people coming out of this place whose storefront consists of a wooden bench, a doorway and a large window. 

That being said, I've never been let down by Gordo's. It's been there for me through the thick and thin, since I struggled to catch all Pokemon in elementary school all the way to now, 10 years later and in college.
author: Shelby C.

description:
Gordos has to be one of the best burrito spots in the city. i believe this because they have the best reputation of consecutively making delicious burritos time after time. you can always expect to get the same great quality burrito every time you step into the spot. There is no "my chicken burrito is dry tasting" or "my burrito got skimped out on the ingredients", its always the same size and taste. The guys who work there are very polite and are open to accept even the hardest burrito modification that their customers challenge them with.


very good restaurant!
author: alex a.

description:
FYI:  a quesadilla at Gordo's isn't a typical quesadilla (meaning flat).  It's like a mini burrito.  First they slap the tortilla with some cheese on the grill to get it nice and toasty (and the cheese melts, yummy...).  Then I had them add grilled chicken, cheese, sour cream, salsa, and.... it was a pure delight to eat.  

Your no-frills taqueria type joint, and they DO take credit/debit cards.  

Very, very delicious.
author: Sarah F.

description: I've lived in San Francisco for 21 years and Gordo is my favorite taqueria in the city. They are cheap, huge, and TASTY. Like their facebook page for chances to win free burritos and t-shirts! Every time I come back home from college the first thing I do is get some Gordos!
author: Patrick M.

description:
Fab carnitas burrito!  That is my gold standard for trying a new mexican place.  Gordo passed with flying colors.  Super fast.  Super cheap.  Super good.

If you order a regular burrito and want cheese (it comes automatically on the super, not the regular), say it first.  They melt it on the tortilla as they warm it up.  Otherwise, you are too late.

No ambiance - I don't even remember seeing a chair. No problem there for me - I wanted it to go anyway.
author: Lil P.

description:
Thank you to who ever posted the pictures....now I am drooling on my desk, over my coffee cup, and depressed that I didn't grab a burrito before my flight out of SF last night.
Gordo is hands down the best burrito place ANYWHERE...and I have tried I many!
They make it exactly how you want it, as you stand at the counter and watch.  They are friendly, and are super cheap!
It is not a great place for a group or a sit down meal...but perfect for on the go or taking on a picnic.
I absolutely insist all your San Franciscans or travelers to SF find one of the many Gordos and try a burrito!
Don't let me down.
author: Cheryl A.

description:
I've eaten here about 3 days a week for the last 9 years. There is not a better burrito in the City (entire world?). 

I can't say anything more; nothing I can write can express to you how much ass this place kicks.
author: Justin B.

description:
So...after eating at the horrible and disgusting Chipotle Mexican Grill in Berkeley, i felt that i had to give my original burrito pplz some props for making a darn good burrito. I personally recommend the carnitas, there's nowhere else that i've been to in SF that makes a better carnitas burrito...

The prices are fair ( $6 dollars or a little more for a Super burrito, depending on what you get on it) and the portions are BIG. 

Some people are outraged at how they could possibly think of charging for chips...cuz i mean...who would ever think of charging for something OTHER than what you already ordered...anyways, they're 55 cents for a good sized bag, stop being cheap and just give em a few quarters for the chips...

If only they delivered...I'd call them from berkeley and avoid the junk they have over here in the east bay.
author: Eric W.

description: I want to apologize beforehand, because it seems like this place has great reviews....buuuuuut, it failed. I am currently at Outside Lands, and some of us decided to order some burritos from the stand. I think all of us wanted to punt the burritos into an imaginary goal line. The burritos were extremely dry and well...just as bad as a flat line in the emergency room. Again, lo siento.
author: Tomasz B.

description:
what i ordered... super burrito w/ beef

they prepare your food in front of you....literally, i just hope the preparer don some gloves, oh well that give's it an extra flavor i guess. the burrito was a good size with lots of fillings of everything. i picked beef for meat because it was a new batch and the carnitas look's ok but they don't sear it like they do at great taquerias. the beef was ok, lacks that marinade taste...


ambiance... good  (small dining area but very clean)
cost... $
author: Gors P.

description:
best cheese quesadilla every. such buttery creamy goodness in a warm flour tortilla. I got it originally for my kid but it was so good I wanted to order another one just for myself (but didn't because I had a huge burrito already). 

got the beef super burrito. large size. very good beef/steak flavor. I'm not a burrito expert but my hubby says it was one of the best burritoes he's eaten. 

ps they DO NOT use msg
author: Win H.

description: This place does the trick if you're craving a decent burrito in the Richmond.  There is also a Gordo on Geary Blvd as well but I seem to like this place better even though it's smaller, just get your food to go.  The super Chile Verde burrito with everything in it is my choice.
author: Emy B.

description:
Carnitas!!!! yum yum
Service = none
Food = Carnitas are burnt just right, with a little crisp
Price = $
Crowd = locals
Personal Favorite = Fast, quick, sometime i just double park
Worst = lines
Meal for two = 13
Final say = great for locals, wouldn't go when i visit sf, have to save space
author: M C.

description: Quick and filling. A little bland, especially the pico de gallo, and the ingredients don't mix particularly well when they roll the burrito up. Not the best burrito, but far from the worst.
author: Yana N.

description: The supper burritos here are huge like all the mexican burrito places! The guy who takes your order though behind the counter seems a little dull and shows no emotion at all, but it's a good thing at the same time because you don't get any attitude from him. The menu is also pretty straight forward.
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
I might be biased as i lived down the block from this place for a year, but goddamnit, there was probably a point in my life where I was eating my squares a day at this place... 
Fast and convienient, but really inconsistent- sometimes the burritos were expertly rolled and super clean and sometimes you'd open the foil and there'd be a gushing of beans and guacamole into your hand- sometimes the carnitas was expertly cooked and sometimes it was so dry and stringy it was like eating carpet sample.

However... let it be said that the prices are fair, the service is fast, it's REALLY clean for a hole in the wall taqueria and you can't really ask for that much more...
author: Heng W.

description: The food is ok, the location is easy to get to and the service is interesting... but exactly nice nor mean? The size of the meals are good but the sides do add up $$ by the time you pay you hope its a darn good burrito! for the most part it is a better choice over other Mexican restaurants... I do like that they make your food in front of you :)
author: Star Z.

description: I've been coming here since I was a teenager.  To this day, they still have the best burrito ever.  I don't know why or what they do to it, but I dream of that darn super burrito when I haven't had one for too long.
author: chad H.

description: Actually, they have improved. i liked my chicken burrito. it needed more heat but it was dang tasty. hence the upgrade
author: irene r.

description: Eww, not a fan. The one time I ate here I felt really sick soon after. I haven't returned.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I first tried it last year and something about the burritos makes you keep coming back again and again. Its a simple place and the atmosphere is decent, but its all about the super burrito. To be honest I haven't had anything besides the Super burrito because every time I go there thats what I crave. I'm usually left hungry after polishing off meals at other places, but the serving size there seems perfect to satisfy my appetite without takeouts. 

The only minor problem, or suggestion, I would make is get some Mexican beer in there. It'd be perfect with a super burrito.
author: Adam B.

description:
Gordo's is one a handful of things I miss about living in the Richmond District.  It was a stone's throw away from my brokendown palace.  

It has by far the best carnitas I've found in the City thus far. My favorite item the carnitas plate.   Ask them for the crispy ends and they were always more than happy to oblige. Add in generous sides of beans, corn tortillas and rice and you've got two meals for $5.  

Taqueria snobs lament there is no decent Mexican food in the Richmond.  Gordo's proves them wrong.  In my book, it's top notch for quality and price.  

One star off for the salsa cruda.  They could do better.
author: Liz P.

description:
I've always begrudgingly bought my burritos here (Clement & Geary locations) only because the guys who work here are so sullen - never friendly word or look.  I guess if I were getting a steam facial from a giant vat of beans I wouldn't really be peppy per se... but never?  Ever?  It's not like I've been here only once or twice.

But the clouds broke today and I was afforded a smile from the guy steaming my tortilla.  Why, you ask, does this matter to me?  Why do I take this as a personal affront?
I don't know!
I just feel like the burrito buying experience could be improved with a smile and a hello from time to time.

And yes, the burritos are good.  Simple and good.
author: Rashmi N.

description:
Yummy yummy Mexican food offered somewhere OTHER than the mission? Oh so true! The quesadillas are especially impressive, served hot, fresh, crunchy and delicious. Perfect for when I'm craving meat...which is um, always. Ew! Get your mind out of the gutter!  

If you need further convincing, my friend saw Robin Williams in here once ordering a super chicken burrito. This place is clearly awesome.
author: Nikki H.

description: I always get the super chicken burrito.  The flavor is good, and is super consistent.  They are also a great value, lots of food for a reasonable price.
author: Juan R.

description:
I think I was mocked by one of the dudes behind the counter (not one actually making my burrito), he was one of those extra hands just standing around taking up useless space. Anyways, as I was saying, I think I was mocked when I ordered chips & salsa as I was paying, the dude said "chips & salsa" in a really high voice (not that I have a super high voice, although sometimes I will sound like a 12 year old girl on an answering machine, close enough that I've been able to tell telemarketers that "no sir, my parent's aren't home right now.") Yeah so, he was either mocking me or had a voice like he had no balls. I hope its both, that he has no testicles and that he was mocking me, then I wouldn't feel so bad that he had no balls. So there's a star knocked off for that, btw everyone else working was indifferently pleasant.

About the food: My super burrito was good, not great. I did appreciate how all the ingredients were evenly distributed from top to bottom. The carne asada was especially good, it was as if they grilled me up a marinated steak and simply cut it up and put it in my burrito. Its not the normally tiny thin chopped carne asada I'm used to, it definitely tastes like real grilled steak. It wasn't bad for the price, very reasonable at $5 something, plus they take card if you're a never-carrying-cash citizen like myself. The mild salsa I got with the chips was super bland. I needed hot sauce, I forgot to ask if they give some to go.... 

Maybe if I want a burrito on this side of town again I will return, see if they hand out hot sauce, and see if the balls-ass-guy is really an ass or if I made up the situation in my head. Next time I want a burrito around here I'll see if they deserve 4 stars.
author: kate r.

description:
Not the best burrito I've ever had, but good enough for the Richmond. Cheap, fast, consistent, and FILLING. Guacamole's usually pretty fresh and dang tasty.

I love the carnitas, but watch out-sometimes they let the meats sit too long in those canisters and the top layers get a little dried out. If I go, my carnitas is perfect. If my boyfriend goes, well...apparently the burrito wrappers don't fancy him enough to serve him the special pork, kept under the counters for safe-keeping, and reserved only for the ridiculously pretty girls that consider The Burrito a religious icon.

Oh well. If my boobies get me perfect slow-roasted pork, then I say, "Girl Power!"
author: Sachi T.

description:
I'm always a fan of the LA style deli's and Gordo's has been giving me good burritos since my days in Berkeley.  This location is great because it's pretty empty so you don't have to wait in line and the food is just as good as the other locations.  Their carnitas are always pretty fresh and they chop up your portion from a larger chunk of pork.  

If you're looking for something different, go elsewhere.  If you're looking for a great burrito at a great price, then come here.
author: Daniel L.

description:
take it from this mexican, gordo's has the freshest and most juicy carnitas taco i have found. 

a lot of people's perception of mexican food is the 'NOT' fresh kind. i know good mexican food and it's good enough for me to bring my family to.

i've ordered burritos but their small corn tortillas are so much more flavorful than their flour ones. order 2 tacos and you're good to go!
author: Rosy P.

description:
Not going to get into a best burrito in the city discussion but to my taste buds, gordo's burritos rank highest. There's something about the flavor of the rice and salsa that my palette really likes. About my only Gordo's gripes:

Since they are so popular, they skimp on their serving sizes.
Meats tend to be on dry side.
Nice guys but could raise one more bar. Probably too busy but try guys:)
author: w l.

description: best burrito i may have ever had, consistent, cheap, healthy and fresh, me and my girlfriend eat here at least 5-7 times a week,
author: jackson m.

description: Overall good food. Got a carnitas super burrito here. Carnitas was very good, just like the rest of the burrito. Good size for the price, however, only 3 stars for charging extra for cheese, sour cream, and guac.
author: Can L.

description:
5 stars because they make my favorite burritos.  They steam the cheese into the tortilla so there's no cold spot and for those of us who HATE cilantro but love spice they make a killer hot sauce as an alternative to the pico de gallo.
carnitas-yum
grilled chicken-yummy
carne asada-yummiest
I lived on these puppies my last semester of school!
author: Jennifer L.

description: I stopped going there many years ago because the food was too salty.  Recently I went back and found they have improved, although still too salty occasionally.   Lots of people there during dinner time, but the line goes fast.
author: Wing L.

description:
Not sure what all the fuss is about or why people drive all the way out on Geary for these not so stellar burritos.

Yes, the prices are cheap. However beans were much to salty, the tortila was goopy and the guacomole was not even worth ordering. The boiled Chicken is fine, although not a new concept at all....my grandma has been doing it for years, so I'm not so impressed with this feature.

If given the option, I'd skip Gordos and go to Chipoltle any day.
author: Abra A.

description:
This place is awesome for a variety reasons other than its more than decent burritos. The service is fast, not so friendly, but who cares when you're getting your food quickly? They're burritos are generally dry, which I like. Their tacos are ok, but their flower quesadillas are AWESOME. 

I like how it's the little brother of a larger Gordo on Geary. When you're here you feel like you found a secret or shortcut. It's a small place but relatively cheap. You can get a small drink on the side with a regular burrito for 6-7 bucks. Definitely go there if you're in the area. 

It's only real downside would be that it closes at 10 pm, which is when I get off work.
author: Ramy S.

description: Been coming here for a long time.  Great mexican food.  My favorite is corn quesadilla with boiled chicken.  Fresh and tasty.  The burritos are good too, I especially like the carnitas...very tasty.  I'd pass on the chips.  Just ok.  The guacomole is also watered down with sour cream.  I prefer all avocado.  Overall, good fast, inexpensive meal.
author: Kailee Q.

description: The best place to grab burritos outside of the Mission. I live just a few blocks away from Gordo, so there have been countless times when I would get lazy and just grab a Gordo super burrito. Also, this is one of the few awesome places that take card with no minimum. Simple, filling, affordable.
author: Miguel C.

description: After a great burrito at the same place on Geary I decide to pick up another 2 yesterday at the Clement location. The guy making the food scraped chunks of carnitas from the bottom of the pan without even slicing it up. At home my brother and I nearly cracked our teeth upon biting into the meat chunks. They were hard as rocks. The cook had to have known the meat was bad when handling it, I even saw him chuckle and say something to the cashier as he threw it on the tortilla. I was really disappointed with the careless service at this place, plus I was totally ignored when I said hello and tried to order. Got a way better one today at Chino's and was actually acknowledged by the staff.
author: Aislinn B.

description:
So, I was pretty pumped back in June when I moved into the neighborhood, just a block and-a-half away from Gordo's!  I'd been going to the one on 9th and Irving since I moved to SF and lived on the south side of the park, and it has ALWAYS been my favorite burrito place, (especially because of their delicious hot sauce!)

That said, this one, for whatever reason, just ISN'T as good.  They always seem to scrimp more here, and the meat isn't always... perfect. 

I dunno what it is, but here's what I do know:  when I went to the Gordo's on 9th and Irving, I would pretty much ALWAYS have the best burrito of my life... the Gordo's on 24th and Clement?  It's hit or miss, and you can never be sure which way it's gonna go.
author: Julia R.

description: No. You canNOT be a taqueria in California and serve such sh*t and call it a burrito. He slapped together bean mush, tepid rice, a glob of sour cream and perhaps five shreds of cheese. A teaspoon of pico de gallo. No flavor. The kind of crap you'd resign yourself to if you are stationed in outer space. Well, I'm not. I'm in Cali and I expect my Mexican food to always, always be a party in my mouth. Come on guys. Seriously.It just seems like it shouldn't be that hard to make a good burrito!
author: Ami S.

description: I don't understand why people rate this place so high.  Went there today looking for a carne asada burrito and found out that's not even on the menu.  NOT OK.  What kind of  taqueria doesn't serve carne asada?  Settled for a "super" carnitas burrito that was borderline okay.  It needs hot sauce.  To the dude at the register, why didn't you offer me some hot sauce for this bland burrito?  After a couple bites at home, I had to bust out some Tapatio just to make it palatable.  So basically, if you like a soggy burrito with no flavor, this is your place.
author: H K.

description: I have huge east coast pride, but I have to admit that SF and California in general destroy the east coast when it comes to burritos.  Having said that, I love Gordo's.  After having lived in SF briefly and visiting there several times, I have had the chance to try several taquerias, and this is my favorite.  Ironically, in grad school (in Boston), the only convenient food near me was a burrito place.  I ate there probably 5-10 times a week.  By east coast standard it was good, but each time I felt like I was being mocked by the recollection of a Gordo's and how much better it was. San Francisco burritos, I love you, and Gordo's, you are a great ambassador.
author: Chris H.

description:
Best Burrito ! and FAST SERVICE ! Done in less than a minute ! Not too expensive too. I usually order Super Burrito and split half with my wife. 
Steak, black bean and Spinach Wrapping are my Favorite !
author: Steven L.

description: Chicken and black bean burrito to go.  Not much to say or even rave about.  It definitely filled me up but I credit it that to the black beans.
