The tortilla was of average taste and texture.  The chicken tasted grilled and there was enough of it that I didn't feel jipped.  I asked for spicy but ended up with barely any salsa.  But that's ok since a good many shakes of hot sauce did the trick.
author: Rosalind S.

description: This is the only place I go for burritos in SF. The generous portions and quality food makes Gordo a cornerstone of the Richmond District food scene.
author: Rob S.

description:
Considering there is no really good Mexican food in SF- Gordo's is an OK cheap, fast burrito place. I like that they have an array of tortilla types and meats. Also, their hot sauce they put on is really good! Hard to street park at this location - which was great bc I used to live 2 blocks from it!

I question the cleanliness a bit but come on, what does one expect for cheap, fast and no seating?
author: Jessica L.

description:
This place has a pretty simple concept, but Gordo serves good, fast, cheap burritos.  I live just blocks away so if I'm ever craving a burrito, this is where I'm at.  Their "hot" salsa is actually hot and they have two sizes of burritos to choose from- regular or super.  The regular's enough to fill me up.  It's not a big restaurant, but there's about 8 seats along the window and wall.  I've never seen the place packed to the point that there are no seats available.  
Perfect place if you're looking for a quick bite in a casual enviroment.  It's like a Mission taqueria in the the middle of the Richmond.
author: Vang L.

description: In a city full of Asian food, it can be hard to find a good Mexican restaurant but, Gordo's is GREAT! the steak burrito is soo good, a great hangover cure too! Only downside, no place to sit really at this location.
author: Courtney C.

description:
A good place to go when you're too lazy to cook.  My usual?  Regular burrito with cheese, black beans, rice, boiled chicken, hot sauce, lots (I mean LOTS) of tomato de gallo, and guac.  The gordo plate with carnitas is also a good bang for your buck.

(Sometimes I wonder if they secretly curse me when I give my order, since all of the tomato makes it harder to roll the burrito. )
author: Gail O.

description:
t's not the best burrito/taco/Mexi-plate joint in the city by a long shot, but it will kill your hunger dead for not a lot of money.  The carnitas are pleasant but not very porky, the tortilla is steamed 'till gummy (though I sometimes like that), the refried beans are obviously vegetarian and there's a ton of rice on the burritos.

Also, if you want a burrito out in the Richmond, your other choice is the other Gordo's on Geary.
author: Suo L.

description:
How anyone can rate this place under three stars is beyond me. I've been coming to this Gordo for years and I've never had a bad burrito. Easily the best Gordo location in the city. Their super burritos are just big enough to hit the spot, but I also like to get a Gordo plate to get more bang for my buck.

Some advice: the big guy gives your more in your burrito, no lie.
author: Edmund C.

description: Ahhhh...Gordo's!!  I go here for one thing and one thing only...their flour quesadilla w/ carne asada, guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and hot sauce!  LOVE IT!  NO ONE makes their quesadillas like Gordo's...MUST TRY!!
author: Patrick C.

description: There are no authentic taquerias in the Inner/Outer Richmond... NONE. When will El Faralito open a joint out there or even a Taqueria Cancun?? I wonder why it hasn't been done?? Either one would make a killing out there expecially with all the late night bar crowd. Until someone opens a descent taqueria.... Gordo's is the go-to place for most people out in that area.   I will admit I do go here from time to time, because its a little hassle to go out to the Mission.
author: Demanding T.

description: If you need a quick burrito this is the place to go. Clean fresh product that is consistently good each and every time I go. I usually get the super chicken burrito and my bill is never more then 7 or 8 dollars. Hit this place if you want a some quality quick mexican.
author: Hunter S.

description:
I grew up at this place!
Always a good idea for dinner or a quick bite!
Super Carnitas Burrito is my fave.
They always fill it up! (The one on 9th and irving sometimes skimps on the fillings)  Tasty, Fresh, Cool Sour Cream and Guac, MMMmmm.
Note: no comparison to Mexican food from San Diego
          apples and oranges, yanno
author: JASON L.

description:
FOOD:  I had the chicken burrito, which was nothing to run home about.

SERVICE:  Habla Ingles?  No, but super fast burritos.

AMBIANCE:  What you would expect for Mexican takeout.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
This place is pretty good. The last few times I have been there, the food has been slipping. 
The place is very small and very straightforward... I ordered a super grilled chicken buritto and I got what I ordered.
If the quality keeps slipping, i will be going somewhere else..
author: Joe B.

description:
Like La Morena over in SSF, I only give this place 4.5 stars because they don't give you free chips. But other than that, they make some awesome burritos and THE BEST FLOUR QUESADILLA. Yes, there are better and more authentic places in the Mission District, but if you don't need that authentic flavor, Gordos is darn good and the meat quality is consistent and all their locations are clean unlike some of the hole in the wall Mission places. I grew up in the Richmond District but unfortunately moved further and further away from the City as I got older. Went there the other day and it's still how I remember it. 

Their carnitas is always bursting with flavor and has an outer fried section that gives it a nice crunch at times. The chile verde is perfect, it maybe salty for some but I love it. Also, their boiled chicken is done so tender you just want to sing "Tender Love" after your first bite, quality white meat chicken that doesn't taste bland and dry. Their carne asada is standard fare imo, I'm not a carne asada guy even though I love a good steak. As others have mentioned, if you like hot sauce, ask for extra... it's off the chain. 

Burritos aside, their quesadillas seem unique. No taqueria that I've been to does it the same way. You should try to eat it when it's fresh or else it may become a bit soggy. Get the flour quesadilla with your choice of meats and pull out a chair and get ready to rumble!
author: Andrew L.

description:
My very very favorite - Regular chile verde pork with guac and sour cream.      Its just the right amount and pork is so super tender.   

If I want to splurge... maybe even chips with salsa or guacamole.  Their guac is quite good... very fresh and chunky.   

Their quesadilla's are pretty awesome....  nothing tastes as good as their quesadilla's.  They are perfectly cheesy and crunchy and full of flavor........

Luckily for hubby and I they have a location in the east bay... otherwise it would go on our list of places to yearn for in SF.
author: Regi K.

description:
I will never get tired of Gordos. This is my comfort food. I've been coming here since the mid-80s, and their menu remains mostly the same (they have since added chile verde, grilled pollo, black beans, flavored tortillas, and salsa).

Their ingredients are simple and fresh. The burritos are wrapped well enough so they can be eaten while walking. And their quesadillas are fried with oil on a flattop grill.

Sure, there are more flavorful burritos in the city, but I can only eat those once every few weeks. I can literally eat Gordo's on a weekly basis without getting sick of it.
author: J K.

description:
Amazing Carnitas Super Burrito.  The carnitas are cooked to perfection and they melt the cheese right into the burrito.  I'd give it 5 stars but they are a little on the slow side and the seating is slim to none.

I know its a taqueria, not high end by any means but I came here with my FF gals and we had to squish into a circle and sit on these crate things they have.  They have very little space so I guess there's not much they can do about that.  

And really if seating is my only complaint,....that's pretty damn good!  I'll be back!
author: Angela S.

description: When work used to take me by this place, it was the go to spot for a great, huge, cheap burrito. I'm not sure what their salsa is, but it rocks. Quick service too. Parking flat out sucks, but it's San Francisco, what do you expect?
author: Aaron R.

description:
My test for any Mexican place is carnitas tacos.  This isn't necessarily because I think that if they get the carnitas tacos right, they'll do everything else well too, but it's my favorite so I need to know they at least make a taco that I like.  I got two carnitas tacos and one chile verde, and my wife got chicken tacos.  Unfortunately, the carnitas were my least favorite of the bunch; it was soft and wet, with no crispy bits, and not very flavorful.  Other reviews seem to indicate that you can ask for crispy ends, which might help, but good carnitas should have crispy bits throughout, and of course taste good.  

The other disappointment was that they put tomatoes and lettuce on the taco, which just isn't authentic to me.  A good taco should have a little onions and cilantro and maybe some hot sauce and a squeeze of lime.

That said, the chile verde and chicken were excellent.  The chile verde was really tasty, as was the chicken, and the chicken was relatively tender, which isn't always easy to get.  The other good things were the portion size and the service.  I was absolutely full after two of my three tacos.  They definitely don't skimp, and the staff is really friendly.

Overall, I thought it was OK, and I might go back to try their burritos, but I'd be more likely to try somewhere else entirely.
author: Perry T.

description:
I've been to many, many, many burrito places and I must say this place is a staple in Bay Area Burrito history.  I just moved from SF but I probably ate here 2-3x /week .  I only have 1 complaint/suggestion, but I'll talk about that in a little bit.  
So what makes this place different from any other burrito place.  I don't know, but I like it.  I have to say the carnitas is very good, it shreds well and its a little crispy.  They don't shred the cheese, they put a couple of slices on the tortilla and melt it in a steamer.  Oh yeah, the rice tastes very authentic, like the kind my mom makes.  Not like steamed rice with ketchup in it.  Thats all I can think of.  You really just have to try it.  

My suggestion, it would be nice to have more hot sauces. or a better one.  That's all.  Now la Vic's in San Jose has the hands down Greatest sauce ever! If you're from San Jose you know that already and I'm stating the obvious. The Orange Sauce!
author: Robert S.

description:
I love Gordo's. Reminds me of bein' back home in the avenues. I'm out in San Jose for work, school and life in general, but whenever I go back home HOME, I pick up a Gordo's quesadilla, regardless if I just ate or not. 

I haven't found any places that grill their quesadillas with oil to get that lightly crispy, greasy goodness. 

I get the flour quesadilla with carnitas, rice, tomatoes, sour cream, guac, salsa, jalapenos and hot sauce. ORDER THIS. TRUST ME. THE UNIVERSE WILLS IT.

When you order a quesadilla, they don't ask you if you want rice or jalapenos in it, so you gotta make sure they hear you.

The carnitas there is fuckin' good. Has a nice texture and crust from roasting, a good bit of fat, and great overall flavor. Best carnitas in SF and better than anything I've found in SJ. 

Chile Verde is pretty good too, especially if you like saucy stuff. 

If you want a small snack, get a Gordo cup... it's like a mini-mexican rice bowl.

Burritos are good, but not what I come for.
author: David L.

description:
What can I say? Of course I am aware that there are nasty burrito wars going on in SF, and I certainly am not above straying to other camps to sample their wares, but I am a Gordo's man, born and bred.

Back in the days it was chicken quesadillas, but that was the era when I was afraid of most ingredients (and I wore Smurfs glasses). Now, it's all about the super carnitas burrito (no, I don't wear those glasses anymore - sadly).

Good ingredients, tangy hot sauce, piles of jalapenos, and fresh marinated pork combine to create a delicious mixture that is far more than the sum of its parts, and of course the size is enough to feed a small family for a week. I tend to prefer this OG location to the nearby spot on Geary, although the Geary Gordo's has more space for seating so if you are with 3-4 friends it's probably better. Veggies beware: the rice is cooked with a chicken stock; all the better for us meat lovers.

Whenever I have friends visiting SF I bring them through Gordo's to sample a proper San Francisco burrito. We can always use more foot soldiers to spread the gospel of Gordo!
author: Richard N.

description:
We don't go anywhere else, but here for their boiled chicken super burrito with everything + hot sauce. No other place has good chicken like this. Tastes homemade and really fresh.

Their salsa (tomatoes) is nothing fancy; it's very plain actually, but I don't mind it in my burrito cause it tastes fresh.

I don't know about the other meats and their other stuff.
5 stars for the boiled chicken super burrito, but I have to minus a star for poor seating :(

Parking is hard to find

We travel from 20 minutes away and come here on average 2-3x a month :)
author: Jennifer C.

description:
If anyone opened a burrito place within 30 blocks of this place, it would be out of business in 3 to 4 months tops.
I have had some bad burritos over the years, but this one is the top of the list.
This place is a joke, they have green water they call guacamole, they put a thimble full of meat, I said salsa, I could not taste it at any point.
I herd the guy in front of me say "extra meat, extra cheese, extra salsa, no guacamole.
I did not realize there was nothing on the burrito at all to start with.
He paid $10.00 for his, I paid $7.00 and some change, and got nothing.
I have been in the food business, I'm positive if there was anyone thinking of doing a burrito place in the Richmond, Gordo would not be a threat.
In fact I would open on the same block, just to take all the dissatisfied customers.
 If I was ten years younger, I would take this place down myself.
Theirs just no excuse for bad quality.
author: Aaron K.

description:
if you need a quick burrito fix, the prices aren't bad, and every thing is made fresh.

this is my first place i went to get a burrito and i still go back their.
author: Seaera T.

description:
This place Rocks and Rolls...... get it !

But seriously, I go here all the time as its close to home and easy in and out food. Great quality and consistent as hell. 

Cheers,

E
author: H Edward C.

description: Super salty carnitas. Just not that tasty compared to all the awesome, cheap taquerias in SF. Doesn't even compare to Taqueria Cancun.
author: Jimmy B.

description: Been in this area a lot and finally gave this place a try.  Got 2 tacos,  and ordered a side of guac, which I apparently didn't need since they asked to put it on the taco anyways.  Nice and quick, wouldn't mind coming back
author: Phil J.

description: I've been coming to this one for a long time. I'll drive an extra 5 minutes to go to this location. Burritos are made nicely. Only drawback to Gordos is that they don't give out condiment like other taquerias do but the food is still tasty.
author: Jae Young S.

description: The carnitas is awesome! Don't waste your time with any of the other meats. This is definitely my "go to" burrito.
author: Jared A.

description:
My buddy from Philly loves this place and he's picky as shit about food.  In fact, when I went back to college, he made be bring one for him on the plane, then he ate the shit out of it.  "Glorious!" he cried, with a full mouth.

I have fond memories of going to Gordo's with my pops and then getting a movie at Cinema Video (which later turned into a Curves, which are everywhere by the way, I'm pretty sure it's a cult :(...), and then getting a grilled chicken super burrito and being unable to finish it.  Nowadays, I am a man, no longer a boy, and can put away a super and a corn quesadilla, ah....fully realized decadence.  Moving on, this place has the best vegetarian burrito I've tasted.  I have no idea why.  No idea why rice, pinto beans, hot sauce, and the fixin's make it so good with out the meat, but they do.  It's perplexing.  When I'm trying to save money, I hit up a veggie burrito from here after I go surfing and drift into a pleasant food coma.  Glorious.
author: Ricky R.

description:
The burritos are good, but that's all I've ordered. I can't remember a time I've been here when the place isn't crowded with people, sometimes overflowing out into the street. The reason for this being a combination of the good quality of the burritos and the cramped conditions inside the place. 

There only two gripes I have is that unlike most burrito places they charge for the chips(wich aren't even that good anyway), and people order non-standard things not on the menu that some of the guys there don't understand and consequently hold up the line. If you are reading this and are one of those people... CALL IT IN!
author: Nate S.

description: A great little spot; very fast, easy, and delicious. An amazing beef burrito with real, flavorful, non gristly meat. And if spicy is your thing which it is mine on occasion, add the green hot sauce, perfect heat and spice. Good size for a decent price, worth checking out.
author: Mike M.

description:
I grew up on Gordo's. This place is quick, inexpensive, filling, and delicious. The burritos are fabulous and I like to get some rice and beans to go, just to have on hand for a quick lunch. 

The people at Gordo's are really nice. Sometimes a bit tired when the line is out the door and they have people shouting at them, but nice all the same. 

Advice:
1. Be polite. They will be much more willing to listen to your "no beans" or "extra hot sauce" request if you're not being a jerk. 

2. If you do have special requests, SPEAK UP! they will start putting on everything if you don't say something.

Good luck, eat well.
author: Emily E.

description: I've been here a couple times with a friend who lives near by.  They make a decent burrito but nothing to go crazy over.  One thing I do appreciate is they make sure all ingredients span the entire burrito, rather than pockets of each ingredient haphazardly thrown around the tortilla.
author: Sage S.

description:
Aww... memories of my high school years! I love gordos. I use to go pretty frequently back in my high school years. It's the best burrito and quesadilla I ever had!

I love how you just point at what you want in your burrito. My usual is broiled chicken quesadilla with rice, tomatoes, guac. and sour cream. YUM!! I'm craving for some right now. The food is fast and cheap! I can't wait until I'm back in the city for some gordos!!
author: Flora W.

description: The rolling of the tortilla wasn't an issue for me. My burrito did not come apart. My issue is with the meat itself, which was entirely too salty. I was able to get through half of my burrito, but toward the end the meat was too hard and salty to finish and I had to remove it. The rest of the burrito was fine, but I wish they had put the guac and sour cream along the same direction as the rice and beans. It doesn't make sense to scoop it in the opposite direction, thereby leaving gaps. Overall this place was okay, but it did not hit the spot for me. Maybe I'm too loyal to my other taqueria.  The staff were okay; I had to ask them to repeat things twice because I couldn't understand what they were mumbling.
author: k h.

description: This was one of the first places that made me fall in love with the Burrito.  During the high school years, it was affordable, a quick hot meal, and filled you up.  I've gone back just to remind myself of those days.  Its still the same.  Super Burrito, spinach wrap, cheese, black beans, broiled chicken, guac, hot salsa and no sour cream.  I usually get my Gordos fix at this location although I've eaten at all the other ones.  Not all Gordos are the same, ones made her is not soggy.  The parking here is treacherous.
author: S F.

description: LOVE their quesdillas :) uber yummy... if u want a good burrito, Taquerias in the mission is where u should go!
author: linda L.

description: Growing up in the Richmond District, this was a weekly destination for my friends and I. Twelve years later I still visit Gordo every time I'm in the area.
author: Asaf A.

description: Really good place to come for during lunch break. Line isnt terrible, but their prices i would say are decent. The steak super burrito is a wee bit dry, other than that. super good.
author: Tommy N.

description:
I have probably eaten more than a billion burritos in my lifetime, so I love me my taquerias. 

Gordo is cheap, quick, filling. I never order meat, because I've been sorely dissapointed with the pollo asada and carnitas, but as long as you stuff it with rice, beans, salsa, more salsa, quacamole and cheese, you're golden.

I will NEVER for the life of me understand why almost every taqueria in the city STEAMS tortillas. I hate that, and my Mexicana momma would scoff if she knew. 

4stars if they start using fire, and add some spices to the meat.
author: Vicky V.

description: I didnt even get halfway thru my burritto and I ran to the bathroom to throw up! The server was rude and didnt even put cheese on the damn thing. Never ever ever will I ever eat another "gordos" anything!
author: tia j.

description:
The Mission has great taquerias.  The problems with the Mission however, are 1, if you live in the Richmond or anywhere else in the city, it's a major pain in the ass to go all the way to the Mission just to get a friggen burrito, and 2, the filthy, filthy hipsters/yuppies/same thing. Gordo's is great because it offers a cheap ($6.50 FOR A CARNITAS BURRITO OMG) without the journey or the aforementioned hipsters. Service is lightning fast. Provided you know what you want and your money is ready, you can walk in and out before the door you walked through has closed. My point is, Gordo's has great burritos for it's cost, time taken to get there, and overall flavor. The Gordo's on Clement is also more friendly than Geary's. Another thing is, the place is TINY. The guys behind the counter look pretty cramped. There's seating for about 10 on a counter. No tables. Doesn't matter though. The first thing you notice walking in here can be one of two things:

A. The place itself.

OR

B. The freaky painting of half to two thirds-naked Mayan people discovering what is modern day Mexico City.

Crazy  I know.

But what about the burritos themselves? Well, kids, they're great. wonderful even. The downside is that they lack a selection of lengua and cabeza. Oh well.
author: Evan B.

description: The absolute worst carnitas burrito I have ever had! The meat was INEDIBLE! Hard, burnt, too salty. Such a bummer! To top it off the guys at the counter sucked. Not that I'm expecting great service at a burrito shop, but come on guys...calling me a "pinche culero" cause he had to reach in the fridge to get me to-go salsa for my chips?  With so many choices of great burrito places, this place should be ashamed of itself.
author: Michael T.

description:
The Good:
Carnitas or Grilled Chicked Super Burrito + guac and hot sauce - My perfect burrito, period.  Meat, rice, beans, cheese, and steamed tortilla are all good.  I like how it sticks to the roof of my mouth.  The guac and hot sauce gives it just enough moisture since I don't get the tomatoes (pico de galo).
Flour Quesadilla - They grill it perfectly.  They let you put anything in it, even rice.  Awesome.
Price - Sure they charge extra for guac and sour cream even on a super burrito, but since i don't like sour cream it comes out cheaper.

The Decent:
Carne Asada - Just ok.  Can find better at other places.

The Bad:
Parking - Might have to circle a few times if you don't want to pay the meter.  Depends on the time of day.
author: Derk C.

description: Best burritos in town!! Love this place! Usually stop by to get some food on lunch break at least once a week.Very affordable,great portion sizes,have awesome spicy salsas.Friendly staff!We've been eating at Gordo's for the past 7 years!
author: Tatiane B.

description: Not my favorite burrito EVER, but very good.  This is my go-to burrito joint as it is on my way home. Very fast and friendly service.
author: Paul M.

description: Killer burritos at an awesome price.  Sometimes a touch saltier than I'd like but overall, awesome place!  The line is always out the door during lunch rush but way worth the wait.
author: Melissa W.

description:
Big fan of taqueria food for lunch! 

What can i say about Gordos that hasn't already been said many times over?

Wish they weren't so skimpy with the guac and sour cream. Ditto the rice and meat. But hell, easy for me to say, not my money! Not like they're hurting for business!

I've been going to Gordos since the early 80s, they started me i guess you can say on Mexican food, especially the burrito. Tried expanding my horizons as i grew up, frequented on the Mission district Taquerias. Then invaded LA and San Diego next and sampled what they offered in Mexican. 

Moved back to the hood about 10 years ago and started going to Gordos again and you know what, i like Gordos. I think its the flavor of their rice. Maybe the salsa too. Whatever it is that makes a Gordos burrito different from the ones served elsewhere, i like it . Its distinctive, flavorful, well-built (doesn't fall apart easily-CRUCIAL to a burrito!)

So yeah, go to a Gordos if you haven't yet. I do recommend the place. 

ps- hopefully the owners are reading my review: PLEASSE, PRETTY PLEASE.....don't be skimpy with the ingridients:)
author: will l.

description: My favorite here are the quesadillas- tortillas are very nicely grilled on the flat grill to a crisp with yummy cheese included, then loaded up with meat of choice and lots of condiments- salsa, hot sauce, guac, sour cream on demand.  I love the carnitas filling in particular, really nice and chewy with excellent spicy flavor.  Most people order burritos so I wanted to highlight the under-appreciated quesedilla!!  Enjoy!
author: S H.

description: I love Gordo!  Whenever I don't feel like trying to figure out something to make I go to get a super carnitas burrito. So tasty and delicious.  Add the sour cream and guacamole, totally worth it.
author: Caitlin B.

description: I've been here three times now and every time the food is whatever. The staff was friendly, depending on the day. The burrito was just OK. You shouldn't have to go to the Mission to get good Mexican food.
author: Tiffany J.

description: I love their pico de gallo! It's the best Mexican food outside of the Mission district.
author: Christina L.

description: If you want a burrito that tastes decent, is made fast, and is also incredibly cheap, come to Gordo. It's not the "BEST. BURRITO. EVER." but at $4.95 you're definitely getting more than your money's worth. And it's not really a place meant to eating in, which is just fine because I would always want to  eat a giant burrito at home in front of the t.v. anyway.
author: Raymond P.

description: I know that Gordo is not a hip Mission taqueria, but I still think that the Gordo burrito is one of the best in San Francisco.
author: Raphael R.

description: I've always wondered why people found Gordo's Taqueria in the range of 5 stars? After living in the area, it occurred to me that it was the only decent taqueria in the richmond district. 5 star rating? Yeah, for a 1-mile radius. For San Francisco, not even close. Go eat at Pancho Villa, Cancun, or Farolito.
author: KGB R.

description:
What's better than cheap mexican food? Cheap, generous, quality mexican food right around the corner from your house!

Do It.
author: Aubree B.

description:
Gordo's is one of my favorite "greasy" taquerias.  I say greasy because that's one genre of taquerias that can really hit the spot when you are in the mood.  The reason why they are so good is because its hard to find a good greasy quesadilla.  They grill their flour tortilla with enough oil so that the wrapping becomes brown and crusty.  This is essential to create that light crunchy flavor.  

Other places grill it, but with not enough oil or not long enough, so there's no browning.
author: Carmen A.

description: I always order carnitas tacos and love them. They put a generous amount of meat on it. The place is very small so I usually order take out. Staff is nice. Will go back!
author: MS K.

description: This place is pretty damn good. I wouldn't drive across town to go here or take two buses (like I do for La Taqueria) but it is damn good. I really like the broiled chicken burrito and their quesadillas. All the workers are friendly and very professional. I dig the operation.
author: Nick H.

description: I have to admit, when I first moved to the Richmond I had a little obsession with Gordo, I really am not the biggest fan on their burrito's (Mission burritos win hands down for me) but the quesadillas are the best I have ever had. It's walking distance from my house, which is seriously dangerous. I haven't eaten there in a while I really had to cut back.. they were that addicting. Eater beware you may be sucked in to the Gordo vortex of yumminess.
author: Danielle K.

description: For a Taqueria in the Richmond district I'll have to give this 4 stars.  While it's not the best place to get a burrito in the city, it is one of the best choices in the Richmond.   I grew up with this location and it's still going strong.  What can I say?  They're really consistent.  Every time I go there my food has been the same which is a good thing to me.  If you're looking at a neighborhood stand point you can't compare it to places in the mission.  That's like trying to get a good Hamburger in Chinatown.  There's another Gordo's on Geary that's bigger with seating I prefer this smaller one as I always take it to go.
author: Terrence L.

description: The reason I'm giving Gordo's four stars is not because their burritos are amazing (although they are pretty damn good) its because you can get a carnitas super burrito for 5 bucks! what a deal! i think el farolito's burritos are a smidge better, but Gordo's is pretty damn close. It's a can't miss, hang over cure. MMMM.
author: Sandi V.

description: I always hit up this place when I come home from southern california. This is my Saturday joint. If not this one, I go to the one on Geary. Gordo plate, half carnitas half steak, refried beans with everything. Guacamole and chips on the side. My friends and I used to eat this in high school. Go off campus during lunch to grab a burrito and grab some Starbucks. I took my big sis here as well, she enjoyed it and said she'd going again. In her words it was " crackin' "
author: Jessica L.

description:
HANDs DOWN the BEST BURRITOs I HAVE EVER TASTED.

I HAVE HEARD the BEST BURRITOs are FOUND in the MISSION or in OTHER AREAs of SF, but these PEOPLE JUST DON'T KNOW WHAT THEY are TALKING ABOUT.  I READ 1 REVIEW KNOCKING GORDOs for HAVING a LONG LINE.  HELLO!, that MEANs the PLACE is GOOD!

The SECRET WEAPON GORDOs has OVER EVERY OTHER TAQUERIA is their HEAVENLY & 1 of a KIND GREEN HOT SAUCE \ SALSA.

Yes OTHER TAQUERIAs, LIKE THOSE FOUND in the MISSION et al, have GREAT BURRITOs c/ of their QUAILITY & UNIQUE INGREDIENTs,

but WHETHER or NOT YOU AGREE w/ me about GORDO NO ONE can ARGUE w/ me WHEN I SAY THAT NOTHING TASTEs LIKE GORDOs; NOTHING COMEs CLOSE.
author: AHAB D.

description:
in a city with so many great burrito joints and taquerias, there are bound to be a few bottom feeders. gordo's is one of the latter. anybody who has had the pleasure of eating at a real taqueria like el toro in the mission will recognize gordo's as a poor substitute right off the bat.

burritos here are tiny, loosely wrapped (to the point of falling apart), with dry beans and even dryer meat. a small patch of cilantro in the middle passes for "salsa," apparently, in gordo parlance.

chips and salsa are always extra, so if you get a burrito to go, your plastic bag looks awfully lonely with a 5-inch long burrito and nothing else in it.

i recently moved from north beach to the inner richmond, and even in the heart of the city's italian neighborhood, you had more decent mexican options than you do out here.

avoid gordo's like the plague. save yourself both money and anguish and head over the hill to 17th and valencia where authentic food in healthy portions is served.
author: john p.

description:
this location WAS my go2 after-work, lazy-ass, need-to-eat-now place...but that has all changed after today.  let's just say that i took 3 years of spanish in HS and though i can't read, write, or speak..i know me some spanglish when i hear it!!!!

the tortilla-heater guy: whachu lie?
me: uh..(thinking not so hungry) a regular pollo please
the beans guy: wha kina beans?
me: black please
the tortilla guy: you waana suupa?
me: no thanks
the tortilla guy: chee i toll you he cheet

WTF?!?!
i have been regularin' this spot for over 4 years and how and why i have been coming here more than chino's on balboa escapes me.  there the tortilla guy is actually funny (why does the guy heating the tortillas gotta be the funny one any how?) and all the staff there are friendly.

fuck you Paco!  i ain't cheap! and...
http://i7.photobucket.com/albums/y270/oudist/192635883414.jpg
as of today i am no longer supporting your gold-front-cap fetish beeyoch!
author: omar b.

description:
like the name, they serve fat/big servings
these burritos are really good
my favorite right now is the chicken burrito
one thing that gets me is they will ask you what you want on it
black or pinto beans?
salsa, hot sauce?
gaucamole, sour cream?
rice?

i dont know which one costs extra.  they ask all of this all at once
i just say put everything because i hate thinking
i'm guessing they charge me on the sour cream but they dont tell you
sneaky are they? yes
but this place is good and very fast.  

i highly suggest you take it to go because they dont have tables.
just chairs and a counter along the window and wall.  
other than that, its goood
author: Jonathan P.

description: I have a love/hate relationship with this place. I used to live right by this place and it was always convenient and tasty. In the end, I decided that Gordo made me gordo.
author: Janae L.

description: Here's the thing about Gordo's and i think I know b/c I've been eating here for like 15 years. The one on clement and 22nd (or 23rd?) is like soooooo much better that the one on geary or the one in the sunset. I am totally not sure why. I mean, it looks, acts and smells the same, but I just don't truly get that wonderfully satisfied "i just ate a gordo super burrito" feeling that i get from the other two. Trust me, go to the one on clement. The parking sucks and there is usually a line, but the trade off in taste more than makes up for it.
author: Brian C.

description: Fellow Yelper Justin B. introduced me to the Super Spinach Carnitas w Hot and its worth a trip to San Francisco from the East Bay to come again...and again...and again.  The only place I'd go to more often in the city is Pizza Orgazmica.  Parking sucks, finding a place to sit sucks if they're busy, but the food is soooo worth it.
author: Max F.

description: You get the same ass service at any Gordo's or may be it is just me? But hmm..it seems like they just want you to get your food, tell them what you want on it, pay, and get the fuck out of their faces. But their burrito is good! But it is always wrapped in the most ugly way ever.
author: Janet Z.

description: Great burritos, at a decent price! Parking sucks.
author: Kevo M.

description:
I think I can sum up Gordo's... 

My boyfriend's roommate had sweatshirts made with the Gordo's logo on them. He gave them out as Christmas presents. 

This place is great, especially after a hangover. Eat here often and you will be GORDO. There is only one thing to get, in my opinion: tomato quesadilla with carnitas, everything except beans, extra hot sauce. OK, if you don't like carnitas, (there is something wrong with you) just make sure you get some form of meat on a quesadilla. That's the key. It's not a traditional quesadilla, it is grilled and crispy with melted cheese, then filled and rolled. 

Gordo's should deliver. I think the guy who made the sweatshirts would deliver for free, provided he was given a quesadilla every hour, on the hour.
author: Milan M.

description:
ok burrito...bit sloppy and low on meat but that must be san francisco style...rice ? why rice? and the dude who makes the burrito should be a bit more exited that i 'm spending my $ in his place...
overall 31/2 stars
author: Dupa B.

description: The best burrito is the city. Maybe even in the world!!! Love this place!
author: Nicole L.

description: Fast, cheap and two blocks away...what could be better? Gordos burritos aren't the best I've had in the city, but they're perfect for a quick fix. They're cheap and and the super burritos will leave you filled, happy and satisfied. My favorite part of a good burrito is the pico de gallo...mas por favor! The service is friendly and fast, a good neighborhood place for a quick in-and-out...also a great place to practicar tu espanol con los locales. Gordos will never live up to the spicy, zingy, zesty Mexican you'll find in the mission but it'll satisfy your craving nonetheless.
author: Kristin R.

description: What is a quesadilla? Go to your run-of-the-mill Mexican food place, and it is a flour tortilla filled with cheese and meat (in some cases). Go to a slightly better Mexican food establishment and it comes with guacamole, sour cream and pico de gallo in neatly displayed portions alongside. Go to Gordo and it is STUFFED with sour cream and guacamole, the already superior cheese oozing out of the lightly browned tortilla as if it wants to climb into your mouth. Cheers to Gordo for making this SoCal Mexican food connoisseur snarf down a quesadilla like a wolf, completely oblivious to manners or any other distractions, to the point where she ingested some of the foil it was wrapped in. Cheers to you.
author: Katie T.

description: I write this review as a true lover of burritos. I have eaten burritos all over the world. This "chain". especially the one on Clement St and 24th Ave, provides the best tasting, least expensive burritos in the world. Even the beloved "Mission St" burritos don't compare to the quality of the Gordo experience. There are many options to choose from and all of the food is super fresh. I recommend the Super boiled chicken burrito con todos (add sour cream and guac., plus jalapenos). Just do it!
author: R G.

description: The carne asada has a good flavor and its nice and soft. The menu is limited, only tacos,quesadillas, and burritos. I had the tacos and they fill you up. The only problem is they need  REAL hot sauce. I understand that for many in that particular area it may be too spicy, but come on people...otherwise if I am in the area I will be stopping by to have a taco...oh yeah and their burritos are very fulfilling. One problem- sour cream and guacamole are extra in a super burrito? Isnt the super burrito suppose to include these two ingredients for free?
author: Jessica M.

description: A decent burrito at a fair price. I ordered a chicken burrito that unfortunatley lacked the typical Mexican flavors that I was looking for. They must have ran out of oregano and cumin...
author: Dario S.

description: This is the original Gordo's.  Ah, the memories.  While some burrito purists will tell you that a steamed tortilla is sacrilege, I'm willing to let it slide.  The burritos here are pretty awesome.  I usually go with either grilled chicken or beef.  I also dig the quesadillas here.  Yes, they're dripping with oil, but that's what makes them so flaky.  As far as neighborhood burrito joints go, Gordo's is near the top of my list.
author: Tony L.

description: Don't hate on El Gordito.  I grew up in the Richmond District and this is the burrito I was nurtured with to help me grow into a strong boy.  Their ingredients run through my blood.  I usually go for the super boiled chicken with everything (which includes quac, crema, and hot sauce).  All the og triple og's will know that the pollo asado didn't come into play until the early nineties, so this is my CLASSIC combo.  Occasionally I cant resist the super beef... EXTRA CARNE.  I have also been known to go all out and order super carnitas AND beef.  Quesadillas are bomb too.  By the way, this is the best location.  Sometimes the other Gordo's are inconsistent and seem tasteless, especially Albany.. they have no idea what they're doing in there.  I know that this is Mexican food por los gringos, but Gordo's warms my heart and the nostalgia brings a tear to my eye.  VIVA EL GORDO!
author: Ray S.

description:
A few months ago, I was so hooked on this place that I went 8 days in a row. Yes, 8 days. I do indeed have a burrito problem, and I may need counseling.  I've probably been here 50 times or so in the past year, and I'll just say this place is consistently good. From the time I double-park my car with the flashers on, to the time I drive away, it never takes more than 5 minutes. It's fast food at it's best.

For my super burrito with grilled chicken and cheese and all the fixin's, I pay $5.42. And it's always $5.42 (unlike some burrito places that make up the price as they go).

The ingredients are good - again, not the best, but they're consistently above average.

The place is pretty cramped so I've always taken my burritos to go.

The staff is nice and it's always the same 4-5 guys behind the counter.

I'd have a hard time saying this is the "best" burrito in San Francisco, but it's too good pass up.
author: Steve M.

description: Good burrito, good price, good eating. Great place when you want a quick meal. No place in the city that I venture to for a burrito when I'm just lookin to eat.
author: Erik S.

description: My bf brought me here because he claims that this is the best burrito place in SF and that any SFer would be proud that I ate here. When I first walked in, it looked like a typical taqueria you would see in the South Bay. But when I looked at the prices, I was wow-ed! How can a super burrito be less than $6?! Impossible! The skins definitely tasted different than South Bay skins. They melt the cheese on the thin, chewy skin, which was a unique concept. The meat was just mediocre, but the skin really was something. If only they had a hole in the wall taqueria in the South Bay...
author: Ede S.

description:
being from san diego i was always weary of northern california mexican food. i mean doesn't anyone around here use french fries as a burrito filler or as a replacement for nachos?! hopefully someone will get on that and make a killing up here. but that's besides the point.

living a few blocks away easily made this my go to burrito place. steamed tortillas still weird me out a little, but after facing the fear, they're quite pleasant. the carne asada, grilled chicken, and carnitas all have very good flavor and sadly, i've even started getting used to the beans and rice. now if they were to sub beans and rice for french fries i'd add a floppity gillion stars to this review.. if only
author: Eric A.

description: I looooove this place. While I haven't found a place in SF with amazing enchiladas this place has one of my favorite carnitas burritos. It's always quick and yummy.  The portions go from big to super so I usually don't finish my whole burrito. They do have tacos and plates, plus they have vegetarian options. I also love that they have tomato, spinach or whole wheat tortillas if that's what you prefer. They're not always the nicest but they always get the job done and you watch them prepare your burrito which is good too.
author: jessica k.

description: Dirt cheap and pretty good, I'm usually waiting in line with a bunch of dudes. Haha. Oh, and I live a block away from this place. Sweet.
author: Jane C.

description: Location, date and time of visit: Inner Sunset 9th Ave, Friday, May 10, 5PM.  hope your boss reads this checker girl.  The experience was crap, food overcooked, salty with chinsy portions.  The cashier was a truck sized poorly beached surly Latina $&#%. I was dying of thirst the rest of the night as the carnitas that the servers recommended over everything was was pure salt. I ordered two super plates, chicken and pork, and the portions couldn't  have been any smaller, even the rice and beans.  The salsa was NOT freshly made but canned stuff.  I threw a dollar in the tip jar in front of the checker and she saw it.  i felt sorry they were slow with only three customers for dinner on a Friday night as all the other eateries around them were filling up or had lines. There were more employees than customers in this dive.  After  was given my take-outs! I paid and tipped.  I saw two at least two dozen little pre-packed bags of tortilla chips on the counter, pointed at them and asked the latina checker girl $&#% if I could have a bag or pay for a bag of the hard crispy tortilla chips.  She says "they are already in the meal box."  Well guess what, they were soft,  not chips.  She either doesn't know the diff or just wanted to deny me chips, even after I tipped them and offered to pay for them.  She was the worst and the food was bad, one star for you!!!
author: Martin F.

description: I've been coming here over 20 years and if I've had a bad experience, I certainly can't remember it. Love the boiled chicken tacos with extra green sauce. And don't miss the quesadillas.
author: Mary C.

description: i recently went to gordos and got  piece of plastic inside the middle of the burrito  i would recommend not eating at  gordos
author: Jeremy P.

description: This place is iconic. It takes a couple of trips to fully understand the assembly line, but the burritos are fantastic
author: Lanier G.

description: BEST BURRITOS I HAVE EVER TASTED. I love burritos and I have gone around town looking for a good place that has a good price and a good burrito. Gordos is the one. The burritos are better than any other place i've been to. Even if the burritos were twenty bucks each i would buy them. there is limited seating so expect to stand or take it home but it is totally work it. The only problem is that the times that I have been there, there have been a few hobos lurking around. So i usually go with a group of friends just to be on the safe side.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Best burrito place in SF outside of the Mission. This Gordo's (there is another one on 9th Ave.) is sort of a hole in the wall place, but it has great food, respectable prices, and good service. I wouldn't plan to eat there though because they only have a couple seats.
author: Teresa S.

description:
instant heaven - just order this:

flour quesadilla with carnitas - add pinto beans, a little rice, sour cream, guacamole, and hot sauce.

so good.
i'm crying right now thinking about it.
author: Ayy C.

description: Granted, Gordo's burritos lean a little on the gringo side. Knowing that, this is still one of my favorite burrito joints--outside of the Mission of course... Also try getting a combination of different meats, chile verde + al pastor, mmmmmm.
author: Luke B.

description:
gordos is another staple of the outer richmond. in my opinion, they have the 2nd best burrito in sf behind El farolito, but i still give it a 10. 

-super carnitas burrito with EXTRA hot sauce ftw!
author: Thomas L.

description: Skip the burrito and order a carnitas quesadilla. You will not be sorry.
author: Kelly S.

description: For once the burrito isn't so large that I throw half of it away.  The perfect size.  I love it that I can come in here, order my burrito and it's customized the way I like it from the beans to the salsa or guac, to the meats to whatever else you want.  Everything comes out super fast, it's cheap and though there isn't a ton of seating if you are lucky you can grab a seat, otherwise do what  I do and take it to go. I liked every bite that I took.  YUMMY!
author: Denise B.

description: Like this place.  Employees are very friendly and service is quick!
author: Ellie S.

description: Big huge melty meaty manly beefy burritos. Perfect after surfing.
author: Alex H.

description: i lived in the richmond district for many years, so when someone mentions gordo taqueria i'm always down to go.  The price is cheap and the food is good.  These mouth-watering burritos are fat and are sure to fill you up.
author: Cedric F.

description: The food here really depends on the mood of the person who is making and the person themselves. I had gone here several times and gotten a fairly small super burrito. When they had hired a new guy all the staff were always happy, talking amongst themselves and the size and the flavor of the burritos improved.
author: M C.

description: This is great neighborhood spot in the Richmond.  Super burrito with carnitas, can't go wrong.  The quesadillas are good also, but they're kinda small.  Not your quesadilla from Taco Bell, it's almost like a grilled burrito.  They pan fry a flour or corn tortilla with cheese, then you add whatever you want, rice, beans, meat, salsa, etc.  Oh, and if you wanna get crazy, upon request, get two kinds of meat in your burrito or quesadilla.  The price is also reasonable too.  Parking can be a pain though, you might have to take a couple of laps around Clement to find a spot.  But it is worth it!
author: Shane Y.

description:
I have been stopping by here off and on for the last decade.  The food quality and value for the buck, and portion size,  has been consistent  - excellent! - throughout all this time.  

The burritos and plate meals (carnitas is my favorite!)  are values one cannot let go.  It hits the spot pretty much anytime of the day.  Parking can be a bit tough at times, but should not stop you from stopping by, especially for items to go.  There are a few seats, but most people stop by for take out.
author: Antonio E.

description:
I don't get it with Gordo's.  I find it's just bland. 

Lat time I was there and the chap asks me what I want.  "Regular carnitas burrito, refried beans with extra avocado" says I full of anticipation.

So he gets the tortilla, warms it,  and asks "Super?"
"No, regular please."
He dips into the pollo and says "Chicken?". 
"Erm, no.  Carnitas please...".
"Pinto beans?"
"No, refried."
"Salsa?"
"Yes please."
And as he rolling it up, badly, I have to remind him for the extra avocado.
And the burrito in question wasn't so much rolled up as crammed into foil.... Sad little burrito with dry rice.  Luckily the carnitas was burnt so there was some flavour.

It doesn't quell the craving for Mexican food.  Just makes me want to go and get a real burrito.
author: Andy M.

description: The place is clean. Only thing that sucks is that there is no salsa bar. Other than the the food is good and the guys who run the place are nice .
author: Opie D.

description:
awww!  i broke his heart =*(  

As I ordered my burrito, ingredient by ingredient, the burrito man cheerfully asked me, "Spicy?!?!"  Having a very low tolerance for spiciness, I quickly, but nicely said, "Oh no no no!" as I always do in restaurants.  He nodded his head to the side with a small pout on his face and sadly rolled up my burrito =(  I was shocked because I have never seen someone so bummed about not adding an ingredient!  I mean, was it essential to fulfill the Gordo burrito experience???  

I'm sorry burrito man.  Next time I will say yes to the spicy.
author: Eileen M.

description: No fancy chipotle salsa or mesquite grilled meats, but this place has an extremely reliable black bean and rice burrito with a straight-up salsa fresca and guac that can be had four bucks.   Tough to beat.   Meat burritos are OK, but nothing to write home about.  I like this spot on Clement, but the one on 9th is also good.
author: Jim M.

description: Pretty bland but if you're hungry, guess it'll do. Where else in the outer Richmond can I find a burrito place?
author: miriam b.

description: Ah... I will always have a soft spot in my heart for Gordo's.  Great cheap burritos.  I will say this though:  My favorite burrito meat is carnitas, and I always get that.  I've had their other meats, and... um... not so great really.    Their carnitas is the best around though... crispy, salty... mmmmm!  If you're not into carnitas, on the other hand, I'd give it a pass.
author: Matt W.

description: The creepy thing about this Gordos is that they know my order because I go in there so often.  I used to try to change things up a bit by going to the 19th and Geary one, but I have reasons to stay away from that one now.  Now I just change my order. . .there's only so much you can do when you go here at least once a week for your dinner.  It's embarrassing because they know I'm not cooking - ever. . .
author: Godzilla T.

description:
This place gets the job done.  If you like fast, cheap, and good(who doesn't?), you will take a liking to this place.  This is mostly a to-go place.  They have a couple of seats inside, but unless you like to be squished by people waiting in line, it's better to eat outside on the bench.  

The bean and cheese burrito is dirt cheap.
author: Stephen N.

description: Gordo's may not have the most delicious burrito or the most authentic burrito. But it is definitely one of the most consistent places I've been to. I almost always get a grilled chicken burrito with cheese and a little sour cream as extras. I'm always full and satisfied after eating their burritos. The salsa is fresh, the cheese melting in my mouth goodness, the rice cooked perfectly and the chicken full of flavor. On the rare occasion that I venture out my comfort zone, I found their quesadillas crispy and really cheesy. It was pretty greasy, but just grab a few napkins and you should be set. Gordo's is definitely a to go place (very little seating) so don't expect to find seating, especially during the lunch rush hour. It's pretty cheap for the portions they serve. And as one of the very very very few taquerias in the Richmond, it is hella convenient. When I'm craving a burrito and I'm too lazy to go to the Mission (which is pretty much all the time), this Gordo's especially is the best spot to hit up.
author: Amanda K.

description: This was a factor in apartment hunting...how many blocks away am I from Gordos. Who doesn't love a $5 Burrito in 5 minutes. Great for nights when cooking for 30 minutes is that last thing you want to do.The green sauce tops off these well sized burritos, and they even offer different kinds of tortillas: Spinach, whole wheat, and I think even tomato. not too shabby.
author: Christy B.

description: Second only to La Taqueria, in the opinion of this SF native burrito snob. However you will not find a better-priced burrito - you get a lot of carne asada goodness for your money, and everything is made to order. I am  partial to the Clement location, since I went to it first, it is 1 block from my elementary school, and I run into someone I know there about 1 out of every 5 times. Thankfully I haven't noticed much difference among the Gordo'ses(?), so I don't hesitate to go the nearest one when the carne asada burrito craving kicks in.
author: Alexi S.

description:
If only the tortillas were toasted instead of steamed and the guacamole was a bit more flavorful!

Great place for a quick, easy burrito (not many seats here, so it's better for take-out).  They good-naturedly humor my annoying requests for my boyfriend's burritos ("no tomatoes, no guacamole, extra sour cream, and LOTS of hot sauce, please..."), and don't laugh at me for the occasional times I go in with a craving for a plain ol' cheese quesadilla instead of my usual slightly more adult burrito.

Not the best burritos I've ever had, but they're satisfying, and you can't complain about the price and friendly service.
author: Morgan M.

description:
For some reason, I remember reading/hearing that this Gordo's location was not very good (there's one in Berkeley I used to frequent and that was always terrific). Nevertheless, I felt myself drawn to it after a stressful day yesterday because there's not a lot of good mexican in the sunset and that's what i wanted. I was expecting to be underwhelmed, but that was not the case:
I ordered a carnitas burrito with everything and while it wasn't quite as good as some burritos in the Mission, it was very solid. The meat was tender, the flavors weren't muddled, the proportions were even-handed, and the cheese was nice and gooey. I wish they had put a little more guacamole because I couldn't really taste it, but that may be reflective of the type of guacamole they use; it does not look very avocado-y, like something else is mixed in. The size of the burrito was also good: not too huge that it's unfinishable, but also not so small you feel hungry after (and maybe not hungry for the next 12 hours).
Overall, I'm sorry I overlooked Gordo's for so long. It is a great option for the sunset
author: Amanda C.

description:
as expected there will be much debate over the "best mexican food in the bay area" but this is the horse i am riding to glory. gordo is understated and no-frills and the food is off the chain. i've never gotten anything i wouldn't order two of next time. once, while tipsy, i ordered my favorite burrito, inhaled it on the way home and then my stomach promptly rejected it. so, i did the obvious thing and marched back down there and bought another one which stayed firmly lodged in my corpus and sent me to shangri-la. hooray for binge eating!!

affordable and delectable; this is everything i want in a burrito|mexican spot. i am going to have them cater my wedding and then i will get divorced so that i can do it again.

and as for the clowns who complain about the 'service' - give it a rest. it's a cafeteria-model burrito joint, there are no sommeliers, no chefs in white hats and no maitre'ds. you order what you want and you get it and sit down and stuff your face. simple, easy and satisfying.

menu tips for the challenged:
pollo blanco in your burrito
carnitas quesadilla - corn
author: W G.

description:
its alrite... but it aint a burrito from the mission.  they charge extra for guac and cheese, and chips and salsa. 

quasidillas are pretty good, but its like a burgers.  how can you F that up? 

one thing i gotta hand to them are their CORN quasidillas... it's freakin delicious.  it's crunchy on the outside and warm and chewy on the inside.
author: Doug ..

description:
Super with black beans
Why does sour cream cost more
Don't be so cheap guys
author: Tyler L.

description:
I don't care that it's not in the mission.  I don't care about it's "authenticity".  All I care about is the taste and in that category,  Gordo's burritos are average at best.  

How much of a glutton do you take me for?   I'd rather resist my urge for a burrito while in the sunset or richmond than settle for a sub par burrito that costs the same as a good one..
author: Daniel D.

description: Better and quicker service than the Geary location, but not by much.  I opted for the carnitas this time found it to be so-so.  It's not a bad burrito option, but that's mainly because it's really your only option in this part of town.
author: John H.

description: Hands down. Best burrito in SF and NYC where I'm from. My boyfriend is from Veracruz, Mexico and he agrees! Delicious carnitas ! Thanks guys you kick ass
author: Dylan M.

description: Value outweighs the price which uncommon these days! When did you buy a meal and say wow thats it!!  This inexpensive meal is the BOMB!! Yummy and delicious! Large portion it can feed 2 people.
author: BlackNinja N.

description: Only eat the quasidillas. They are deeelish. Grilled extra crispy with the cheese and then the sparse ingredients added later. Yum. But stay away from the burritos, I really really DISLIKE steamed tortillas and the ingredients added are bland and not many choices. Plus it gets more pricey for every thing you add (umm any place in the mission sour cream is included in price!!) But try the simple quasidilla, that is tasty.
author: Alyssa C.

description: During my lunch break, I just had a grilled chicken "quesadilla," which bears little resemblance to an actual quesadilla. What is with this town and its muntant quesadillas? [See my review of Cha Cha Cha.] Anyways, it's a buttered, grilled flour quesadilla folded up with melted cheese, gobs of grilled chicken, and salsa, all for only $3.65. Unless you add guacamole and sour cream, which I did for an extra 90 cents. And also, I found parking right next to the store with 10 minutes left on the meter, which almost makes me want to give Gordo five stars. Oh, and I also made it back to work on time with like 40 minutes of my lunch break left to mess around on the internet and stare out the window.
author: Ben P.

description: Yah.  They've got hella good grub.  Standard taqueria menu. Above-standard taqueria goodness.
author: Beth G.

description: Finally!  A restaurant that has named itself after me!  Its about damn time I get some recognition.  If it was named Gordo y Feo I would seriously have a boner.  Besides the fatty name the super burrito is pretty fatty but nothing special.  I tried the carnitas because they looked really good.  The person making my gordo y Feo burrito grabbed a hand full of carnitas but after chopping it up he only put half the pile of meat into the burrito with 4 scoops of rice.  No wonder people become gordo here.  They stuff your gordo face with carbs.  I'd rather walk to burrito express than drive 15 minutes and spend another 15 minutes trying to find parking.  I'd rather be gordo y lazy.
author: Fatty A.

description: I used to love coming here.  UNTIL...I ate a chicken burrito and got food poisoning.  I was doubled-over for the next three days, swearing off everything Mexican (except Tequila, of course)and anything chicken.  DO NOT EAT HERE...it almost killed me.
author: Jaena G.

description: The burritos are freakin awesome. Best place for fast, cheap, freakin great burritos.
author: Aly L.

description: They named this place Gordos for a reason.  Cause you really round out when you get there.  I love these burriots and I consider myself a burrito connoisseur.  Cheap, fast and amazing!  Do it!
author: Lauren M.

description: Fat burritos with a variety of tortillas including spinach and tomato. Life is simple here - you just tell 'em what you want! The carnitas is good.
author: Jimmy L.

description: I've been eating at Gordo's for as long as I can remember-my mom even ate Gordo's burritos when she was pregnant with me!!  Prices have not really changed over the past 30 years too, and you get a very decent meal with your money.  Of course, Gordo's isn't a "Mission" street taqueria, but when it's within walking distance of your house, it's a great place to grab a burrito or quesadilla.  The food is tasty and they have generous portions, and the taste has been consistent for as long as my memory reaches-easily one of the best things about living in the Richmond district.
author: asia c.

description: Mmmmm... Gordo's burritos are soooooooo good... The locations are really small, so it's best to either take your food to go or go when it's not busy, which is almost never...
author: Lindsey S.

description: I went to this place the other day and I have to admit, it's not that great.  I ordered the carnitas burrito with all the works and parts of the burrito tasted cold and other parts were warm.  Quite a weird clash.  I wish there would be a really awesome burrito place in Richmond district, but this is as close as I can find right now.  There wasn't much flavor in it either.  I still need to try a Mission style burrito.
author: Tim L.

description: I fucking love this place, and even though I can get a way better, way more traditional taco at Pancho Villa's or La Cumbre or.. or..or... in the Mission, I miss living on 26th and Clement for the short walk to Gordo's.  We would house super burritos w/grilled chicken or carnitas, or super quesdillas with the same every week.  We were fatter than we needed to be, but god there's a particular flavor to the Gordo's burritos and quesadillas that can't be found anywhere else.  The quesadillas ended up being my favorite because they're the same size as a burrito, but they grill the tortilla and then fold the insides in thirds so its crunchy and buttery on the outside, with burrito insides.  Incredible.  I miss it.  I must drive my ass out there to remind my mouth how good it is.  And their fountain diet coke was always delish.  The guys were creepy, but I also loved going to see them.
author: Loren R.

description:
am i the only one who doesn't care for gordo's anymore?? 

maybe cuz i've been eating it since i was out of the WOMB and its just.. a burrito. 

yes its cheap. its quick. its not bad, its flavorful.. but I dunno, it's just so.. BLAH! =p 

i think the highlight of this location is its 1 block away from me,  I've seen Robin Williams here on numerous occasions, its a quick ticket to mexican food without having to head to 16th and mission, and if you're in line on a busy night.. theres plenty of cute guys.. alone! ha :)
author: Diana R.

description:
shit! what else is there to say other than burrito?! best of all it's a damn good burrito in "new chinatown"!! 


WHAT!!!!!!!!
author: Kristin Y.

description: cheap and delicious! thats all I need! there chicken quesadillas are amazing!
author: Everrett T.

description: 4 stars for the salsa ... if you like it really hot, their "hot" salsa will fry your taste buds off (either that or the salsa is just too hot to taste) which is fun sometimes. The burritos come large or really really large in a choice of tortilla types.  They make them right in front of you, asking what kind of filling you want and scooping it from the buffet like counter in front of them. Nothing to really go out of the way for, but if you're in the neighborhood I've found it a reliable and tasty standby.
author: J P.

description:
I've spent so many nights grocery-less nights double parked in front of Gordo's on Clement St.  It used to be right around the corner from my house and an absolute god-send when the cash flow was low and the cupboards were bare!
I sometimes wished for more elaborate options but when it really comes down to it what's better than a 5 lb carne asada burrito for $5!
author: Amy C.

description: Great tasting burritos. I live out in the Richmond district and can't always go out to the Mission for a decent burrito, but this place holds me over. It's got a great variety of tortillas; tomato, corn, or spinach. I usually get the  Super Burrito with steak. Runs me about $7.00 and I throw everything in it. It's pretty satisfying and your definitely eating more than you should. The quality has always been consistently good.
author: Wil M.

description: Close and cheap.  For $5.10 - I can get a super bean burrito with quac that will fill me up.  Not the most amazing burrito ever but good enough in the neighborhood and it will fill you up.  For those of us that can't handle the commute to the Mission - this is a great neighborhood place.
author: Anna L.

description: Mmmm... gordos.  I was never big on Mexican food, but God how I love Gordos.  There is something about their super burritos that makes me drool.  I used to live nearly blocks from this place (down the street on 26th).  Now I have to drive from the sunset (don't want to look for parking at their 9th Ave location).  Parking still sucks there too, but man it's worth it.
author: Serge S.

description: A++, I LOVE GORDOS!!!  Fast and cheap.  Try the quesadilla, it's not like the ones you usually eat flat, it's pan fried, and wrapped up with what you want in it.  Eat it when you get it because it's very crispy however, if you leave it out longer, it gets kinda soggy but nonetheless, it's still good!!!
author: Tina L.

description: I walked here all the way from the Haight because my old roommate raved about it.  So far, this is the best burrito I've had in the city outside of the Mission.  The meat tasted fresh, but like every other place I've seen in SF, they didn't grill to order.  The ingredients were quiet hot, and I got beans, rice, guac, sour cream, etc. for about $1 less than I'd pay for a less tasty version over in my neighborhood.
author: Charles C.

description: Awesome burrito spot.  I live down the block a go all the time.  I heard a huge amount of hype before I went so naturally nothing can live up to the legends.  I've had much better burritos in my day but I go here at least once a week and will continue to do so as long as I live nearby.
author: Nate W.

description:
my welcome back to california burito stood up to its expectations and exceeded them.
juicy chicken, soft tortilla, fresh quacamole, and amazing hot sauce.
equiped with a neighborhood know it all who told us stories on the bench while we shoved goodness in our mouths, my visit to Gordo's was complete.
tip- you CAN get the regular size with cheese and goodies on it, don't be fooled by the 3 extra inches of tortilla in the 'super'
author: Helen N.

description: The closest place for me to get my burrito fix.  I usually get the super carne asada with everything on it including extra hot sauce.  4 stars but still doesn't beat the mission.
author: Allison T.

description: The burritos are good.  Most places put way too much rice and the burritos are too dry.  This place didnt it had a nice ratio.  The food was tasty not amazing. The people there were super nice though. There wasnt enough seating but its not really a sit down place so i just went home and ate it there which was fine.  I wanted to eat it the whole car ride home!
author: Hannah S.

description: This place is the shit. The best Taqueria in town. I have been coming here since I was in 4th grade. Employees are cool, decent price, and the food is the bomb diggity. Try the quesadilla, and the Gordo cup which is a small rice cup with what ever topping you like for $1.95. Its like a hidden menu only the locals know. I remember costing $1.10 when I first started going there as young juvenile. I personally like this Gordo than than all the other ones. I guess it just has a special place in my heart.
author: tai n.

description: This is the best taqueria around!  The food is delish, fast and cheap!  Enough said- just go there!
author: Heather S.

description: One order of the super grilled chicken burrito with sour cream & guacamole pleeeeaaassseeeee~!!!!!!
author: Juli S.

description:
gordo burritos are the bomb diggity!

 i grew up eating this stuff since my days at alamo elementary school down the street. the clement location is the best. i love the sound of the steam as they warm your tortilla and the sight of carnitas being diced on a wooden block in front of you. everything about this place reminds me of my childhood and days of overeating. spectacular! 

oh yeah, i also like that gordo means "fat" in spanish! ha!
author: Dave N.

description: This was pretty darn good for being a burrito place that I stummbled upon while running an errand in the richmond.  I had a chicken burrito which they made right in front of me, the flavor was great but I wish they would have made it with a little more care so it didn't fall apart when I ate it but besides that I can't complain.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
I seriously CRAVE Gordo's, and could it it at least 5 times a week and not get sick of it! 

My first Gordo expirience was also my first memory of San Francisco- my boyfriend and I had driven across country in a FOCUS from New York to our supposed new home in Petaluma. We pulled up to the address, took one look at it, and turned around, deciding we were not suited for living in a crack house with an attached meth-lab. So we drove to San Francisco, and came across Gordo's (my boyfriend had previously lived in San Francisco, so we had  that working to our advantage). Famished, and completely ready to get out of the sardine can in which we had arrived, we parked, walked the block, ordered, and........

BEST BURRITO EVER!!! 

they steam the tortillas and they're chewy and gooey and absolutely delicious. i usually ask for extra hot sauce b/c its usually not spicy enough for me, but thats just me. all in all, gordo's was a beautiful introduction to this wonderful city for me!!
author: denise d.

description: I lived in the Richmond D for over 20 years and Gordo's always treated me right. Super boiled chicken with everything, and make sure to get the tasty hot sauce. There are other locations but they aren't as good, so make sure to hit up the one on 24th and Clement.
author: Alex F.

description: Gordo's is the place to go when you want a killer burrito (for all of us non-mission-living folks!)  They have big-a** burritos with all kinds of good fillings.  The great part is that your burrito is made right in front of you, totally custom.  Pink beans or black? Salsa?  Boiled chicken or grilled? You will be full after this one!
author: Jorie p.

description: Best carnitas quesadilla in the city...i add rice...so it like having a fried burrito!! yummy!!
author: Steph S.

description: Great Burritos! we go about once a week and they're awesome! Still, there are better joints in the city.
author: Jeremy M.

description: I love this place. When I moved back from LA this was the first place I went. For the the price and the quality/quantity this one of the best for SF. But of course everyone loves their neighborhood Taqueria.
author: Ryan G.

description: did not like, I am mexican and this was kinda of insulting...the rice was okay but everything else was salty, dry and the salsa was tasteless, it was cheap but not worth the $5...
author: Ribec F.

description: I got a carnitas super burrito with black beans, rice, cheese, and sour cream.  It was pretty good.  I also got the chips and guacamole and it was excellent.  The service was fast and the seating was basic.  Parking in this area can be hard to come by, but you can park at the parking lot next door ($2.50 every half hour) and be in, have your burrito, and get out while paying just $2.50 for parking.  That's a heck of a deal in San Francisco!
author: Tom C.

description: I've loved going to Gordo's for years. Excellent burritos, for a decent price. The dudes that work there know their shit.
author: Zoeboe D.

description: Gordo's burritos are awesome, but the platos are even better. they come with all the ingredients of a burrito, with a few flour tortillas, they are cheaper, and more food!
author: osmahn k.

description:
sometimes at night, i dream about the green sauce that they put on their burritos.


they are incomparable
and i am considering moving up north solely for gordos.
author: katie j.

description: Gordo's hands down is the best burrito...in the Richmond District. You can get a real big monstrosity of a burrito that includes guacamole, sour cream, salsa, cheese, rice, beans, and your choice of meat. Out of the two in the Richmond I would say this is the better one. I go here because they melt your cheese better when they steam your tortilla. The other one on Geary just pumps the steamer once or twice and the cheese doesn't melt at all. My place to go when I want something filling.
author: Michael L.

description: Fantastic Mexican food, dirt cheap. Wide variety of toppings and meats available, and everything my wife and I tried was delicious. Not a lot of seating available, but that can't be expected from a taqueria. When you can get food this great for Taco Bell prices, it's hard to feel like I won't be back.
author: Evan and Christine J.

description: My favorite place to get quick and inexpensive Mexican food! I usually get a plate which includes, Mexican rice, your choice of black, pinto of refried beans, salsa, sour cream, guacamole, and your choice of meet. So good! And it's enough food for two meals. They also accept credit cards which is great.
author: Lauren C.

description: I love the burritos here! Service is pretty decent even when there's a line (and there's almost always one when I go).
author: Rachael E.

description:
The burritos here taste great!  There was no line and they quickly made my burrito.  I ordered the Carne Asada Super Burrito, which consists of; carne asada meat, cheese, rice, pinto beans, and salsa.  I love pinto beans so that was perfect.  The burrito was huge and cheap too!  They lost a star for not giving out complimentary chips and salsa.  I have said this before about a previous Burrito spot, it is not a true Mexican joint if they don't serve complimentary chips and salsa. Also, the TV they have is so small!  I don't really care about the TV but it's just an observation.  Other than that, the burrito was great, the chips and salsa (that I paid extra for) was great.  Overall I give Gordo's 4 stars.

4 Stars:
-Big portions
-Tastes great
-Cheap
-Fast Service
-No complimentary chips and salsa
-They didn't have the ingredients of each type of burrito (regular vs. super, etc.) listed on the menu.  So I just asked, but it would be easier if I could have read what was in each type of burrito.
author: Michelle K.

description: Yummy!!!! That's the best word to describe Gordo's. Seriously that's it. In the all of my years going there I have NEVER EVER been disappointed. I like the Clement Location the best, just because it was the original. but they are all so Goooood!!
author: N H.

description: Cheapest, fastest, bestest eats on Clement street.
author: Andrew S.

description: The best burritos I have ever had in my life. Hands down. I had great memories of this place from my younger years, and after taking a hiatus from the Bay Area for the last six years, I ventured back a week ago. And still incredible. I can't eat the amazing flour tortillas anymore, but  I got the chicken platter, and still got to eat all the delicious ingredients that go in those fantastic tortillas, and wrap them in some warm corn tortillas. My girlfriend, who accompanied me on this venture, also agreed, saying that her burrito was the tastiest she'd ever had. So. Gordo's. Go. Oh, and I love that even after all these years (not so many in the grand scheme of things, but still....) Gordo's has its same informal, authentic feel, and the cost of the burritos is still so inexpensive. Amazing. I don't know how the other locations are in comparison to this one... but this location is great, and I HIGHLY recommend that you go try a burrito. With guac of course. And spicy sauce, if you're into that sort of thing. And maybe even try bringing your burrito to nearby Baker Beach and eating it there, while watching the waves... like I did the other day. A great afternoon activity. In conclusion: GO!
author: Anna K.

description: i contemplate driving from LA to SF just to eat some Gordo's.  No joke.
author: mike p.

description: They make some of the best burritos in town. Really fresh beans and meat. Price is a little high, but otherwise great!
author: Julia P.
