description: I love Gordo's burritos, especially the carnitas. The great thing about them is that they are consistent. I know what I'm going to get every time. The reason for their deliciousness is how full of flavor the rice and beans are. I might have to go get one right now.
author: Mark L.

description: I love this place and go there all the time. Low prices and excellent food! Never a long wait in line and their guacamole is fabulous!
author: Darrin A.

description: To say that I grew up on their boiled chicken burritos, carnitas quesadillas, or carne asada tacos would be no exaggeration.  I have been going to Gordo's for the past 15 years and nothing has changed.  There's usually little wait, they prepare your food in minutes, and they have reasonable prices.  In fact, I don't think their prices have gone up in many years.  I must admit that I have not been a one taqueira guy, I have ventured off to try just about every recommended burrito and taco place on yelp.  One place may have better guac, another better carne, but when it comes down to it, Gordos is dependable, hits the spot, and the service is always consistent!
author: J. S.

description:
I have been going to Gordo's since high school.  Yes, that was a long time ago...20+ years.  I moved away and when I came back, it was still here...and I was thrilled.  I eat at  Gordo's at least once a week, more than once a week if the SUPER burrito I happen to get has an excessive amount of sour cream and hot sauce while lures me back for another one the next day.  It's a different kind of burrito than you get in the mission and maybe it's not as authentic as the ones you get there BUT (1) the Mission is really really far and (2) does something have to be "authentic" to taste good?

Don't forget about the quesadillas, especially with carnitas, which also rock.

And, yes, sometimes when I can't decide whether to get that super burrito or quesadilla...I don't draw straws...I just get both!
author: Janet W.

description: Si, super carne asada con todo. I never thought it possible to have a burrito that could exceed the supreme excellence of Albany's Gordo's. This is, of course, until I came across the original taqueria on 24th and Clement. WOW!
author: John H.

description: Soooo good.  My husband and I crave Gordo's take out all the time.  Try the quesadilla with carnitas, beans, and hot sauce...you won't be disappointed!  My husband loves the carne asado super burritos.  They are huge!  His only complaint was there wasn't enough meat, so we started asking for extra meat.  For only a dollar more he is super happy with the extra meat!  Good deal for the amount of food you get.  We love everything about this place!
author: Courtney D.

description: excellent basic taqueria, probably one of my favorites.  has the best quessadilla (carnitas) I have ever had.  Good value for the money, always been satisfied and full.
author: Dave n.

description: just as good as the infamous taquerias in the mission.  a tasty place to get your mexican fix in the richmond.
author: Sheri N.

description: I love this place!  The food is super cheap and really good.  I think this is the best gordos in the city.  At lunch the line can creep out the door, but they move people fast, except for the damn people that order for the whole office.
author: ivy c.

description: Please don't flame me, but I lived nearby this place for a year,and I think it beats the hell out of any burrito from the mission.  Not only does it beat the hell out of any other taqueria, it takes them apart stone by stone and then sows the ground with salt so that nothing may grow there ever again..but that's just my opinion.
author: Brian C.

description: Hands down the best burrito in San Francisco. And the service is perfect. No other burrito joint compares. (Here I'll add that Chipotle is in a different league b/c they started in Denver and helped me survive many a hung-over mornings at DU, so they'll always be my true love). The best choice is to mix the boiled chicken and carnitas together and add pinto beans, lite rice, guac, two salsa and tomatoes. Cures hunger for up to 8 hours!
author: Mark P.

description:
Not sure if it is because I was born and raised 15 minutes away from the Mexican border or having a Mexican grandma make the most delicious food ever, but this place isn't that great.  
Firstly, it is pretty overpriced for what it is.  The burritos aren't that big and the carne asada (which is usually what I order) isn't that flavorful.  And what the heck is up with putting a slice of cheese in a burrito!  
Secondly, they are extremely stingy on their ingredients.  I asked for extra salsa and the guy barely added any.  Along with the salsa, they fill their burritos up with beans, and rice (which is good), but only add a smidgen of meat.
This place is not bad, but it definitely is not better than good.
author: pat j.

description: Decent burritos joint in my area. I have had many burrito dinners in succession just like Ozzie...
author: Ringo L.

description: Best straight up burrito in SF... "Straight up" meaning no fancy veggies, tofu, etc... they do have whole wheat, spinach, and tomato tortillas which are a nice healthy twist. Just a good ol' classic burrito.
author: Adam G.

description: The carnitas super burrito is YUMMY!  One of my favorite taquerias.  Great to grab a lunch and take it to go to the nearby Land's End hiking trail, and eat lunch overlooking the GG Bridge and Pacific Ocean!
author: K V.

description: Their burritos aren't really good. They make it really fast though! I don't think this place is authentic enough for me. Not enough flavor, a bit bland, seems a bit Americanized? so to speak. I'd say it's comparable to Chipotle. Then again, some people love Chipotle. But if you want a real good burrito, go to the Mission. You won't be disappointed, that's forsure.
author: Howie T.

description: Best burritos ever. I just moved out of SF and I am missing this place a lot.
author: Agnieszka T.

description: funny that all the bad reviews are from so'cal people, its nowonder that we hate you. go home. gordo's is bomb og richmond district burritos. take your self back to chile's or the olive garden or whatever. just leave sf.
author: cornelius u.

description: good, fresh tasty ingredients, very fast service and low prices.  My only quibble is that the burrito wrapper is extremely GUMMY.  bring a toothbrush and a mirror because your teeth will be coated with pieces of white dough.
author: Alexandra D.

description: The style of ordering can be intimidating if you've never stepped foot in this place. Don't get me wrong, the staff is super friendly and efficient. The customers (which are obviously regulars) are also very fast and efficient! hehehe, so If you're not sure what you want you better go wait in the back of the line and not piss anyone off! Its a trip to watch how fast they make their burritos and its great that they do everything right there in front of you. Have your $ ready because as soon as you pay you're handed your order and boom you better move outta the way for the continuous flow of people coming in behind you! This place is very small and there aren't any tables to lounge at. A bench was found outside where my boyfriend and I shared our beast of a burrito. We got the carnitas super burrito and let me tell you that pork was juicy! The parts of the burrito that were just rice and beans (you get to pick between black and pinto) were a lil dry so I would suggest asking for some salsa verde (if you can handle the spice) to top everything off before they roll it up. I didn't see any salsitas lying around on the counter anywhere so your only option might be to get it inside the burrito.  For $5 two people were fully satisfied off of one burrito. talk about some amazingly cheap eats!!!
author: Niki P.

description: One of the cheapest places where you can get a nice super burrito to go. My personal favorites are the Grilled Chicken Burritos or the Gordo plates. Compared to other Gordo locations, this place is a bit small with a few seats. If you plan to eat in with some friends I recommend going to the Sunset or the Geary location.
author: A R.

description: I was sitting with my buddies one day having lunch in LA and I asked the question.  Has anyone ever had a GORDO burrito?  My friend David, looked at me and with much enthusiasm..  said GORDOs!  His eyes were wide and mouth was watering with drool.  I said to him, so you understand?!  He immediately nodded like some kind of common secret was just revealed.  Now my other friend Tony was seeing  this and had a look of confusion on his face and was like.. umm okay.  I don't get it.  We told him to go to San Francisco, go to Gordo and you will understand.  He did just that. One day we were again having lunch in LA and Tony said "GORDOs!!!!"  He understood.  We've converted many people to being a GORDO lover and if you're scratching you heard in confusion.. go to one of the few locations up in the bay area and you will understand too.  I still don't understand one thing... If LA is so close to Mexico, you would think that there would be a better place for a burrito than all the way up in the bay area.  I have yet to find one that can beat out GORDO.  My recommendation.  Don't just try the burrito.  Try the Quesadilla.  Trust me.  It's not what you think it is.
author: John B.

description: I just love Gordo's. I've been coming here since I was a kid and it never disappoints. I admit that I am not a huge fan of Mexican food but the burritos and quesadillas were are simply delicious.
author: Keromi K.

description: I've been going to Gordos since I was like 4 years old - the one on Clement.  I'm now 28 and have lived in another state for the last 5 years, but Gordos is always the FIRST place I go when I visit SF.  No joke - whoever picks me up from the airport KNOWS that my first stop will always be Gordos.  I probably eat there 5-6 times a week when I'm home - sometimes twice in a day!  I'm addicted.  I've literally had dreams where I'm back in the city and I go to Gordo's but it's closed.  I wake up in a cold sweat.  God bless Gordos.  PLEASE come to Seattle!!!!!!!!!!!!  Or else I might have to move back...
author: Denise O.

description: we are having those nights again that  we don't know what to eat or where to go for dinner, so we end up here at gordo's. this is not my first time to have a taste of their appetizing and gratifying regular carnitas with everything on it, and it was another satisfying, fulfilling meal we had. place is small and customers usually have their food to go, but we chowed down our food at the scene for we were so famished. thanks gordo for another delicious meal!
author: Nelle A.

description: BEST burritos!!!! I ride through Richmond at least once a week, and if I'm hungry, I'm stopping at Gordo's.  Food is great, prices cheap, best bang for buck here.
author: Alex L.

description: Decent burritos and great quesadillas.  They're probably the best flour quesadillas I've ever had.  I used to love their burritos, but they have recently began to taste dry to me.
author: Nick H.

description: This is probably the best burrito place in San Francisco. It is amazing. I go there about once a week and I love them. Their food is amazing and you can get a great meal for under $10. I absolutely love it. Burritos are amazing, tacos are amazing, meat is amazing, everything is amazing. If you are looking for a good burrito gordo is the place to go.
author: Jeffrey A.

description: I really like Gordo Taqueria.  It is cheap and good quality and the people are pretty friendly.  I've been to pretty much every one of their locations and they are very consistent.  My favorite burrito spot in the city and perfect for take out.
author: Glen E.

description: Probably the worst burrito I've had in a long time.  Stopped by there b/c we were catching a movie at the 4 Star Theater and wanted a grab a quick meal.  Dry and flavorless, very disappointing, especially since I had fond memories of Gordo on College Ave in Berkeley.
author: Shin C.

description: Been going here for 25 years and they are always the best burrito in town.  Gotta try the carnitas...yum!
author: Dan J.

description: i live like a block away from this place. awesome burritos! i usually get the super with grilled chicken. it's so good. i highly recommend coming here.
author: Dwigt S.

description: Ok, I gave up pork for years and years after visiting a pig farm way back when.  But, after a mistaken bite into my boyfriend's carnitas burrito when I thought it was chicken....heaven!  I am now an avid Gordos carnitas burrito lover.  Thank you for bringing back the other white meat into my life!
author: Mary H.

description: I love Gordos!!! I have been going here about once a week for two years and have never been disappointed.  Their food is fresh, tasty, fast and affordable.  I highly recommend the chile verde super burrito.
author: Mark N.

description: i used to came here every single week... sometimes 3x/week, when i was in relationship with my ex... when my relationship came to an end, its effecting my relationship with gordo too... i missed the quesadilla though... but i rather go to other gordo place, just to avoid meeting him *sigh..
author: sherly A.

description: ate with shivani. not bad. wheat tortillas eh. price was good. they didnt have chips.
author: Noah K.

description: i lived around the corner from this place for 2 years, oh how i miss it!  i'm very picky about mexican food, especially california's take (i'm from san antonio), but this place did it for me.  i always got the same thing, grilled chicken quesadilla.  i don't know why they fold it into a burrito but that's beside the point, it's DELICIOUS!  best mexican in san francisco, fo shizzle.
author: N L.

description: Nt all Gordos are created equal.  This one rocks!  It is a small shack, but they have a bench out front where you can sit, eat and people watch.  We love to treat ourselves to a super burrito after a nice long Saturday afternoon walk.
author: greg F.

description: I used to go there all the time because the burritos there were off the hook. However, the food quality doesn't taste the same. It seems like some flavor is missing.
author: Jimmy T.

description: This place is one of my local favorites.  I was there today and got myself a carnitas burrito (I'm not brave enough for the SUPER burrito) with black beans.  Their menu is not giantor like other taquerias in SF but what they do have is mighty tasty tacos, burritos, quesadillas. Service is quick and and generally friendly.  Tables for dining in.
author: Jenna Y.

description:
Hands down, the best cheap burrito place outside of the Mission!

I grew up on Gordo Taqueria in Berkeley, and I've always told everyone I know to go there for the best cheap burritos you can find.  They have this awesome little press that melts the cheese right onto the tortilla before filling it with beans, meat, salsa, guac, etc.  It makes any burrito taste better, and I have no idea why every burrito place doesn't have one.  In fact, I've only seen something similar in one other burrito place (and I eat a lot of Mexican food (and yes, I know a burrito isn't actually Mexican, but whatever)).  Calling in orders is a good timesaver (as it can get very busy sometime), and walking in past the line and going straight to the cashier definitely makes you feel like a big man, but you run the very real risk of not getting exactly what you ordered.  So if you aren't in a huge hurry, definitely order right there, and they are totally willing to give you more or less of an ingredient if you just ask.  Gotta love Gordos!
author: Ari B.

description: This place is all  you can ask for from a neighborhood taqueria.  Ok, so you can get slightly better burritos in the mission, but if you live in the richmond, this place is a godsend.  The staff is friendly and its super cheep too.  For like 5 bucks you can get an enormous burrito that will fill you up.  Its great.
author: Daniel P.

description: Gordo's carnitas quesadilla with guacamole, sour cream and hot sauce. (no rice) Say no more.
author: Michelle N.

description: much better than the geary location! got the carnitas burrito and it was yyummyy! the meat wasn't hard and chewy like the other location. the regular size was perfect because i could finish the whole thing without getting a food coma. i will definitely be back.
author: N. M.

description: i could care less about the san diego vs. san francisco burrito war. when i was in san diego all i dreamt, thought, breathed, smelled, desired was gordo burritos and quesadillas and tacos and carnitas. mmmmm. i've never had better carnitas. i've tried other peoples carnitas' and it's no match. i don't want to hear of places that are better... i simply don't care. gordo's is king. everytime i came back from sd, the first place i went to was gordo's. people used to ask me, "do you realize your favorite place is called FAT?" and i brushed them off. you don't understand my friends. get a carnitas quesadilla with hot sauce. heaven. or a carnitas, grilled chicken or broiled chicken super burrito with all the fixin's. i love you gordo's... i once even had a dream that i went here for a burrito and you ran out of carnitas. wait, i called that a dream? no it was a nightmare. i'm so glad they are in the east bay too. mmmm... i'm hungry.
author: Erin D.

description: for a semi "chain" this place is delicious. the richmond location is by far my favorite...there is usually easy parking and it's never overly crowded...which the irving location can be.  the burritos are the perfect size, the price is right and the guacamole is top notch. if you aren't a mission burrito snob i think gordos will fulfill all your expectations.
author: Claire M.

description: dirty. and the food is microwaved and greasy and lardy! i would NOT feed this to my child.
author: Parya B.

description: reasonably priced. decent size. quality fresh.  good for if you're in that neighborhood.
author: Yelper S.
